It definitely gave me that festive cheer and might I add, after seeing their black diamonds collection, I wouldn't mind coming back!  Best of luck to their newest location here in the valley!

"I never worry about diets. The only carrots that interest me are the number you get in a diamond." 
― Mae West

I'm so fancy... you already know! Went with one of my bests and thought it would be a great idea for her to come with coz she's looking for a ring for her upcoming engagement, and I knew she wouldn't pass up champagne. 

The ladies and gents of Robbins Brothers where very helpful and I liked the store, Sasha was a sweetheart, and her colleague Tonya, (I think) was so informative telling us the differences of clear, loose, cushion, and canary diamonds. Loved one diamond ring that was a 1.5 carat and it was a clear and because of the light it could trick you into thinking there was a canary in it but it was just the light, loved it!

As for the event, Thank you Hailey for the great sweets, the yummy hot chocolate, and the festive atmosphere, an awesome event to be at! Oh and I got to meet a fellow yelper, Meagan B. who was a doll, sorry I was a little awkward but I'd love to see you at other elite events in the future. Good times, and great people!

My +1 and I had so so so much fun at this event. Seriously what is better than dressing up nice, drinking champagne, chocolate fondue and trying on diamond rings???

This was my fist elite event to attend and I must say it is definitely not my last.

Also, the staff at Robbins Brothers are just unbelievable. We were having fun with them and they all were so kind in letting us try on a million different rings. I will now recommend everyone to this store when they are in the market for a ring. You just cant beat the service!

This event combined all my favorite things:

-- Fun friends
-- Shiny things
-- Decadent desserts
-- Champagne
-- Yelp Schwag + FREE JEWELRY

Soo...I couldn't possibly be LESS in the market for an engagement ring, but the Robbins Brothers staff (and our lady in charge, Hailey) still made my friend and me feel most welcome as we tried on reasonable rings...and some that were perhaps a bit excessive :)

We learned about diamond classifications, colors, and weights (did you know a 1 karat diamond can actually be a bit less than a full karat?? TRUTH!

Also a fun truth is that we were gifted a super shiny and sparkly tennis bracelet (plus other cool stuff) just for attending.  Highly recommend this place, even if only to get fun ideas for non-engagement jewelry (they had a decent selection of bracelets, earrings, and birthstone jewelry).

I was totally impressed with the selection and sparkle in this store! Every style imaginable and more! Plus, the associates were knowledgeable and patient with us even if we asked "dumb" questions. Frieda was amazing!! This was a fun event to bring a friend to look at rings or just to enjoy visiting a new business. My guest was so excited that she won one of the giveaway prizes, and the gift bags with goodies were impressive (beautiful crystal bracelet). I would definitely recommend this store to any friend looking for an engagement ring (or other jewelry). Great work on Robbins Borthers part for putting everything together and making us feel welcome! And thanks to Hailey for coordinating it!!

Diamonds to the front, Diamonds the back, Diamonds to the left, Diamonds to the right!! OOOHHHH MMMMYYYY So much bling!

Had the great pleasure of attending the Elite Event: Diamonds & Dessert At Robbins Brothers.  This is truly any girls dream come true, to able to try everything in the store, while being handed flutes of sparkling bubbles to drink.    And if by chance you needed to give your hands a break from carrying all that bling on your finger, we were able to stop by the delish dessert counter with a flowing chocolate fountain with fruits and candies to dip.

It was great seeing everyone and I must admit I did have fun trying on the rings, I'm a huge sucker for bling! 

Thank you Robbins Brothers for having us and big thank you to Hailey and Yelp for putting together this fun Elite event for us!

Sparkly things!!  Don't things that glitter and shine just make you so happy?

Huge thank you to the Robbins Brothers and Yelp for a fun event out in Scottsdale.  At the door we were greeted with flutes of champagne and light bites.  At the back of the store there was a big spread of every kind of dessert you could imagine and a cute little drink bar where you could get a cup rimmed with frosting and sprinkles, yum!

My favorite part of the event was of course looking at all the gorgeous bling.  I also really loved learning about diamonds and the "4 C's" that rate a diamond's quality.  It was also interesting to see how just a change in the overhead lights a store uses can vastly alter the way a diamond appears.  So you have to be careful and look at your diamond in "white" or "natural" light!  I'm not a diamond type of girl myself, but now I know what to look for if I'm ever looking to buy one for someone else.

And who can leave out the amazing gift bags!  Seriously, Robbins Brothers, you spoil us too much.  The faux diamond bracelet in there was so cool and I'm looking forward to sporting that soon.

The only thing I was sad about was that I posted my photos too late to be considered for the Instagram contest.  I was just too caught up in all the neat things to do/see there!  Next time I know to take my photos and post them immediately!!

This event was so beautiful! After countless drive bus, and perhaps In n Out pit stops I finally got to go into Robbins Brothers. 

I usually avoid jewelry stores that specialize in engagement rings, because well.... I'm not engaged. But this really opened my eyes to things I liked! I attended this event and worked with Kim, she was amazing. They get to know you and all your likes and dislikes. They even ask about your lifestyle and while all the rings are there, which is overwhelming, they narrow down the choices and you find that perfect one.

I also like that you can really customize every ring in the store. Short on cash for that big rock? No problem. You can put a different stone in the diamonds place, and come back later and upgrade it!

The sweets station was my favorite. The chocolate fountain was top notch. I also won a swag bag after guessing a close number in a contest with a bowl full of fake diamonds. 

If I ever get engaged, the boy can come here!

Great variety of vendors and the perfect holiday shopping pop-up for the dudes in your life. They've got beard oil, bike accessories, leather goods, cuff links, socks, reclaimed wood decor, and more. I picked up some unique gifts for my husband and father-in-law, all while sipping a Tele-porter. Can't beat it!

A pop-up shop for men...genius! My husband was like a kid in a candy store with an Unknown beer in hand and wifie carrying his shopping bags trying to keep up. Are we in some sort of alternate world?!?

From Panthers shirts to lamps made out of gears, there was a little something for every guy. Great place to pick up stocking stuffers for that special guy in your life. Unknown was an ideal venue to house this pop-up. I hope to see more of these guy inspired shops in the future.

I am loving the recent surge of pop-up markets, and this one definitely "hit the spot." 

Being able to grab a beer while you shop? Check. 
Awesome, off-beat products? Check. 
Super friendly owners?  Check. 

My only critique was the venue was a little small, which limited the number of vendors. I would have loved to spend more time there and had a little more variety to choose from. But I did love what was there!
Great popcorn! Very fresh and many flavors. Something for everyone. Wish they had a sampler platter.

LOVE this place! The nostalgia is real! The 50's-60's tunes makes it a feel good place. 
The service was friendly and fast. 
I had the double burger California style combo which came with fries and a drink. The food was fresh- made to order. The burger was delicious. The burger was cooked perfectly, crispy on the edges from the flat top. It was almost like having bacon on my burger! Amazing! 
I also ordered the Hawaiian concrete- custard with pineapples, strawberries, coconut and macadamia nuts all mixed up like a blizzard topped with whipped cream and a cherry on top!

Definitely worth giving a try.

My absolute fav place for burgers and fries. I love the thin patties (get a double or triple if you like thick burgers) and the skinny fries are the best fries anywhere!  Love the seasoning and the fry sauce. Yum. Yum. Yum.
Great service and very clean. But the burgers are average and I didn't care for the skinny fries - you don't taste the potato. I may come back to try the custard.

This was our first time trying this new burger joint in Concord Mills. We decided to take our lunch to go, because most of the tables were occupied. Short line, long wait, but they were busy so it wasn't too bad. There was a woman clearing table, and she overheard me reading Yelp reviews to my Wife. One of them mentioned the fry sauce, and the woman told us that it was similar to 1000 island dressing. I ordered a bacon & cheese double steakburger, as it was (mustard, pickles & onions). My Wife ordered a single steakburger plain with bacon. We split a fries and onion rings too. When we got home and opened the bag the onion rings were missing. I guess we should have eaten there. The burgers were ok, mine almost tasted like it had been pan fried a little too long. I didn't care for the consistency of the burger either, Alina thought it was fine. The fries are really thin, and were good when they were hot. Because we got ours to go, they had cooled off by the time we got to them (after sampling a few in the car) and they weren't very good anymore. Lunch for 2 (without beverages) was $17, kind of expensive for so-so burgers. 

Overall, we probably wouldn't go back again. There are too many better choices in the area, including 5 Guys and Steak & Shake.

The good: the food is very good, the frozen custard is incredible. The employees are always friendly and professional.
The bad: the drive thru is so slow..... Plan on being a while, even if you are the only car there.
The bottom line: great family dining at a reasonable price..... Just save fuel and go inside.

Eh. Just, eh.  Freddy's is trying soooo hard to be Steak and Shake, from the 50's motif and furniture, the black, white, and red color scheme, the nostalgia on the walls, and menu.

It's counter service instead of being waited on by a server.  Service speed wasn't fast but not terrible.  Its real short coming is the burger.  I don't need to be able to read through the party, meaning it doesn't have to be so thin.  It gets burned that way.  Had two burgers and each was burned.  They carry Pepsi products (vomit).  It is clean but that may be due to its newness.

I will stick to Steak and Shake.

The food is good. The music is nice. There's a wide selection of Greek and Italian favorites. The Baklava is spectacular.

Of note from our meal was the Gyro platter, Moussaka and the Calzone. Kid size spaghetti and meatball was a hit too.

This was our first visit to Mike's since he reopened in his new location.  As always. his food was excellent and the service was both good and friendly.  Mike has always served some of the best food in the valley.  We will come back often

We never got the chance to visit the old location, but heard from Mike's past...food would be excellent.  And it definitely was!  Would loved to had a glass of wine with our dinner, but was not an option.  Hopefully he will get a license soon...we will definitely be back!

Tonight  I took my folks to  Mikes.  I had fish, mom had Gyros Platter with Lemon soup, and pops had Chicken Marsala with wedding soup.  Everything (oh, yes...everything) was outstanding...including our waiter.  Mike himself stopped by to check on us and even got my pops to smile which is some task.  We topped the night with cannoli which was perfect. .  I think we have a new favorite.

MIKE IS BACK! OPA!

The West Side has a NEW "GEM" in Town!

Mike is a well known Chef in this area and is well known for his Greek and Italian Cuisine. 

This restaurant prepares well made food. Sauces and many meats prepared in house. The front of the menu says they are a Bakery too so possibly some of the breads might be prepared in house too.

I've been to his last restaurant many times and this new restaurant offers a bigger more varied  menu, wait staff, roomy comfortable booths in a nice atmosphere.

I came in for lunch and ordered the Salmon Souvlaki Pita. The pita came with my choice of Greek Fries or Greek Salad so I went with Salad. Out comes a big fresh salad and soon after my pita arrives. The pita bread seemed like it was made to order as it was so fresh and hot and the filling was tasty. My husband had the house made sausage with peppers and onions. The sandwich was baked with bubbly mozzarella cheese. 

We were checked on several times by our server and by Mike.

We will stop in for dinner next time as I remember the Myconos Chicken was pretty darn tasty.

Portions are large and pricing is reasonable.

They serve breakfast (8am), lunch and dinner 7 days a week.

Give Mike's a try when your in the area!

Great new location on the north side of Bell.  Dave our server was attentive, there at every turn. Becky raved on the Greek salad, my Caesar was fresh, and flavorful.  Becky ordered the calzone, having to take half home it was so big.  I had the Involtini di Polo alla Vsldostana  stuffed chicken breast with mozzarella, ricotta,  fontina, feta, fresh spinach, sun dried tomatoes, topped with Marsalla wine mushroom sauce.  Excellent!

Chef Marc Sgrizzi has once again outdone himself. Heartbroken that my beloved Parma had closed (I had a 4x/week habit for a time), I was eager to be one of the first patrons at Chef Marc's new Trattoria. Just entering the restaurant sets the mood. He's turned an overly curtained and tassled Indian venue into an elegant room - sophisticated, welcoming, warm, with the perfect lighting for a romantic date night. The menu has gotten an upgrade, though Chef says he's still deciding what stays and what goes. While you'll find traditional fare - alfredo, manicotti, ravioli - these all feature Marc's fresh made pasta and unrivaled Sunday sauce. He definitely has offerings for the more sophisticated - linguine Nero with squid ink pasta and artichoke hearts with a kick. I tried the linguine and clams and my date went with the veal parmesan which took up the entire plate for about half the price you'd find elsewhere. It was one of these "there's no way I'm finishing this whole thing" that turned into "I can't believe I ate the whole thing, but it was so delicious and now I can't move." The service is, as expected, amazing, featuring some of the old Parma crew that made dining with them feel like being at home with a (functional) Italian family. 

Chef Marc himself chatted with us a bit about the menu and we were enraptured by his descriptions of how he dreams up and executes each dish. The passion he exudes consumes you and, before I knew it, I was cheering him on as he described each step of his craft. "Yeah, sauteed chanterelles, then what? Oh yeah, a little white wine and garlic? Fresh pasta? Hell YES." 

While I'll miss the deli and the little retail store that unfailingly had my obscure Italian ingredients for my pathetically short-falling home cooking, I look forward to how this venture develops. 

So glad Chef Marc is back!

We had an excellent dinner at Chef Marc's Trattoria on the weekend.  My wife had
the Veal Chop parmesan and a green salad with artichokes.  Her entree was outstanding,
tender and well seasoned, the salad was lightly seasoned with fresh vegetables, olives, etc.
The portions were large and the prices were very reasonable.  The restaurant is quite
pretty with an outdoor patio (which would be nice in the summer).  I had pasta with  a hearty
Bolognese sauce, which reminded me of pastas in Rome.  The large beet salad was refreshing and substantial.  Garlic bread was served almost immediately, warm and very tasty.
This venue is prettier then Chef Marc's former restaurant, Parma.  The room is warm,
with comfortable tables, chairs and discreet lighting.  The room has large view windows,
and tables are private and set apart.  Service was very good. Next time we will try some
seafood and pasta and save room for desert.  We were glad to see a neighborhood,
elegant, non chain restaurant, that takes food seriously and treats the customers with
respect.  Every one was welcoming.  We will be taking family and friends out to dinner
here in future, because we can trust that the ingredients are fresh, pasta is home made, and
just can't wait to come back to sample more.  Menu was pretty extensive.

Everything was amazing!!!!! From the second we walked in to the second we left. We felt welcomed and appreciated the entire time. It felt like being invited into a family members house for dinner. I remember going to the old place on tenaya and loved it so much. Loved Parma as well but this place feelings like the old days. Chef made me the classic A la Dean Martin, a staple of the old Marc's. Speaking of, they even have the old "M" that used to be at the old place. Everything is delicious and everything is can't miss. Me and my family will follow Chef Marc where ever he goes, but I do hope this place will be very successful and a staple of Las Vegas.

Last night I came to dinner here w/ a friend of mine who has known Chef Marc for many years. Chef Marc is a personable and talented man who has absolute passion for cooking and happiness of his customers.

Better if you can believe it, than what I recall of his former restaurant Parma, I had the pleasure of tasting Marc's delicious Italian cuisine at his brand new restaurant located in a small strip center @ SW corner of Sahara & Durango, behind Lakeside Charlies.

Shared appetizers were delicious...
*Mozzarella en Carozza--Fresh mozzarella wedged in thin bread then fried, w/ tasty marinara dipping sauce.

**Cold Seafood Salad--Wild shrimp, mussels, calamari, imported provolone, hot cherry peppers.

My entree was delicious...Barbershop Bone-in Chicken Scarpariello...roasted w/ Italian sausage over polenta. A bit of a challenge w/ bone-in, but managed to act like a surgeon and savored the perfectly cooked juicy, tender organic chicken meat. Sausage had a nice tangy flavor. Polenta was very good. Green beans were al dente and excellent.

Dessert was delicious...Creme Brulee that was torched tableside by Tracy, 1 of Marc's friendly servers. Sweet & flavorful w/ fresh berries.

Nicely decorated upscale restaurant w/ cool wall decor, nice lighting & furnishings, and the sounds of enjoyable Ratpack background music that was a classy touch around this time of what would be Frank Sinatra's 100th birthday.

Service was impeccable by our friendly server Lino, originally from Italy. And once again, Chef Marc is a true restaurant entrepreneur w/ passion and talent for his Italian cuisine. I highly recommend dining here!

See 8 photos below...

YELP 300 CHALLENGE 2015: #296

It was great to see Chef Marc back in the kitchen. We have enjoyed his cooking since his restaurant on Lake Mead Blvd. The new trattoria is a comfortable size dining room with a variety of wall photos. We look forward to the outdoor patio as weather permits. 

We were seated  promptly upon entry which was 5 minutes in advance of our reservation. We did request a change of table as the one near the door was drafty when the door opened. 
Service was friendly and timely with water and cocktail orders. Our waiter asked our preference of wines and said he would choose. That was a surprising twist. He returned with a Riesling and Cabernet Sauvigon. Both were to our satisfaction.

Our starter was the Burrata salad. A beautiful and delicious piece of mozzarella, micro greens and sliced cherry tomatoes with balsamic. 

For entries it was the Chicken Piccata and a combination of Chicken and Shrimp Fra Diavolo.
The Chicken Picatta was served with al dente green beans and lemon wine sauce with capers. The 3 large pieces of chicken were tender and juicy.
The Chicken and Shrimp Fra Diavolo consisted of 3 pieces of chicken and 3 large shrimps. An excellent flavor from the light tomato sauce, capers, red and green bell peppers and mushrooms. The chicken and shrimp were perfectly cooked and delicious. 
Both entrees were large enough for a take home second meal.

Although the trattoria does not have a deli like Parma, you can still buy fresh pasta and sauce to take home.

Welcome back Chef Marc

This place just dropped in my book. Caesar  salad was soggy.  With asked for bolonase and there was hardly any meat   Sent it back added maybe a drop more of meat and charged an extra $5.00 
That was crazy and now I remember why I stopped going to Parma. 
Too bad was looking forward to a new neighborhood place to eat.

I went there for their opening night.  Their beers were generally good and very interesting, with some unique varieties such as sours that you don't see too often.  I was disappointed they didn't offer a flight option but they did let me taste a few so I could decide what I wanted.  The food was also decent, but not amazing.  I was really excited about the meatballs stuffed with cheese, but sadly they must have forgotten to stuff it with cheese :(  The service was the part that was most lacking. I called the meatball issue to the attention of the waitress but she didn't seem concerned and just walked off, not to return again.   I would've been ok if they would have just brought some cheese to put on top at least.  She also forgot one of our drink orders we had to remind her of, then she still brought the wrong thing even though she had written down the original order.We had to get her attention many times before she could finally bring the check. It took about 30 min from when we first asked her to finally get it.  She seemed to have trouble using the machine to check us out and there was only one machine that could be used at a time.  She didn't apologize at all (not about the meatballs lacking cheese or about the delays or forgotten drink orders) until the very end when she finally produced the check and she took the meatballs off of it.  I know it was their opening day though so they are probably still working out some kinks, so I still hope to go back and see how they do.

I came with a group of four for their grand opening. The beers ranged in style from a cider to a stout and everything in between. The cider was decent, not sweet but a bit tart and sour. I really enjoyed the dark star beer, I would have to say it was my favorite one of the night. They have some unique beers available and I'm excited to see what else they will have available in the future. Since this was their first day of service being open to the public-I felt that service was okay. Our server wasn't super knowledgeable about the beers and even though she wrote our orders down-she kept forgetting what we ordered. The food menu looks good-my friends ordered wings and they looked tasty-they even have a ghost pepper sauce for their wings that I can't wait to try! I will come back and give Insurrection another try as I always love to support local breweries-but it will probably not be for awhile in order to give them time to work on their execution and service.

I came here 1 week after it opened.  The beers were good, adventurous, over all well done.  I'm an IPA fan and they did those well.  I loved the half pours because they gave me the option to try a large amount of the beer list without having too much.  They do 1/2 pours instead of flights.  So don't be disappointed if there are no flights, because the 1/2 pours are perfect....you can try so much more!  It wasn't overly crowded and the service was on point.  The cheese and meat board was a nice size and you can choose your own.  The wings were also pretty good.  The place is the start to something wonderful.  

There is street parking only, so take it when you can get it!  Also, although the street sign says East Railroad Street, those of us from the South Hills know this road as Washington Pike coming from Bridgeville and Washington Ave coming from Carnegie.  I'm not really sure why the township renamed this road East Railroad Street because it parallels West Railroad Street.  As a person in the map making field....this is really odd.  You don't usually have east & west road names parallel to each other.   So just be aware, this is on the main drag.

Just happened to be in Montreal staying in an Airbnb condo just steps from Jellyfish the week it opened. Place has a great vibe. Really nice and helpful staff. 

We had the scallop ceviche which was excellent. Raw scallops in a light sauce with a lot of complexity. 

Also had the softshell crab on a steamed bun with kimchi (they had a cooler name for it). Another excellent appetizer. Big enough for 2 to split. Worth it. 

The beef tartar was good but not the best we've had this week. Blue cheese sauce on the side was good but the whole dish was a bit salty. I still finished it. 

For an entre, we split the veal stew which was delightful. Rich sauce. Plenty of meat. Great comfort food. 

Finally, we shared the Jellyfish Donut (my name) dessert. This was two beignet/donuts made with carrot ricotta and a lemon custard. Excellent. Not too sweet. Perfect, actually. 

They had the usual minor startup issues with service but were really responsive and fixed things right away. We knew this was opening week, so we didn't expect perfection on everything. The staff and management was really engaged and wanted to know what we thought about everything. Great start for them. 

Go here.

Went there for my birthday, table of 12 girls. The service was good, the food was amazing. Even the chef came to see us ! I had a really great time despite other loud groups! Overall, 10/10 ! Loved it !

Found this place online. It was brand new and already listed in the top 10 restaurants in Montreal. The atmosphere is wonderful and it had a very good vibe. Impeccable service from the get go. We just happened to be seated next to the chef's mother! Our meals were excellent to say the least. Steak with Asian chimichuri. When I asked if they could do something special for my wife's birthday, our server returned with a one off custom made desert. It was an great experience overall. To top things off, the chef came out to talk to his mom and she sent him to our table. We showered him with praise.
NIce and Refreshing, Finally a place that serves something other than steak or pizza in the area...Will be back for sure!

Thank God I live a block away from this place. They have .99 cent sandwiches in addition to all of their other items. You can also order to-go. This is going to be a great place to grab an inexpensive bagged lunch in a hurry. I can also see this as being  place to purchase food in bulk for meetings, events, or to feed volunteers. Move over box of donuts, I'm bringing PBJs to the office. 

I went in for the first time today and was served by the owner who was very nice. She told me that the peanut butter and jelly were both home made at a local space. That's awesome! I feel like this place will be around for a while. I only tried the PBJ so I can't comment on the other items but there were, indeed, a ton of other items.

Ordered from here with some coworkers for lunch.  We split the "Brown Bag Lunch" where you get to pick 6 sandwiches from the "classic PB&J" menu for $11.99.  This was a really great, affordable way to try a lot of different sandwiches.  Some we loved (Apple Jack, Grahama's Fav), others were just okay (elvis, black & gold), but we collectively didn't care for the cookie dough delight.  Overall, fun experience.  A few people ordered the BLT, and it was a really small, wimpy sandwich for the price.  For $6.99, you would get a huge BLT at other sandwich shops. So, I'd stick to the PB&J if you order from here.

15 stars. I've wanted this concept to become a reality my entire life, and now it has -- right next door to me. Makes me think I've done some really right things in life to be so lucky.

I've been a PB freak since birth and have messed around with it in more ways than I can appropriately disclose.

The owners, bro and sis, are the sweetest, and super-driven entrepreneurs. They have serious care and soul into the place.

I went twice in 24 hours. Ready to restart that streak now that I am back in town. I hope everyone that comes across this place or this page will go, minimally for my selfish reason of: I need them to stay open forever for *me*.

Oh, and I've eaten a bunch of "sushi rolls" and a modified Elvis so far. They're killin' it.

Yum!
Love the idea! You feel like a kid again, with the boxed juices and milks. Love it!! I got the strawnana "sushi" roll. Yum!

Meh. I was less than impressed by my meal here. It's a cute concept but I'm not sure it's going to make it. I got a bagel, my friend got a BLT, we both got drinks. Somehow it was $17. My bagel was clearly the kind of cheap bagel you could buy in the frozen section of the grocery store, it was less than special. Everything felt sticky (presumably from jelly), however it left a not so great feeling on my hands and seat. Not thrilled by that. I think it's worth checking out but I don't think I'll go back, there are too many good restaurants in the area to eat like a 4 year old.

I went here right after it opened and thought it was adorable.  It's very inexpensive for basic things, or you can ramp it up and get fancier "sushi" rolls, wraps, flatbreads, etc.  You may want to get two things if you're there for lunch, because the portions are more snack-size (or maybe my appetite was just bigger than usual).  I recommend the pretzel roll.  It comes with chopsticks and is very fun to eat.  It's just a quirky little place that's fun to visit with friends or family, and the food is cute and good.

Food, drinks, and atmosphere were good. Nice addition to Westgate. Only complaint is the management's inability to use a remote control and read a TV guide. We stopped in to watch the end of the Michigan vs OSU game. Of the 14 TV's on display, the game wasn't on any of them. We asked several times to change one of the TV's to the game and we're finally told that the game isn't televised. Instead the West Virginia vs Iowa state game played in our view.

Super excited that a place like this opened up where the shifty magaritaville was. The food and service was great. Sriracha sea bass tacos rice and beans super good. The wife had the enchiladas they were stacked not rolled. I will be back for sure.....

Bar area is open to Westgate fountain which creates a nice feel for the area.  We had a chicken quesadilla and enchiladas.  Both were ok, nothing great.  

Two meals and one drink each $60...seemed a little high for the food.  Chips and salsa are extra charge, a little unexpected for a Mexican bar.

Great place to watch a game but I would skip the food.
Food was pretty good service was lousy just way overpriced, skip this and go somewhere else the food doesnt justify the prices.

Stopped in for a beer before the Coyotes game on Saturday, Nov. 28th. 
$8.25 for a 22oz Miller Lite Draft. YOU HAVE TO BE KIDDING ME! No wonder it was only  1/2 full on an event night.
No, I won't be back.

Service is horrible. Waited over 5 minutes just for our drink order...then had 3 different servers and all of them took forever. Barley got checked on... watch Mexican restaurant doesn't give you free chips and salsa?? Although the guacamole and chips were delicious, they're an extra charge. Food is just ehhh. Got the Carne asada  tacos. They don't even come with Pico de Gallo.... rice was mediocre and beans were delicious. Food is overpriced and service sucks!

Although the staff was friendly we waited 30 minutes for our drinks and the only thing good about the food was the beans. Do not go to this restaurant. Nothing tastes good and the service yet while friendly terribly slow.

Went in on Saturday November 27 before a Coyotes game.   Sat at the bar for dinner and a Margarita.  I had the prickly pear Margarita which was the worst Margarita I have ever had and my friend ordered the Cadillac Margarita when we told the bartender that it was supposed to have Grand Marnier in it she snapped ar us and said no it doesn't.  The food was ok, nothing special but overall the place is overpriced.  There are many other places at Westgate I would go before I would go this place.

First off, this place is WAY better than the other "mexican" place in Westgate. Our server was AWESOME and the food was very good! We loved the atmosphere there as well. Yes, it's a little overpriced but honestly, most of the places at Westgate are. We plan on going back one evening to kick back and enjoy!

**There's two different address listed on Yelp for the same location, so I'm leaving the same review for both!
Love this place!! Awesome people !! Great food !!! Friendly service!! Family place!!! No complaints at all!!! Great location !!!

Ate here for the first time today. They've been open about four weeks. Overall we liked it.  I had the lobster tacos which were served with a mango  fruit and they were very good. My daughter's steak empanadas were excellent.   Husband had the carne asada tacos. The meat was good but the taco itself was a little dry--needed some green salsa or something. The rice and beans came with some kind of sour cream drizzle on them which was not mentioned on the menu but the staff was nice enough to replace them with plain ones.  The papas were hot, both in temperature and taste.  Husband thought they had too much chili powder.  Reuben, the manager, is a really nice guy and was very receptive to our feedback which included a suggestion to be able to mix and match tacos.  They promote themselves as a taco shop but did not have very many kinds of tacos.  Overall it was a very good lunch and we will definitely go back.
Great find in of all places a mall.  Nice assortment of meat choices with interesting flavors.  Fresh toppings.  Worth the trip to the food court at PV Mall.  Ole'

Heard there was (another) new place in the food court at the PV Mall...turns out there were two.

There is a new Vietnamese place where McDonalds used to be (no Bun and no Cafe Sua Da = no deal), so we decided to try Mucha Lucha Taco Shop.

Ordered the 5 Street Tacos and asked for one of each of your favorite 5 - ended up with Carne Asada, Green Chile, Barbacoa, Red Carnitas and Tinga Chicken.  They were all pretty good (though either the Carne Asada or the Barbacoa (hard to keep them all straight) tasted mostly of salt).  She told me the Tinga chicken would be spicy (it was, but not a lot) and she suggested leaving the hot salsa off of the Green Chile, because it was spicy (it was - pretty hot).

Also got a Jarritos Lime drink - pretty good.

This is probably my favorite food court restaurant at this point, so I bumped them up a star as being 'best in the area'.  :-)

Give 'em a try 

(and best of luck to the new taco joint at the mall!!!  we'll be back!)
Best tacos! the food is fresh and the tortillas are really good great people working here to really nice

Best local sushi hands-down! Great new location with lots of parking. New place is roomy with more seating. Great to have them back in business. We tried many substitutions but no one can compete with their quality of fresh fish, and the Taste and flavor of their sushi. There at another level than most local sushi places. Great job
Absolutely the best Sushi in town. I have been going to them for over 16 years. Been a happy customer back from Sapporo days. YES! It is that good.

Came in for lunch today around 1:30p. There were about 6 people sitting at the sushi bar. 3 of them regulars from their previous location. So many choices to choose from. Good option for the customer who does not like sushi. Teriyaki chicken and beef. I got the Stacie roll with chicken katsu. So filling. The two gentlemen making sushi asked us if we were enjoying our food. A first for me. Our waitress was great. Hard to understand her English at first but very thankful for our business.  Plenty of seating. They have one area capable of seating 10-15 more customers. Asked the waitress if more tables were going there and she said space could be available for bigger parties. Within walking distance of my home it kind of scares me how many times I'm going to eat here. Plenty of parking. Especially around dinner time when most of the other businesses close by are closed. Located right behind vinny's pizza

I am so happy Sin City re opened. We have been craving there sushi. I love the Hatrick either handrolled or I have them put it over rice on a plate . And you can't go wrong with the Kasia roll or the seafood salad. 
We have been there customers for over 10 years. The sushi has always been awesome

THEY ARE BACK!!! Poncho, Jimbo, Moon, and Yong have finally opened they're new location and the sushi tastes as good as ever! So happy to see the Sin City family back in business!!
I went for lunch and I walked into a restaurant full of Sin City's regulars(me included) and I felt like it was some kind of reunion celebration with everyone talking to one another!  The quality of fish was exceptional as always! And it was so nice to have my favorites(Zesty Salmon Handroll, Kasia Roll, Vampire Roll, Baked Mussels)! I plan on visiting more often to reacquaint myself with the menu and hopefully try some new rolls soon!

This is hands down my favorite sushi restaurant in Las Vegas! I've been eating with this great group of people for over 10 years since Sapparo in Henderson. Yung, Moon, Poncho, Jimbo and even Milton (who came out of retirement) are all back in action. 

Everything here is amazing! Screaming O, Green Mussels, Salmon Collar, Vampire Roll, Ugly Roll, Dynamite Handroll, Cajun Albacore Nigiri, Garlic Tuna Nigiri, Tuna Poke, Yellowtail Nigiri & even the House Salas are a few of my favorites. 

Tell them Franny sent you!

Yay my favorite sushi spot has re-opened!!!  Place was empty but that was better for us.  Poncho was great.  Me and my boyfriend has been going to this chain since Kai sushi days and they never disappoint.  Well maybe sometimes their service is really bad but hopeful they got better. Go eat here!!! Some of our favs

Vampire roll
Stacie roll
Ugly roll
Charlie hand roll
Baby tako
Baked green mussels 
Oyster shooters 
Jalapeño poppers

It was a quite disappointing experience.  The fish weren't fresh and the rice is flavorless and hard.  The ratio of fish to rice is not proportional.  Typical AYCE...I'm giving this place a 2 star because they are friendly.  Don't waste your money here.  I rather go to Sushimon and Goyemon
Fantastic ayce sushi ! Our favorite place , we were regulars at the old location so happy they finally opened this location . Best quality of fish friendly staff !
Very delicious sushi! They serve very fresh fish.

I am giving this place 5 starts, because I want to see them survive in this neighbourhood. We live close by, and stop here few times, but never eat here, because it's always empty. I see good reviews, i hope its good. Maybe management can work more on advertising and bringing people in?

I am, admittedly, a big fan of Barriques. They are my favorite coffee shop in Madison. So, when I spied a Barriques sign in the window here a few months ago, I was excited.

Stopped-in opening morning, and was pleasantly surprised to bump into Yelp's Waunaking, Matt W. We sat in one of the side rooms, near a very comfortable fireplace and caught-up for a bit.

Despite it being the first day of business, things went smoothly. The only hiccup seemed to be with their payment processing system, but I understand how technology doesn't always like to play nicely on day one.

+ The space is by far, the best of all of the Barriques in Madison
+ Tons of reclaimed wood, plenty of comfortable seating, block glass, polished and dyed cement flooring, and huge windows everywhere
+ Three distinct seating areas: the main entry area, a smaller/quieter side room, and a "front room" with 3-sided fireplace and a huge garage door that will make for nice al fresco seating in the spring and summer months
- There are only a handful of hard chairs situated around the fireplace; some softer seating options would be nice in this space, but I get it... there's not a ton of room available for overstuffed seating in the space (see Matt's photo for a better representation).

+ Decent selection of wine
- Didn't see any beer, but I didn't look closely. Having a decent beer selection from a retail space would be a nice add in the neighborhood
- Semi-limited bagged coffee offerings (bulk); I assume the staff will make you a bag of whatever is on-hand upon request

+ Same Barriques food menu - wraps, salads, bakery goods
+ Same friendly Barriques staff
+ Same high quality Barriques feel

Suggestions: more bagged/bulk coffee, maybe add beer (if it isn't there), relocate a few of the tables to allow for more room by the fireplace and behind the bar area near the cashiers (those hightop chairs bump directly into the table behind them).

Pro tip: There's a self-serve water fountain with glasses to the right of the cashier area, near the high-tech espresso machine

All-in-all, one of the best Barriques I've ever been to. I have a feeling I'll be a regular here. I can't wait to swing through for coffee while on my way to work.

In the two days that this Barriques has been open, I've visited twice. It truly fits the atwood feel with its open concept, warm feel and welcoming fireplace. There is plenty of booth space, plus lots of tables, a bar, a separate room that can be reserved for small groups, and a a very open, bright, warm atmosphere. There is a state of the art espresso machine that makes your coffee come out perfectly, with the help of a very talented team of baristas. There are some grab and go sandwiches, along with made to order options. There is also a wide selection of baked goods that are baked fresh every morning. This is easily one of my newest favorite cafés, and I cannot wait to come back often for study sessions, hanging with friends, or relaxing after a very long day with a craft beer or glass of wine. Way to go, Barriques Atwood!

Stood in line (if you can call it that) - one person in front of me. Three employees behind the counter. Waiting... waiting... waiting... ... ... waiting. The person ahead of me ordered one (1) coffee drink. Their transaction was complete. Three employees behind the counter still. I'm still waiting... waiting... waiting... & waiting. At this point I'm about to say fuck it & walk out.

Suddenly one of the three employees sees me & offers a lame excuse (thought I was with the person ahead of me, who only ordered one drink). In all, I was waiting just about 7 minutes at this point. So the ordering & transaction were fairly normal until I went to pay. Apparently, they're not taking debit - a generally accepted currency these days at most normal low to moderate volume businesses. They do take credit however (cuz I want to pay interest on a cup of coffee for the next two years). Luckily, I had cash. Unluckily, Barriques did not. I got a few fives & a shit ton of quarters back for change. I was offered an apology, but I didn't accept it. I won't be going back. I believe, for one cup of coffee, I waited over 10 minutes. Unacceptable.

The coffee was terrible. My wife & I are coffee fanatics - so we know what's good. This tasted like the nasty drip coffee at her 90-year-old parents' place. 

Starbucks in Monona never failed me, so I will gladly drive to a place, where even when there's a huge line - I'm served faster than when there's one person ahead of me at Barriques.

Great Mexican restaurant at the music factory! Much better than the previous Texicali. The chef was kind enough to bring out appetizers prior to the show at The Comedy Zone. Also, there was plenty of staff on hand. I am looking forward to their taco Tuesday, since I work right across the street!

I had been to Texicali before and didn't think much of the food but it always had a great location and a cool set up. My girlfriend and I decided to give La Revolucion a chance because it was new and close by. After eating there, I had such a great experience that I decided I needed to write my first review. The food was terrific, the staff was great, the drinks were extremely tasty but you could definitely tell there was alcohol in them, and the owner was fantastic. He came out to greet us, explained they had just opened, what type of food they served, and brought us a complimentary appetizer. The meal was also extremely affordable. 8 tacos and another appetizer for $20! I wrote this review in hopes people would come back and give this great place a shot because I really hope it and the owner succeed!
Love the new food! Original and delicious. The service was great. We are definitely coming back :)

This was a blast!  I'm so glad I made it to this. Its something I've wanted to try but who knows when we would have got a group coordinated to go. 

Not only is My Escape Mission amazing but if I'm ever really trapped in a situation that requires complex problem solving to get out, there's no one I'd rather be with than Madison's Yelp Elites!  

And congrats to team #2 for blowing away our time!

Omg!  what a fun night.  I have been wanting to check out a room like this since I read about one in Chicago.  I was in the first group of nine.  Smart folks!  We got most of the clues (darn googly eyes!).  We all brought something to the hunt.

I cannot wait for the West side location to open to try different kinds of Missions.  Thank you to My Escape Mission and Yelp for the excellent event!

There are so many things I loved about this night I do not even know where to start. 

I'll start with the venue, The Escape Mission is a top notch escape room activity. The amount of work and detail that went into the mission was incredible. Challenging, full of surprises, and just all around fun! 

The food from The Wise was delicious. I have not been to The Wise yet, but will certainly check it out now that I have sampled some of the fare. My favorite items were the homemade dipping sauces - a slightly spicy honey and creamy mustard paired perfectly with the small bites platter. 

The event was great at creating relationships among "eliters". Nothing like being locked in a room, that I swear was increasing in temperature, to bond complete strangers together. When I see my team at other events, we will have the "remember when we were locked in that room" forever among us! :) 

And lastly, our host - "the great one" totally made the night. He was funny, knowledgeable, and all around knew how to host us well. 

We will be checking out the new westside location when it opens for sure!

I'm glad I had the opportunity to experience an escape room. I liked the idea of this as well as Escape Mission's execution of said idea. That being said, I felt like the group I went in with was too big. I felt more like a bystander than part of the team. My team members were really great at solving all of the puzzles, so there wasn't much for me to contribute. I think I might enjoy this more as part of a smaller group.

Going into this, I wasn't sure how I felt being locked in a room for an hour trying to solve clues.  Fortified by some delicious appetizers from the Wise and some boxed riesling (beggars can't be choosers), I must admit Elite Escape surprised me.  I thought the clues were clever and loved the creativity and the energy from the team of people I was with.  I thought it had something for both left as well as right brain thinkers.  I think this would be a perfect place for a rainy (or snowy) weekend day or a small teambulding exercise.  A westside location was discussed and if it comes to be, I wouldn't hesitate visiting.

Thanks to Stacey L. for organizing!

Awesome time. Like a real-life version of a puzzle video game. We functioned in a large group (10 people) and still found it challenging and rewarding. I think the best part was that pretty much everyone managed to contribute pretty significantly! Our host was one of the more amazingly positive people I've ever met, as well!

This was a LOT of fun.  It was great to have so many different types of people to work with. I didn't get stressed out at all, and the guy who runs it, Emmanuel, was a lot of fun.

I am REALLY looking forward to coming over to the West Side location when it opens.

I would definitely recommend this place if you want to do some team-building, or just need something really different (and mentally stimulating!) to do.

Come early, because parking is a bit mysterious if you're not familiar with the area (on-street only).

I'm sold on this place just based on the cookie, yea it's that good.  The sandwiches are equally as amazingly good,  and it's all home made.  One of my favorite things is that they serve filtered water,  I think thats what makes the food so good. Everything was rich in flavor and very moist. I'm definitely taking home a pie.  Turns out NASA had taken their bread into space, so i guess their food is out of this world.  Literally.  No doubt I'll be back,  excellent for lunch.

I stopped by Bread Basket and Pies for the first time this week to grab a bite for lunch. I loved the chicken noodle soup, and I had a dessert/cookie called 'Hello Dolly' that was soooo delicious. Will definitely stop by for lunch again soon! Is so nice to have fresh, homemade food. The Employees were also very kind and helpful.

I'm from Chicago, where  ethnicity rules, ergo, you must know something of everyone's culture, including their foods, eating habits, etc., and especially their language  (most important of all). So, that said,  let's get started.
I happened by the Bread Basket & Pies (BB&P) recently , quite by accident, of course.  And what to my wondering eyes should appear but lots of loaves and butter to be washed down with...fresh Columbian nectar steamed carefully from fresh arabica's and filtered through genuine Egyptian cotton ( photo example to appear soon) with accompanying explanation.  In short, I've had my mind and attitude changed from one of,....'any bakery in a storm , to one of, BB&P now rules the taste buds in my mouth,... Let us begin the journey of learning!  
Early mornings,  you'll probably find me in the newly designated LE  corner having my single cuppa Joe!

Let me tell you about their chicken soup.  This is truly the taste of heaven as Mrs. Izenberg my neighbor from the local Hadassa would exclaim about the chicken soup , ...' Mit schmalz even',  she belched happily. 
Prepared fresh each morning, the soup is made with mounds of appropriate veggies for the very health conscious: and home made noodles, yet.  Oy vey, not Kosher but could pass the most stringent rules,...hmm, maybe even latkes one day,  I wish!  
I shall add additional photos of the store front, so when you come by four a visit and to pick up a cookie or two, then you'll know you found the right place!  Se you there, my LE friends!

Address is actually 2016 small man street!!

Really fun cool concept where you can pick from 4 restaurants- order at the counter then give them your cell and you are texted when your order is ready. Nicer atmosphere than I expected, cafeteria style seating with bar located near seating. Exciting and youthful atmosphere as all these chefs are setting out to prove themselves.

Veggie perspective - definetly have a few options among the 4 restaurants- carota cafe had the most options so I went there for entree AND dessert

 Carota cafe review: (chef Jessica Lewis) I loved the kale and egg (great flavored fresh and though it doesn't look like a lot of food it filled me up) dish. Yucca fries were mediocre, perhaps I'm not used to yucca but very dry and chewy- the aioli was great tho! Lastly I finished with the chocolate babka which was perfect and not too sweet.  They gave me a small glass of the beet mulled wine which was delicious- and on the house! This was a limited opening - looking forward to more visits to the galley!

*my carnivore husband loved the sausage Ana sauerkraut at Aubergine- he gave compliments to the chef!

I'm terribly proud to be apart of the innovative and forward-thinking city that conceived this concept. 

Four unique and talented chefs share the same space for 18 months while sharing their gifts with whatever lucky Pittsburghers wander into 2016 Smallman St. 

These great counter-serviced restaurants are accented with a fantastic bar. Local brews on tap & top-notch cocktails. 

My favorite concept was the veggie heavy module of Smallman Galley. I like the chef's approach "produce of Pittsburgh accented by meat and seafood." 

It's the epitome of what the strip is all about -- fresh food, culture, quality materials, and a reasonable price.

Decisions, decisions??? The only thing I did not get to do at last week's event was have a meal. Well never fear all four restaurants serve Sunday brunch from 10-3!

I stopped over here to do some last minute strip browsing and went inside. Off to the left as you enter there is a brewery bar. As you enter there are 4 food court style stations where you can order off each of their menus. This is a unique concept style chef food court new to our area.

This place is now officially open and the four chefs are in preparation for 18 months of preparing different seasonal offerings before they go on to open their own establishment here in Pittsburgh. I did ask if these chefs were going on to other cities and I was told no, they will open up somewhere else in the city after the 18 months and then 4 new chefs in training will replace them.

The current businesses are "Provision","Carota cafe", "Josephine's' toast", and "Aubergine."  I perused the menus and decided to go with Carota cafe but I guarantee you that you won't be disappointed with any of them.

I met up again with Jessica Lewis of Carota cafe. She specializes in home grown fresh vegetables but will add some meat to her offerings. She had a special brunch menu but she had the octopus salad available. I opted for that and for some chocolate Babka for dessert. Her drinks consisted of a choice of either carrot or orange juice or a warmed infused chicken broth. She let me sample the broth but I was really wasn't impressed with it so I pulled a bottle of ice tea from the common refrigerator they share.

I told her I haven't had good octopus since I had been in NYC and wanted to see if she would top that. I paid her and she in turn took down my cell phone number because the businesses text you when your order is ready.

I had my food in no time flat and rather than sit in the bar area I sat in the back area where they have picnic style wooden tables with a view outside. My octopus was to die for! As I was eating I met up with the owner of the establishment who welcomed me and asked me if there was anything I needed. He got me some straws from the bar area to finish my iced tea. The salad was not too big and left enough room for that delicious chocolate Babka. "Seinfeld" fans will know where that pastry originated from. It was just enough for me. 

A clean up man came over and offered to take away my plates. He said normally you would take them to an area set up that collects trash and of course you can place your used dishes in them. I thought that was so nice of him.

This is one of the best additions to the strip and am anxious to see it grow. Next visit I will enjoy a meal from one of the other 3 chefs. It is located on Smallman St near the Catholic church.  Street and bike parking are available. If you prefer then you can park a few blocks away in the garage above Marty's market for a nominal fee.
Love the concept and love the food. Had a chicken skin sandwich that was amazing. The beer selection is on point and the bar staff was very talkative and knowledgeable about the beer on tap.
I live in So. Cal.  I do business in Phoenix and when I know my schedule ..first thing I do is make sure I book my spa treatment with Carly.  I look so ever forward to being pampered .

Carly does a wonderful facial, She's very focused on detail. I will definitely 
schedule a monthly appointment with her. I'm glad I got referred to her.
Carly is so knowledgeable personable and professional!  She's been doing my skin for about five years now.  I would never consider anyone else!  She's simply the best!!!!
Carly is amazing! She's very knowledgeable about skincare and individualizing what type of facial and products will be best for your skin type. She's really sweet too :)

Carly is fantastic!  I have been going to her for years and she always customizes facials that are appropriate for my skin and leave me glowing!  I would definitely recommend Carly for any beauty treatment!

I look forward to facials by Carly! She pays attention to your skin's individual needs and makes the whole experience great. Not to mention, my skin looks and feels amazing afterwards. I've been spoiled and can't go to anyone else! Her space is cute, cozy & relaxing.

I live in Indiana. Whenever I come to Scottsdale to visit, I look forward to seeing her for a facial. She's skilled, pays attention to details, and most of all, my skin feels wonderful afterwards. In addition, she has wonderful personality to make you feel relaxed. I would recommend her to anyone.
Carly is simply the best....your face will feel 10 years younger. Absolute best facial care in Phoenix. You have to try it!

This was a great opportunity to participate in history!  This might be one of the best events I've been to through Yelp. Supporting up and coming young chefs showcasing their talents in this terrific venue was an honor. Pittsburgh has come far in the food scene these past 5 years or so and the future never looked brighter to me than it does tonight. There was something for everyone on the 4 menus and the free drinks were a generous bonus. Thanks Yelp!

A wonderful holiday gift from our CM Rachel! The Smallman Galley brings a new concept to the old fashioned food court idea by bringing in local chefs to prepare signature dishes for a period of time.

We were greeted with two complimentary drink coupons upon arrival. They have 4 parallel open kitchens where you can see the different eateries. Immediately to the left of that is the bar area. I asked for the specialty drink of the night and was told it was a rum ginger syrup and honey sparkling wine. It was out of this world!

Rachel then introduced us to the four chefs who would give a short introduction of their business and the samples we would be tasting. Jacqueline Wardle of Josephine's toast explained how her offerings are made on toast and we were given a sample of her salad.

Rafael Venola was up next explaining Aubergine bistro. Got to sample a marinated white anchovy. Not sure where these samples came from since they were passed after the presentation but all were very good.

Steven Eldrige then explained Provision (menu was so small on chalkboard they had to put one in their display window). He does an interpretation of American food. We got to sample a chicken skin biscuit Bhn mi. Very different!  Finally, Jessica Lewis of Carota cafe. She is vegetable focused gathering her food from local farms but does have a nice selection. Her favorites we were told were carrot soup (sampled that-so good and healthy!), octopus, and even sampled a different type of chocolate chip cookie!

After the presentation and the samples we were told we could order what we wish and eat in the back area where there were wooden picnic style tables. We were given an opportunity to press and write thank you notes to small businesses c/o  Sapling Press. I could have written a bunch of them but I was told to choose one and put the name of the business on it and they would mail it.

I got an opportunity to meet new friends and have a great evening. As always, I got too full on all the samples but it merits a return trip which I will do after the holidays.

The Concept of the Galley is that after 18 months as these chefs prepare to open new restaurants new chefs will come in to take their place. Located at 2016 Smallman St, you can also enter on 21st st. Street parking is available but if you prefer there is a small pay garage nearby on top of Marty's Market. 

Thanks again to Rachel and all the Yelp staff for making this event a holiday present I'll never forget!

Maybe the best Yelp event yet! This interesting concept is featuring some talented new chefs, and we dined exceptionally well. The idea here is to create a platform for emerging talent so new chefs have an opportunity to hone their chops and learn about the business end of the restaurant world before starting up their own brick and mortar places. Each chef gets 18 months, and then there will be new chefs coming in as the previous ones leave for, hopefully, their own ventures. The talent was obvious, and the excitement and energy palpable. We were treated to complementary small bites from each chef and a selection of beer and libations. Just one of the perks of spending all this time writing reviews for Yelp, and a good reason to become elite, for those of you not yet in the groove. The drink they were featuring was a yummy concoction with rum, gin, ginger, honey and sparkling wine over ice. Very refreshing and well balanced. 

After sampling some food and looking at each chef's menus, my husband was really excited by what Chef Rafael Vencio was cooking up, so we ordered some food from him. His Kim Chee, house made sausage with sauerkraut and potatoes, and charcuterie plate were all excellent. Try the pork confit...you'll be happy you did. Truly delicious food coming out of this kitchen, and I'll be back for more.

Rachel, our Yelp ambassador, always puts a lot of time and thought into these get togethers, and it seemed that everyone was having a great time. Thanks Rachel!

One of my favorite Yelp events to date! The food was delicious, the chefs were informative and had interesting takes on their individual cuisines.  The cocktails were incredible. I can't lie I'm always a fan of a well mixed cocktail, I'd take it over food half the time! 
The batch cocktail they made for the event was great, very seasonally appropriate.  At the recommendation of Will I tried a cinnamon ginger cocktail (my god the clever name is escaping me at the moment).  It was perfection in a glass.
I got to meet Yelpers I did not know and it was lovely to make some new contacts! 

Rachel, you always do such a great job!

If I could, I'd give this event extra stars! Yelp knocked it out of the park with this event! To start, the decor and setup was perfect for the event size. The large side room, along with smaller tables spread throughout the Galley, had lots of Yelp swag for grabs. Kuzies, bottle opener keychains, hand sanitizer in a neat yelp holder and Yelpstick (for our chapped winter lips!) There was also a local company letting us hand press thank you cards that we filled out with holiday greetings to our favorite local business and Yelp mailed them out!

 To be expected with the gift of two free drink tickets, the bar was packed in the beginning but once the guests got a drink & Rachel made an announcement about the dining room, the crowd spaced out and had plenty of room to mingle. The long family style dinner table made for a great spot to get to know a fellow Elites and their guests.

The concept of the night was an opportunity for 4 new chefs in the area to showcase their foodie vision. Each of them has a separate kiosk style kitchen in the Galley with their menu & explanation of their cooking style. Before they started passing hors d'oeuvres they each introduced themself, how they landed in Pittsburgh and their cooking style. This event and proceeds from their sales help them save for their own restaurant one day!

A few of the hors d'oeuvres were heavy on gluten so I passed but I did try a delicious carrot soup from Carota cafe. From talking with other guests, none of us were disappointed with the samples!

After the hors d'oeuvres, each guest had the opportunity to order from the kitchens. We ordered and were notified via text when our food was ready. I found this method to be efficient and well executed. Crowds didn't form waiting for food and we could continue mingling until we got our text. 

I opted for smothered fries from Provision kitchen. This kitchen has gluten free and vegetarian notations so that's what sold it for me. The bottom layer of the dish was winter squash puree and the fresh & crispy fries were topped with seasoned lentils and pickled onion. Goat cheese was included but I got it on the side for my friend since I couldn't eat it. Wow, this twist on smothered fries was full of unexpected flavor due to the combination of lentils & creamy squash. I look forward to going back for this dish in the future. My friend opted for a dish from Josephine's toast where everything is served on a different type of toast. She got chicken, escarole, potatoes & parmesan on garlic toast and it didn't disappoint. 

Kudos, Yelp! This event was wonderful! The 4 chefs are incredibly talented and I couldn't be more delighted that they brought their skills to the great Steel City!

Wow what a great event. This place will definitely be my next choice for a date night. Plenty of seating and lots of choices for food is always a plus. My favorite aspect of this place is how you have four restaurant in one establishment. It has the strip district vibe to it simply by allowing me to choose which business I want to eat at without having to wonder outside.

Each restaurant brings its own flare And culture behind why they cook what they do. We sampled foods from Provision and Carota Cafe. The beef cheek pot roast I had from provision was excellent. I loved the side of sweetened cabbage and the risotto was off the hook delicious!!!

Carota had a unique menu featuring an Octopus salad and I must say that that was the BEST Octopus I've ever had. It wasn't chewy like a lot of places but literally tasted like I was eating a piece of Cod or Salmon. My husband hates things that are too fishy but he really enjoyed this dish. 

I wasn't drinking tonight but the bartender William was able to hook me up with a ginger based non-alcoholic cocktail that kept me coming back for more. Literally 3 more!! I'm so happy this place was featured for a yelp event because I love a place with options. 

Thanks Rachel C. for the amazing intro of Smallman Galley, I look forward to coming back really soon!!

What an exciting evening! Who would ever have guessed just a few years ago that Pittsburgh would be named the top city in the U.S. on the restaurant front. 

Talk about innovative restaurant concepts! Smallman Gallery is an incubator for the talents of four chefs, each developing his or her own concept, and working towards opening their individual spots at the end of the next 18 months. When these four chefs have completed their tours of Galley duty, another four chefs will take over the helms and the incubation process will begin again. 

The space itself is large, brick walled, industrial, yet warm. The communal tables that parallel the gorgeous copper-topped bar make for a comfortable spot to enjoy your selection of food items along with a well-made cocktail, beer or non alcoholic drink.  (Might I mention here that it's a GREAT place to see everything...prime people watching!) We Yelpers filled every inch of that side and spilled into an adjoining space filled with tables. THIS is a space for one hell of a private event!

I can't wait to enjoy a meal, picked from all 4 menus, when they open officially. I saw gluten free items that I'm looking forward to. I already know the bar is putting out some top notch cocktails!

Thanks Rachel...you outdid yourself last night!

A great event and I was SO excited to learn about the Smallman Galley! I've never really heard of anything like this, so it was so exciting to have this place here in the Strip! I absolutely loved the lay-out of the building and it was a perfect space to host such a large group. I sampled a few of the bites as they walked around and I really enjoyed getting to hear from each of the chefs. Their menus all looked very unique and I can't wait to try more!

I loved the signature cocktail they whipped up for the evening too! They had a variety of draft beer as well as other signature cocktails as well. I will be back very soon for a full meal!

I had a blast at this sneak peek!!  What a great evening.

Jessica Lewis - Carota - Café: Horseradish Gnocchi was outstanding and my favorite dish of the night.   I savored every bite and really didn't want to dish to end!  I will definitely be back for that dish.  I also enjoyed the carrot soup (not sure if it was considered soup or broth) but it was delicious.   
Chef Stephen Eldridge - Provision:  I tried the Bahn Mi (fried chicken skin) was tasty and different.  

Chef Rafael Vencio - Aubergine - Bistro:  White anchovie small bites.  I don't normally eat seafood (although I have tried it all) these were good! 

This was one amazing event and I feel lucky that I was able to attend.  All food prepared by "all" the chefs were amazing.  The décor of Smallman Galley was so rustic and modern.  I love the brick walls. Its so interesting to watch the chefs prepare their dishes and really see what goes on behind the scenes.  

A big thank you to all the amazing chefs, Smallman Galley, Yelp and Rachel ..

OMG this was like the best event ever! I loved the food, even though some of the food was more adventurous than I am used to. We also bought additional food from 2 of the restaurants and that food was great too. I liked it all so much, I think I might actually have my wedding reception there.

What an exciting event! I loved every minute of this event from the chef concept to the food to the interior!

I was excited to hear that SG had only opened 2 days earlier so it was awesome to be a part of their opening days. The concept of SG and the 4 chefs working for 18 months toward opening their own restaurant is awesome. I enjoyed speaking with the chefs and the samples they provided. We also purchased a dessert from Carota Cafe.

This place is generally beautiful and would make a great dinner and/or event spot.

Big thanks to the Yelp for an awesome event!!

Great event to end the year!

This had to have been one of the best Elite events of the year! During this event we got a change to get a sneak peek of the brand new Smallman Galley.  

The décor is rustic and modern at the same time and such a nice space. It is much more spacious than it looks from the outside too.

When my wife and I arrived we snagged a couple of seats at the bar. The "Yelp" cocktail was very tasty and had a nice kick to it. It featured rum, gin, ginger, honey and sparkling wine over ice and was topped with cinnamon. Veronica was one of the bartenders working during the event and she took excellent care of us the entire evening and kept the drinks flowing. I love a good cocktail and these were absolutely incredible.

Smallman Galley is very new and innovative dining concept. It features four different "kitchens" where four unique up and coming chefs get to hone their entrepreneur skills for 18 months with a ultimate goal of opening their very own restaurants once the 18 months are up. Then a new group of aspiring chefs will come in and the process begins all over again.

During the event a appetizer from each of the four kitchens were pasted around. First we got to try Chef Stephen Eldridge of Provision's Bahn Mi (fried chicken skin) It was my favorite. Next we got to try Jessica Lewis of Carota cafe's carrot soup. We also got to try Chef Rafael Vencio of Aubergine Bistro's White anchovy small bites. They were quite unique.

After the samples were finished being served I made my way over to Provision and ordered the two of us a couple of Umami Burgers. It features a locally made beef patty, simple greens, Parmesan Frica, smoked mushrooms, Umami aioli, Cheddar cheese all served on a Challah roll with a side of fries. It was one of the best burgers I have ever had in my life! It was so, so good and very different from other burgers I have tried.

The place was packed so I can say that the event was a total success! I think I just found my new favorite summertime hangout!

This was my favorite Elite event of the year! Rachel truly out-did herself! The location is gorgeous! The food was amazing and the Yelp cocktail was perfect! I was so happy to be able to bring my boyfriend as a guest to this event. The Galley was truly showcased and I love the concept! Overall, a very memorable evening!

The food from each vendor showcased different personalities and food perspectives! The carrot soup was different from others I have had. i have always had a sweetened carrot soup and it was nice to try a savory style! I also loved the fried chicken skin!

A great event! Truly grateful to have gone!

Wow what a great event! 

I've never gone to an event for a newly opened restaurant. The sneak peak @ Smallman Galley was like 4 newly opened spots in 1! 

All of the chefs (& staff) were very kind when opening and when passing out their creations. I tried a few things and they were all great. I loved the cocktail that the bar had made(!!!). The space here looks so nice w/ the exposed brick.

 I wish the best of luck to all chefs and i look forward to heading back. 

Awesome event. Thanks to everyone who made it happen

I was blown away by this one! I signed up without knowing too much about Smallman Galley, and was so excited once I learned more about the concept.

It was a great opportunity to be here on one of their first nights open. We got to hear from both the owners as well as the four chefs who are currently in rotation at the Galley. I absolutely love the whole idea of giving up-and-coming chefs a spot to showcase their skills and build up a following. I will absolutely be back and am excited to see how things develop!

The event went off without a hitch and we had a great evening. We were generously provided with two drinks and a sampling from each of the four restaurant concepts. I enjoyed each item that I tried, am already looking forward to eating here again.

Sapling Press had a station set up where you were able to print your own thank-you card for a local business of your choosing. I thought this was a really cute idea and we enjoyed the activity.

A big thank you to Yelp and Rachel for the opportunity to get an early look at a place which is sure to be a smashing success!

!!!

Yep, I really just started a review with "!!!" - because this event was wonderful. This event is in my top five events ever. This event tops the Ten Penny holiday party from last year. Why? Because Smallman Galley is awesome, it's unique, and it's a great addition to Pittsburgh.

Smallman Galley is a brand new spot that, according to the website, is "a launch pad for the best new restaurant concepts in Pittsburgh." 4 chefs have come together here in four small kitchen spaces, and each are in the process of developing a great menu. Over the coming months people will be able to come here and sample all of the food available at these four kitchens - while also enjoying items from a shared bar! - as the chefs get their ducks in a row and look into opening in their own local businesses.

During this event I had a chance to visit this brand new spot, enjoy some free drinks, and sample some lite bites from each kitchen - and then we had the chance to actually purchase items on the menus. I admit, I'm usually all about the free stuff. But this time, I was more excited to purchase something than I was about the samples!

The samples were good, of course: carrot soup, salad on toast, anchovy bites and spicy chicken biscuits. All were delicious - no complaints from me there. But oh man, was my main course great! I, like others, opted for smothered fries from Provision kitchen. And smothered they were - smothered in goat cheese, pickled onion, and lentils and creamy squash. Wow. Just, wow! Every single item in this stack of food was fresh/cooked to perfection, too. I legit thought about ordering a second helping. That's how great they were.

Everything about this event was absolutely wonderful - it's a wonderful concept in a wonderful space that's home to some wonderful chefs. Rachel's idea of giving us the chance to write thank you letters to local businesses, by the way, brought the whole event home and was a perfect touch for the holidays. Rachel, thank you so much for an amazing 2015 - I cannot wait to include Smallman Galley in my plans for 2016!

Rachel C. outdid herself again! 

This was a great event, and it was a lot of fun getting to see this place in action! The bartenders did a good job of dealing with the onslaught and quickly made up a mocktail for me due to the little one.  My husband really enjoyed the batch cocktail and even had two which is a lot for him! 

The chefs were all very friendly and excited to discuss their concepts and their appetizers with the masses. 

The food was so good that we ordered a couple of small plates to share! 

I can't wait to go back and to introduce all of my friends to this amazing venue and to these amazing chefs!

This was my first yelp event and it was a great gathering.  I never knew about the Gin Club in Pittsburgh and the news that it is open to anyone who is interested in taking things to a whole other level in regards to gin. Regular gatherings are Thursday nights.
We were  treated  to a couple of  great tasting  gin drinks while munching on a fine array of bites.


I certainly have a whole new appreciation for gin and I am looking forward to another visit to Spoon.

I couldn't agree more with Maria, this was a great event.

I have heard of Spoon but, had never been before this event. I absolutely love their sister restaurant Willow so I knew we would be in for a treat.

The space inside the restaurant is very cozy, warm and inviting. It makes you will like you are somewhere else other than Pittsburgh. I actually forgot we were still in East Lib. LOL!

We were started off with both a charcuterie plate and a cheese plate to share amongst ourselves and then some appetizers were passed including Lobster salad, Ahi tuna on crispy wontons, a spoon of some sort of salad and meatballs. All of the food was excellent!
 
Also, during this event we got to sample some fantastic gin based cocktails. The first was a Gin & Tonic with cranberries and the second was a Gin Martini. Both cocktails were delicious and full of flavor. 

A special thanks goes out to not only our Yelp C.M., Rachel for throwing such a great event but, also to the owners and staff of Spoon as well. I must say that the service was exceptional the entire evening also. 

Spoon is now definitely on my list of places to come back and try again for dinner in the near future.

My last visit to Spoon was for a birthday dinner eons ago. My impression was decent, but not great. And, given the countless other options in the city, I never returned - until last night. We were treated to two awesome cocktails and some bites courtesy of the owner, Brian. I dig their Gin Club concept and will keep it in mind next time I have a craving for a G & T.
