As usual, it was nice hangin' with our awesome Yelp community including Kerri, Lauren, Tim, Nicole and more! Thanks so much to Spoon and Rachel C. for a delightful Thursday night!

A fun Thursday night at the  Gin Club with yelpers! I was at Spoon years ago for a friend's birthday dinner and everything about it was bad from the food to the service. I was hesitant 
to give it another try but glad I did. The staff was friendly and really on top of checking our waters and serving the food and drinks. We started off with the gin and tonic which is something I normally would not like but this was a bit sweet and sour with fresh  cranberries added- very tasty and strong. The menu of gin you can order from with mixers and garnishes is amazing and overwhelming all for decent prices. Up next we had sample appetizers which included a cheese and meet tray, lamb meatball on a stick with pita, and an avocado salad in a spoon. There was also a tuna and lobster app that looked beautiful been not liking seafood I skipped those.  We had the back room which makes a great area for a large party!

I'm a little late to the review party on this one, but, better late than never! This event was the very first time I ever visited Spoon, and now I'm dying to return. Things admittedly started a little slowly at this one, with the Yelp group seated in the main area; we were moved to the private section later, but until then there were a number of people sharing appetizers in a relatively small space around two tables.

That said, the appetizers we tasted were absolutely wonderful. The cheese plate we started with was quite nice, and the the avocado salad bites - as well as the the meatballs with pita - were delicious. But the real show stealers in my mind were the Ahi tuna bites on crispy wontons. So. Good! I ate those tuna bites every single time they came to our tables throughout the night. I literally have no idea how many of them I ate. But it was a lot!

As others have mentioned, we also sampled a Gin & Tonic with cranberries and a Gin Martini. I was a BIG fan of the Gin & Tonic - I made that bad boy last. :) I also ordered a Shandy cocktail just to try something not on the menu and to support Spoon. It was ok, but next time, it's Gin & Tonic's all the way for me!

All in all, this was a GREAT event. Spoon's staff were so patient and were so happy to talk and answer questions throughout the night. I was admittedly super happy when we were moved to the back room with multiple tables, since we were all bumping into each other at first in our excitement and attempts to grab food and drink. But overall, this was a wonderful event - and if I have to spend an evening bumping into people, I'd rather it be people on the wonderful Elite team. Thanks so much for putting together another GREAT event, Rachel!

Moi et ma blonde avons passé un merveilleux souper ! Même si nous sommes allé souper un lundi, l'ambiance était très cool et le serveur à donné un excellent service ! Nous avons profité du rabais pour les universitaire 1l de bière pour 6,95$ ! Nous avons mangé des moules et elles etaient très bonnes !
Great mussels, beer, and bison burgers. Would definitely go back. Yes, service could be better. But very good food and drinks at a very reasonable price.

We came here because the mussels were supposed to be good and it got decent reviews but we were mostly disappointed with the food. We got the classic mussel, some fries with chipotle mayo dip and a French onion to split. All around, everything was a bit bland. Mussels could have been more flavorful, French onion soup was serviceable at best, and the fries were a bit flavorless. Beer and service were good. There was hockey on the tv though no one seemed to care or watch as it was not that kind of crowd.

Disinterested service, at best, despite a small lunch crowd. Felt like we were passed off between various servers who didn't really want to make the effort.

Salad was good, and the sausages of the day were quite good. Mussels smelled great but we didn't have room to try everything. 

We were 0/2 on our beer choices, not their fault, but it would be nice if they did half-pints so you could sample more taps.

A solid little place for breakfast and lunch - my experiences have been good, but not "outstanding" - it's pretty difficult to have a bad breakfast (although Perkins seems to have mastered the art of the worst breakfast), so I'm going with 3-stars: A-OK.

The place gets a little busy on weekends; I've been there both during the week and on weekends.  It's largely a "self-service" type place, which is fine by me.  You place your order at the main counter, get your own coffee and condiments, find a table and wait for the food to arrive.  When you're done eating, you clear your own table, take the dishes to the "dish basket" and head on your merry way.

The pancakes aren't anything spectacular - just your regular "mix made" pancakes.  They're cooked well, with nice color, and are "plate size" so one or two should be plenty for most folks.  They're not obscenely thick; in fact, they're a bit on the thin side, come to think of it.

Breakfast sandwich is decent - an egg, your choice of meat, some cheese, and served on a muffin.

I've also had the Wright Breakfast and today, I had the special, which was two eggs, scrambled with tomatoes, peppers, onion, ham, cheese and a choice of toast.  Again - it was good, but not "out of this world great."

They're currently serving Alterra-brand coffee; another review references Ancora, but it looks like they've switched to Alterra.  It's good coffee, nonetheless.

Staff keeps largely to themselves, which is nice - no one bothers you throughout the meal.  They don't take credit/debit cards - it's cash or check only.  There's a fair amount of seating indoors and a few metal tables and chairs outside for when the weather is nice.  There tends to be a lot of families that meet here on the weekends, so if kids aren't your thing, steer clear on Saturday and Sunday.  I had the joy of listening to two screaming kids during my entire meal this morning - the parents were oblivious... 

My biggest gripe?  Price.  My breakfast this morning ("special" plus two pancakes plus coffee) cost $14.10.  That's a little steep for standard breakfast fare...

Breakfast is served all-day long on Saturday and Sunday; during the week it's served until 11am, at which point it's lunch only until closing time (around 3pm, I believe).

I've been here at least 8 or 9 times since the August 2010 review; time for an update.

Pros:
+ Solid breakfast food, especially the special scrambles. Can't miss.
+ Great breads - I've tried nearly all of them and they're excellent
+ Altera coffee 
+ Friendly staff
+ Bakery items (cookies/pastries) are superb

Cons:
- Cash only
- Slightly expensive
- When busy, seating is hard to come by; small space

No complaints with the food - it's always been high quality. We were there today as part of a team outing, and several folks commented about the pancakes - they are truly great, with a good sear, excellent flavor, and perfect texture. I had the scramble, and it was as good as always.
First time in the new space and it was better than ever!   Friendly staff and great food and I paid with a CREDIT CARD!

Have always loved Prairie. We have looked forward to eating here Sundays when in Madison (which has been often the last 3 years). Got here today and found the Cafe had moved across the street. New space is okay, high ceiling makes it extremely loud. I miss the warm atmosphere of the old spot. Biggest issue is I think they forgot the recipes and seasonings at the old place. First time ever, we were horribly disappointed, after waiting 30 minutes for our food. Toast was burnt, sent it back and dug into my corned beef hash. Potatoes were not done and it was bland beyond belief. We sent the plates back and while they added a bit of seasoning it was still not "Prairie hash" and they threw the same eggs on grill to rewarm so now my medium eggs were hard. Maybe the new grill isn't seasoned enough yet. They also now clear the tables for you, instead of having a station for you to dump your own. Twenty minutes after we eere done someone came and cleared our plates away. I sincerely hope they find the old mojo!

New location is gorgeous!! There's something for everyone here. Healthy options, ultimate comfort foods, a wide selection of teas... And oh their tea! You get a huge pot of high quality loose leaf tea for a small price. I always ask for a little soy milk to add to mine. Just delightful. 

Note: The wifi is strongest in the far end of the cafe near the restrooms.
Super cute cafe!! Very spacious with great ambiance. Many different food and drink options. They now take credit cards too!!

Went to new facility on Fathers-day. It used to be one of my most favorite places for coffee, bake goods, and breakfast. Food was still excellent, we had a scramble and it was excellent. Food still is great, but, the new beauty full facilities has major problem. I have not been in such a load environment for eating for a long time. In looking at the internal construction there is no sound absorbing or muffling materials anywhere. The restaurant is an Eco chamber. Than to top it off they where constantly grinding what I initially thought was coffee but it turned out to be some kind of smoothy. Than a worker showed up without her proper tee shirt on and the manger had to yell over the smoothy machine for her to get her work shirt on and get to work. He of course had to yell since the smoothy machine was going so all the customers got to witness the entire exchange. The tables are much more spread out and the tables are big. But because of that I could not talk across the wide table in such a noisy enviorment. The design to have the kitchen out in the open makes the noise of food prep  a big problem. The feel of the old place is gone. 
They can now handle more customers but the dinning experience is greatly reduced. I came across town from the east side to dine here, but going forward I will only be going here if it happens to be on my way to somewhere.  I hope Prairie can address the loss of comfort they used to have, it will take a real effort and defiantly some extensive attention to sound dampening.

Just had my third breakfast since this cafe moved across the street into larger quarters.  I loved the food at the old place.  I'm ready to report my major disappointment with what the new kitchen is producing.  Food was long in preparation, egg dishes were overcooked, greasy, omelet was a overdone dried out frittata.

Visited for breakfast today, and really enjoyed it. A couple of specials listed on the board when you walk in. Order at the counter and the give you a number and bring it to your table. 

The special sounded good - but I went for an omlet with sausage, mushroom and cheddar with sourdough toast. It was excellent! Good size, delicious sausage and the Fresh bread. Others in our group had a Belgian waffle and one had oatmeal. All were very pleased!

Order came out fast and the staff was very nice. Good sized place and it looked like there was outdoor seating too. Very pleased. 

Only complaints were it looked like many bakery items were sold out (good sign they were good) and the menu on the website wasn't working. One review said cash only - but I don't know - I saw a card swiped ahead of me so that might be old info. 

Can't wait to go again! Very good!
I have visited for lunch twice, great sandwiches at good value with fresh fruit as a side - beautiful new building full of light.

My family loves this place!  We have been going here since their old location. great place to bring your kids for breakfast. It's good food and they are pretty quick (we are generally there pretty early)!  They new building is great and has a ton of space. 

My husband loves getting the Corned Beef Hash and the Burger and Fries breakfast.  I also love the Corned Beef Hash.  Their specials are all really good.  I generally get the special scrambles.  The coffee is great , and they have unlimited refills! YES! 

The fruit is always fresh, and they have great baked goods.  Staff is really friendly there.   

and YES!!! they take credit cards now!!!

New place + several more visits under my belt = time for an update.

Dropping the rating a star from before; I'm so torn on how to rate this... I feel like a 2.75 is about right these days, but I'll be a bit generous.

+ New space looks great. Open, airy, bright. 
+ Dining area is largely separated from order counter thanks to half-walls and coffee area.
+ Menu remains the same as before
+ They now accept credit/debit cards!!!!! Finally!!!! Yay!
+ Friendly staff 
+ More outdoor seating than before
+ The toast. Yummy.
+ They now bus your tables when done eating
- It's not immediately clear that they do this; I discovered it by accident after walking around the place, holding my plate looking for the bus-bins.

And now, for the negatives...

- Tried to dine on July 3. Place was locked-up tighter than a drum. No signs about holiday vacation, no mention anywhere. Just dark (at 9:30am). Not cool.
- While they have Colectivo coffee, it's brewed far too weak. It's so thin and anemic, that all variants taste nearly identical to one another.
- Do the scrambles-of-the-day ever change, or do I manage to visit when the same scramble is featured (every.dang.time.)?
- Scramblers have become quite greasy. Past two visits left my plate with a solid sheen of oil.

But my biggest gripe (aside from weak coffee and greasier than before food): logistics of the coffee station/order counter area. Why are they so close to one another, thus making it nearly impossible during busier times to get coffee or to get up to the counter (to ask a question or request a to go container)? The distance between the order counter and the coffee area is maybe two-people wide, so it gets crowded quickly in that area. It's also the only area for garbage/recycling, which makes it all the more busy.  :-(

I'm quickly running out of favorite west-side breakfast haunts.

Great place with extremely fresh ingredients. I've been here twice now-both times for breakfast and it's just a wonderful little place. The space is open and cheery. You order at the counter, get a number and go find a seat. There are a number of tables outside as well as counter seating if a regular table/booth isn't to your liking. Coffee is by Collectivo and is self-serve behind the register. Don't forget to grab your silverware right behind you after you pay. 

The menu has quite a large selection. I had the carnitas burrito and it was delish. The chipotle sauce that it comes with is excellent and I could have used a touch more on my burrito. It comes with a side of salsa verde which was awesome. Not sure if it was housemade or not but it sure tasted like it! My sister had the burrito with black beans, red/green peepers (I can't remember what it was called and is not on the online menu for some reason even though it was not a special-though after a second glance I notice the carnitas burrito is not listed either...CAUTION: website menu is not updated). She really enjoyed it and hers came with a very good red salsa. Portions aren't overwhelming and don't come with potatoes so is actually a perfect amount of food. I'll be back for sure.

Nice new building with well trained staff. My neck got sore looking up at the menu behind the bar. They need some hand out menus like other places. I had a southwestern rollup that was very good and spicy. My partner had the CBLT, cheese BLT I think, that was good but had too much butter on the outside of the bread. The only complaint was that there is no sound proofing and one crying rug rat in the dining area really hurt my ears and made it hard to talk. It is an open ceiling design which is nice looking but bounces all sound everywhere and is annoying.(Ban Kids!) Breakfast menu looks great and I will definitely go back.

We came for lunch. Food was delicious and coffee was amazing! The service was great and the employees were friendly.

Furniture was clean and employees were attentive at clearing the tables. Plenty of space to find a seat during lunch. Music playing but nothing obnoxious and not too loud.

I only wish that they served breakfast all day, and I'm sure a lot of other people feel the same way.

I attended the opening on Saturday. Lively space and great decor. My friends and I were treated to a red sangria while waiting for our table. We tried 4 different plates all of which had great flavors. My favorite was the crispy chorizo chips served with the shrimp and the fingerlings potato plate. Blood orange beer is one of the best I've tried. Very friendly staff. Looking forward to my next visit.

We knew it might not be perfect since it had just opened but wanted to give it a try based on other reviews.  The music was new age spacy and the lights were dim - it felt like a wine bar but the wine list was not much.  We tried the BBQ and Whipped potatoes, which came served on slate that had not been heated so the food was barely warm by the time it hit the table.  We also tried the polenta with lamb.  The polenta was very buttery but did nothing to compliment the lamb which was dry and had some kind of gravy poured over it.  The seared scallops were very rubbery and the potatoes with romesco were even disappointing as the romesco was so thick and again, not hot when it hit the table.  Only one of us had one glass of wine and our tab was  $66.00     Over all the food was bland and sort of mid west old school.   The wait staff was attentive but not very knowledgeable about the food or its preparation.  Although trying for eclectic it just seemed disjointed.    We talked to one of the owners who said they hoped to evolve to something the neighborhood would support.

Is give this place 0 stars if I could.  Invent here with my buddy after work and the food is boring as hell.  Good beer selection but damn... Enough with ripping off people with small expensive plate nonsense.

His place is also odd and the middle of the ghetto. Weird.

It's hard to read bad reviews for place that's been open for a week. Needless to say I needed experience it myself and make my own judgement and absolutely glad I did. First off, this place is absolutely so cute! I met one of the owners, believe his name was Ray and I learned he does the paintings himself which alone is amazing! I had the calamari tapa which was AMAZING. I also had two red and white sangria's which were highly addicting. I see myself definitely going back. My experience was not bad in any way, staff seemed very happy to work there .

I went to Cor Tapas  for the first time last night and it was an amazing experience.  Everything  from the staff who were friendly and wonderful ,  to the food perfect. 
Ray an owner is warm and inviting, was  kind enough to show me around and tell me details about all the beautiful extra touches that they put into building this restaurant. The food was incredibly fresh delicious,  original very very good   A very  pleasant experience. We are  so lucky to have this gem in our neighborhood.

It's sad to see past employees making a bad name for a new neighborhood business. I'm glad to see anyone that wants to invest in the area and bring something new, so thank you. 

I thought the food was cool and interesting. Items you don't see all around town. The tapas concept has always been something I like, gives me the chance to experience several different items. 

The wine and cocktail list was also very interesting. I always admire someone that tries to incorporate new experiences and originality. Wines from all over the world and labels you may have never heard of. Shaken sangrias???? Never heard of them before but Very fun and tasty

Thank you and look forward to more

We absolutely loved our visit to CoR! The fresh spinach salad with roasted vegetables and balsamic was delicious!  The presentation of the food is spot on, just beautiful. We tried several tapas to include a bruchetta board, caprese, spicy scallops, a portobello tapa and a dessert trio. We were not disappointed! Not only is the food artistic, but the whole bistro is. The atmosphere is very cool and trendy. The bar is gorgeous, polished concrete and very cool barstools. The bartenders are very enjoyable to interact with and make the garnish on the drinks extra special.This is not your average restaurant, it is a very unique bistro. I loved the fresh flowers and votives too. It is a fun experience every time we go! This is our new "go-to" date night place.

Very excited that we have this amazing new neighborhood spot!  The food and drinks are so beautifully crafted and the staff that I had interacted with were delightful!  I'm excited to go back, enjoy a different drink, and to try new dishes that the menu has to offer!

In Phoenix for a vacation and went for the paella, however I indulged in the brussel spout salad, and the flank steak (being from the Mid West I LOVE beef).  I had 2 of the house sangrias (the white and the red) both were flavorful and reminded me of the summer in Madrid--how coincidental I am back in a warm weathered place and brought nice memories.

The ambiance is well suited for the type of food served--a great job with making cement aesthetically appealing!  It is like the old meat packing district in lower Manhattan (before it became commercial) with great ideas--but only for the locals!!

Overall, the food was good, the cocktails/sangrias were GREAT, and the environment makes it an enjoyable place for a couple or groups of friends to gather.

Good job!

Jason

I heard this place opened via Yelp, so we decided to stop in last Saturday night for a cheese and charcuterie board accompanied by a glass of wine.  My cava was perfect and so was the cheese and charcuterie selection.  The bartender and the owners were so welcoming and talked us through the menu on what to order when we visit next time.  We can't wait to try out the tapas...everything looked amazing that came out of the kitchen.  We will definitely be back!

I went to this establishment because I really thought the atmosphere was nice. I reviewed the menu and although the prices were high I had expectations of really good food. I was not impressed. I ordered pan seared scallops, which are a favorite of mine for $17. I was highly dissapointed. Not only were they chewy, but I only got four. That's right!  Four scallops and nothing with it. No rice, no salad, no veggi. Four crappy scallops for $17. I would have made a huge fuss in the restaurant,  but I was on a date. Haha...not going back.
Great people great drinks and great food!! Always a fun environment the people around the bar are always fun and willing to engage in conversation.
We love Barcelona. COR is reminiscent of the tapas places in Barcelona. Great food and atmosphere. Service was excellent and friendly. We'll be back.

Went to this place with a friend of mine. We both loved it! We shared the Pork (quite tender) and the Spicy Scallops...the Scallops was our favorite! The spicy with the sweet is a fantastic blend! 
We ended our evening with a delicious dessert Tripple Delight. VERY flavorful!

Our server was Mondonna (sp?) and she was VERY attentive and well versed in the menu. She gave us suggestions based on our tastes. In addition, the owners were on hand to greet us at the door. They made it a point to talk to each of their guests and made you feel like you were a VIP. 

For those who are new to the Tapas concept please understand that Tapas are small plates with the highest quality of food and flavor. Don't expect to stuff yourself. 

I will be back soon and can't wait to try more fantastic plates.

Historically Phoenix has not been a great place for to find A good Tapas restaurant. This is one.  My wife son and I shared six dishes and all were excellent. The server recommended the Paella and the Osso Buco, both we good choices. We tried the sangria and it was also good. The staff was knowledgable and very helpful. We cannot wait to go back.

Great pressed sandwiches. I had the Prime -- the roast beef is superb, with a mild but distinct zest. Gorgeous day to picnic on the tables in the side yard. My wife had the Porky's Nightmare. She raved about the baguette.
Simply amazing! Zach, is definately a sandwich creator!! Great atmosphere and even better sandwiches. Highly recomend!
Awesome and delicious! Creative and healthy. What a treat for a weary traveler. Delicious vegetarian green goddess sandwich. Mostly great looking meat options though too. Thank you!
First time in and Great Sandwich. Highly recommended!  Home town friendly service and fresh healthy taste for sure.  I'll be back next time in town. Thanks!

Stopped in Wickenburg on the way from Phoenix to Vegas for a quick bite. So happy I chose this place! Absolutely delicious, everything is homemade even the mayo. I got the Local and added roasted tomatoes. Yum!

The new best spot for sandwiches in Wickenburg. A cute quaint place with picnic tables outside to dine at. The sandwiches are amazing. I had the chicken caprese with prosciutto and pesto aioli. The panini press style sandwiches are great. The wife had the greek goddess which was a great selection of veggies served cold. We also tried the grilled cheese which had prickly pear jelly and an assortment of cheeses pressed panini style. 

If in Wickenburg, you have to try the local press!!
Excellent! Excellent! Excellent!  Great friendly service and delicious food! It's my new crave!
Marginal overpriced Sammies $14 for mine, "pressed" on a George Foreman. Go to subway for a third the money. Or stop at Screamers on hey 60 for the best burgers and shakes in tow.

How do you one star Jersey Mikes? Fast friendly service. Always good. Just as good as any other  location I've been to. I even got fresh hot white bread which is a bonus!!! Hardworking people here! It gets busy!!
nice people, greeted the moment I walked in. great sandwiches, so glad it's here! Will be back soon.. The Italian was super good and very filling.

To know me is to know that my favorite food is cake. That being said, my expectations are high.  The best of the best in my opinion is...wait for it...Giant Eagle. Yep.  I love the sugary sweet icing and the texture of their cakes.  BUT, Butterwood is giving GE a run for their batter.  I stopped in on Saturday with some family to complement our delicious and decadent dinner from Dive.  Among our choices were a Cranberry [short] cake (literally - it was short), cinnamon/chocolate cake; vanilla/sunflower seed and chocolate/sweet potato.  I split the sunflower seed and sweet potato options and DANG, these are GOOD cakes!  They're so dense and flavorful I actually couldn't finish - which is VERY unlike me.  Take a pic, because now that a bakery is open down the street from me until ELEVEN PM, I'll be twice my size in no time. At $6+ a pop, I might also be broke, but I'll also be happy - so bring on the Butterwood

P.S. I got our cakes to go, but look forward to eating in next time. The décor is straight out of a Victorian cakery! Love it!

On today's Lawrenceville cookie tour I made it a point to hike nearly 10 blocks from my car to find this place. It is very small and quaint. They have a relaxed seating area in the front with a few comfortable chairs and tables. In the back were all your dessert offerings.

I asked the person who waited on me what her recommendation was and she said everything. Well that leaves me with one option. Look and see what little is left and chances are I would get a winner. They are all priced at $6.00 but the slices are enormous!

I saw the cinnamon cake was gone so I opted for what they call the vanilla black sesame cake with chocolate buttercream.Never tried anything like that before but it's different so I went with it.

The lady brought the slice to my table and it was to die for! Every bite you can taste the sesame seeds and it was very rich! I learned that take out is available as well and of course you can purchase whole cakes if you are inclined to do so.  I really felt like I was eating a gigantic piece from one of the more popular chain restaurants. I was so stuffed from eating it that I was glad I had the 10 blocks to head back to my car to "burn" some of it off.

The cake shop is located near Allegheny Cemetery and it is easy to miss if you don't check the house numbers. Next time I'll get a box to take half of it home!

Yum!  I have only tried a handful of goodies from here and they were all very good!  However,  I think it's the ambiance of the bakery that really does it for me.  It is so pretty and romantic in there.  The perfect spot to take a date to for a sweet treat after 10pm ( they are open till 11pm ).  They even have vegan offerings!  
I can't say much for service because both times I was there it was empty and everyone working seem pleasant.

YAS! What's not to adore about a place that serves perfect coffee and heavenly (gimme all the cake!) homemade desserts that is open past 9pm (they're open until 11 most days) in Lawrenceville! Throw in a smattering of friendly workers and a chic atmosphere, and this is my new go-to work-friendly meeting spot.  

Note: Try their homemade buttercream frosting!

Festive fun with a choreographed tunnel of lights paired with different local choir music. It's fantastic the tickets are free and the show is the right length - about 15 minutes of watching and listening before the opportunity to walk through the tunnel of lights. I loved it! It wasn't what I expected and the choir music isn't live but it's still great fun.

It dazzles with somewhat lots of lights and has pre-recorded choirs tuned to lighting display. 

Sure it's good but I wouldn't say I was overwhelmed by it.  Mind you saying that it's good for kids and it's free.  I can't complain too much as it was free.

It's set on the Royal Mile and it's a ticketed event.  It last around 20 mins and your welcome to wander through the lights whilst listening to the choirs.  There is about 4 choirs that sing a song each.  All very good but pre-recorded.

It's a lot of standing/ walking around and it's outdoors, so wrap up warm and be prepared for the seasonal Scottish weather because you ain't protected - at all!

I had a good time, but I'm sure the kids would enjoy it too if you have them!

Really great to have outdoor activities in our city such as the street of lights especially in the winter when everyone need a little more TLC. The lights dance to the harmony of the choir and because it takes place twice a day the street are busy but not mugged which is just what you need to pleasantly be enjoying the event. Although the event said to book your free ticket online we didn't need them to get in for some reason. The show lasted 15 mins though I was maybe a little disappointed with the colours of lights which were predominantly red and blue, it was nice though nothing I was completely wowed with.

Of course we have a Street of Light... Edinburgh is anything but ordinary during the holidays!

I had friends in town visiting and we timed a trip to Wings around the 6:30pm show, which meant we snuck onto the street and bypassed the need for tickets. However, it seems on days that are a bit drizzly, you don't really require pre-booked tickets - something to keep in mind for those planning to visit on a supposedly "sold out" evening.

The display is beautiful, especially at the end when they light the whole street. It really is a sight worth seeing but I have to admit, I was a bit disappointed that the music wasn't live. I think having a live choir would have made this truly enchanting. As it stands, it's still an impressive display and well worth taking 15 minutes out of your evening to see.

Bring hot chocolate.

When I heard about the Street of Light, I assumed it would be a permanent display, turned on whenever darkness falls. However, this is absolutely not the case. There are specific "show" times that you can turn up for and see the lights, coordinated with some pre-recorded choir music.

The lights are nice, for sure. There are plenty of photos on here, so you can see for yourself. However, I'm glad I just happened to be on the Royal Mile at the right time. If I had planned my evening around seeing the lights, I think I would have been disappointed, particularly with the lack of live choir singing. This really could have been a big opportunity to create an excellent festive event with live choir, and fantastic lights.

As it is, the Street of Light is worth seeing if you're around the area, but make sure to go at the right time, and don't change your whole evening plans just to fit in the lights!
Two shows per night with free tickets via virgin online. Only 20 minute show but really great atmosphere. Singing along under the lights is a fun way to start getting into the Christmas spirit.

Beautiful display, lights coordinated with the (recorded) choir music. It's on for about 15 minutes, they light up the whole street at the end and you can walk around a little.
They do two shows per night, and there are free tickets available online
It is not necessary to book the tickets, which is good - I didn't remember to do it before going.
I was a bit disappointed with the whole thing, though, and I'm not entirely sure why. May be because I was expecting the choir lo be live, or the lights to be more colourful. I was still pretty impressed by the display, it was fun and I had a nice time.

This display is really pretty but why oh why is there not a live choir?
I would rather have coughed up a couple of pound for the music to be live than have it pre-recorded. My friend & I were looking around the whole time wondering where the choir were standing & when we realised it wasn't there felt a little bit deflated.

Awesome concept though & it is nice to see people braving the weather & getting into the christmas spirit.

I loved the lights and singing. I wouldn't bother to make a special trip to see them but if you are in the area the make sure you see them. 

The singing is recorded which was a little disappointing but the timing of the lights was spot on to the recording. 

Tickets aren't really needed especially on a rainy weekday evening so it's worth trying to get in even if you don't have tickets.

So its a pretty cool thing happening by the Royal Mile, but I kinda expected more. A really pretty display, but yea, its just... pretty. 

The show lasts for about 15 minutes and the choir is not live like I thought it would be. I did book tickets online even though it's a free event but wasn't asked to show this when we arrived. 

Overall, its a pretty cool thing to see. I'd suggest making an evening of it and checking out the Christmas markets on Princes street afterwards or enjoying a few drinks at a local pub nearby.

I first laid eyes on the Street of Light on the bus home. Oooh, shiny; I was drawn to the dazzling bright lights in the distance. So, I made sure to visit the next evening that I was close by.

I didn't take part in one of the free ticketed choir events but just walking through the tunnel of light was a dazzling thing in itself. Of course, it's not unmissable as others too have said, but it's a pretty nice little addition to Edinburgh this Christmas and could have you feeling in the festive spirit. This is a teeny tiny bit tainted by the 'Virgin Money' sponsor that shines from every illuminated archway. 

But yes, ooooh...shiny, indeed.

I appear to be one of the few people who truly let her inner child loose for the Street of Light, and who wasn't that bothered by the lack of a live choir. All I can say is: event featuring a lovely light show along the Royal Mile coupled with a quaint selection of (for us) songs from the Gay Men's Choir (you rock on guys!)-- and it's FREE? I'm all over that like a duck on a june bug.

I say bravo to Edinburgh for its never-ending efforts to entertain and provide for the good people of the city. Sure, I would've loved to have seen the Gay Men strutting their stuff live, but I respect their efforts even recorded as they were. That coupled with an impressive light show in the rarest of moments free of rain in Edinburgh as of late, I was bopping along in great spirits! Yeah! Encore, encore!!

Awesome Holiday Lights display that my sis and BIL stumbled upon a few years ago, and thought they'd share with us. Apparently, it's been put on by a local couple for 30 years and it's turned into a bit of a side business for them. The entire thing is free, but they do sell some food, toys and such to help offset the cost of the electric bill, I surmise. While I was there, Santa shared with me the Naughty and Nice things to do while visiting the lights:

Naughty

*Don't stop in the middle of the road and block-up traffic just so you can jump out and take a selfie.

*Don't block their neighbors' driveways because you are too lazy to walk an extra 10'--are you on a calorie saving program???

*Don't start touching and messing with the lights and displays. 

Nice:

*Do make a donation to help out

*Do park respectfully and try not to bother their neighbors.

*Do buy some snacks (i.e., Rice Krispie treats, Cookies, Hot Chocolate) to eat while enjoying the lights. 

Santa said that by adhering to the above rules you won't get a lump of Reindeer Doody in your Stocking. Merry Christmas to all, and to all a good Yelp!

Not the largest Christmas light display in the history of mankind. We'll leave that for reality TV. If you want heart and continuity, however, year after year, this is the spot. Pick a background. Pose the kids. Come back again next year. Repeat.

Easily accessible. Just off 44th Street, south of Camelback. Parking can be a challenge, but there's always a spot somewhere on the street. Just don't block a driveway. The neighbors here deserve a bit of kindness in exchange for their amazing tolerance. 

Lots of lights to view. Bubbles for the kids to chase. Window displays full of animated characters. A courtyard in which to walk. Random Christmas decorations for sale. Donate a buck or two to help pay for the electricity. Enjoy hot cocoa ($1) and a cookie or Rice Krispie treat ($1). Let the kids wander in wonder.

One bit of bad news. The resident Christmas dog, now sixteen years old, has been forced into retirement for health reasons. That's 112 years of Christmas joy for us to be thankful for in dog years!

My wife and I took our sick and congested toddler over to see this tonight and had a really nice time.  There was so much for him to look at, he forgot all about being sick.  We also learned that he knows the words, "Mickey Mouse" and "Train!"  I'm really glad they opened their yard to us, and that there are no HOAs in Arcadia.

So excited to have Popeye's in Scottsdale!!! Went today and it was delicious as expected! Never going to KFC again!!!! Tuesday's you get 2 piece for under $2! And the Naked (no breeding) chicken tenders are off the charts... And a little spicy! Their mashed potatoes are better then most fancy places... I am already and fried chicken addict... But now it's close by... I am in so much trouble!!!

Popeye may need to feed his chickens some spinach. 
The tiniest pieces of chicken I've ever had (and ever seen, for that matter). Maybe this is what non-GMO chickens really look like?
The Lilliputian 3-piece was $7.55. Leg was 3 inches long.
Thought they'd given me a 2-piece, but set up the telescope and found the wing-ette at the bottom of the box under the thigh-ette.
My dog was not impressed.
12/17/15 it was awful. Cold an dc dry chicken strips. Coleslaw is not tasty canes hays the beat.

Brought the family to eat here for the 2nd time since they opened up recently and the 1st time everyone was friendly and kiss ass cause it was grandopening weekend and all the big wigs were present. Fastforward to today 180° No welcome mat, employees in the back cursing talking about other customers and not to mention it looks like a gang festival with employees having tatoos on theyre face and rags hanging out theyre pockets. I love popeyes food but will neer visit this 1 again. They were out of alot of drinks and were out of almost all deserts at 7pm. Not to mention i got called BRO. Fix it quick popeyes or your gonna lose buis fast

Staffed with people with a bad work ethic and bad attitudes. I have had bad experiences 3/5 times there. In one order they managed to screw up 3 times. I asked for Mild and got Spicy. Asked for BBQ got Buffalo. Ask for sweet tea got unsweetened. This was one order for just one person. Not to mention if you ask for something or point it out even the managers have attitude problems. I rather drive to the one at Broadway and Dobson.

Dumb, dumb, dumb as rocks here. Ordered a combo and it ended up in 3 different bags separate with another meal, wasn't spicy like ordered either. Then tried to order a single item off the kids menu which I know they can do but they insisted that item didn't exist as a meal OR item and I'm staring right at it. Ordered a side, didn't get that in my bag either, also ordered a drink and they neglected to tell me they removed it from the order but we still ended up with a kids meal bag? I have no idea... We even said we'd wait and we did wait a few minutes, I'm fine with that but don't tell me you don't have items I can see,  convince me to get something else and then not even give it to me properly.

AMAZING!!! We were driving to another Yelp find and saw the food truck.   We immediately flipped a 'b$tch' and parked.  The menu was short and sweet, just the way they should be.  I don't get when food establishments have a million items on their menus, how can you possibly prepare those perfectly every time?  It's not happening!! Every taco we ordered was made to perfection!  

I'm on the move so I'll finish this review up in a bit..my pics tell the story of what my mouth and belly so lovingly devoured!

Michael Reyes is a class act.  He does things well, and his new Paz Cantina food truck is no exception.  He is introducing empanadas, and I can't wait to try them.  He had duck empanadas today, but I didn't learn that until I'd already stuffed my face with two delicious pork belly tacos!

Oh, and he has a new location that looks to be long-term, next to Modified.

Amazing tacos! I tried them all! The smashed jalapeño margaritas are my fave of all time! Thanks Michael for owning such an awesome place, being so down to earth and taking time to meet your customers. You rock!

I have been dining at this location on a fairly regular basis over the last nine years ... Thrilled to walk in tonight and to find they have remodeled and revamped the menu.  As always the oysters and fish were fresh but tonight the atmosphere was fresh as well.  Servers were very attentive and knowledgeable.  

Tonight we had Naked Cowboy Oysters that were absolutely awesome!  The large Shushi platter that consisted of a variety of fish and roll - every piece fresh and tasty!

Oh yes even though the weather was not conducive this evening  I can't wait too try the new outdoor seating it looked very cozy and comfy..

If you haven't been in for awhile give it a try ... You will like it!

I haven't been in for several months.  As always they did not disappoint.  We started with the nawlins shrimp and kumomoto oysters.  MMMMM we both had the hazelnut crusted pacific salmon and it was so fresh and tasty its hard to believe we are this far from the ocean.  I have been going to Kings Fish House for at least 10 years and will keep coming back for this awesome food.  The service wasn't bad either.

The food was amazing! After living in the Pacific Northwest I feel like I know good seafood when I taste it. I almost never leave reviews, but this place deserves every star. Not only was the food amazing, but the service from our waitress, Anissa, took our experience to the next level. Plus the ambiance is really great to meet up with friends or for a date. I highly recommend this spot to anyone living in or visiting Vegas!

Just had a great experience here. The staff was gracious and attentive. My Mom was in the mood for surf and turf and after a Yelp search of the area we decided to give this place a try. Glad we did. I had grilled scallops which were good. I highly recommend the garlic mash! My Mom plate looked amazing and she loved it. Give this place a try!
Loved every little thing. The server, Ben, was a standout. Fantastic "Perfect Manhattan." The yellowtail carpaccio and sea bass were outstanding. We will be back!

Went in the other night with my boyfriend and had Paul as our server. Service was AWESOME! He was very knowledgable and able to help me find something on the menu even though I have allergies. Food was great and it was a nice atmosphere. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a relaxing evening out. We didn't have to worry about our drinks getting refilled and the food tasted great.

Packed out! Tons of Charlotteans, local venders and good eats. I thought 7th Street Market was a perfect venue, however I left wishing the booths were a little more spread out or a bit more space for the flow of traffic. Aside from that, I  enjoyed the beer on tap and hand crafted jewelry. A great event to pick up those last few Christmas gift on your list. I can't resist a pop up shop to support local venders.

Way too crowded! Seemed like there were lots of great vendors (I LOVE Muro jewelry) but we couldn't get within 5-feet of any tables. I was tolerating the crowds until I realized that all the exits were blocked/locked. We spent about 10 minutes trying to leave and went to have dinner at Queen City Q. Some crowd control (maybe timing entrances, selling tickets for a nominal fee, hosting 2-3 nights of the same market, etc.) would do this event good next year!

Great venue! I had an awesome time socializing and supporting local vendors. However, It was very crowded. The 7th Street Market isn't very big as it is, and then you add 50 vendors. It was a recipe for disaster, but I expected it. Especially, since there was free wine and cheese. In my opinion, It would have worked out better if the event was for a few days. It could give people more time to shop and enjoy their visit. 

Thanks Nikki for getting the "thank you" cards together. I am sure they will appreciate it. Also, Eric at Massage Works of Charlotte thank you for enlightening my day!

It's no secret: I freaking love 7th Street Public Market. The only way to make it better: add the holidays and some bubbly.

The market brought in dozens of amazing local vendors to set up for this pop up market. I know there were some complaints about the crowd. Personally, watching so many people come out to support local businesses was incredible. I just don't think there's such a thing as too much. The biggest problem was the very beginning because people mobbed trying to get their hands on a free glass of champs. Come on people, just go buy a drink. 

I bought a couple of really neat presents. I can write about both of them here because 1) I already gave Lauren's hers and 2) Hudson is a year and a half and cannot read this. For Lauren, I got a really cool hand-painted pallet sign about mermaids. For little Huddy Bear, I bought two books: the ABCs of Charlotte and the 123s of Charlotte. The authors signed both books for him. Very cool.

So, what do you need to know for this event: the market validates parking for 7th Street Station, but it's only good for 90 minutes. You'll have to pay for parking if you go past 90 minutes. If you plan to eat, take your food outside!! It gets pretty busy inside and there's limited places to grub. 

Shout out to Toni, Chris, Ben, all the regular market vendors, and all the pop ups for a fun evening. Thank you for supporting local and everything you do for uptown.

*My daughter dropped and cracked our Ipad air this morning and i was calling around to find a best price to get it fixed. I stumbled upon this store in yelp search and their pricing was way better than any other shop I called to. I was  closer to their Tempe location,  and saw that their business has already 5 stars in mesa. I dropped it off with Alex in Tempe and after 2 hours came to pick it up. Ipad looks like new now, the screen is fresh without any fingerprints or dirt. Thank you so much, you have made my day. I will recommend you to all my friends! *

I cracked my iPhone 6 screen one again, went to these guys since they are at Tempe now, got same excellent service as I did last time, walked out with my phone repaired 20 minutes later. I highly recommend them!

Just got my screen and battery fixed with these guys . The service was extremely quick and efficient !!! The guys were really polite !!! I am really pleased with the quality of the screen too. I definitely recommend this place !!!

Me and my sister had cracked screen on lg g4 and lg g3 phones. I found this place in tempe and dropped it off for repair. Alex said they wil be done in 2-3 hours. When i came back both phones were fixed and looked amazing. Thank you, now i have a trusted electronics repair shop that i can go to anytime.

Rapid iPhone repair is the best! These gentlemen have fixed my iPhones a few times now and they are the cheapest price around town and they can fix your phone faster than anyone. They just fixed my iPhone 6 glass and all in 15 minutes. This is the place to go for all of your iPhone repair needs!

This company is great. I have called and in 30 minutes they came to repair my phone screen. My iPhone 6 glass was replaced in less than 20 minutes He also installed a tempered glass screen protector on it. I also had IPad 2 glass that was cracked and he fixed that too on the spot in about an hour. But it doesn't stop here, these guys also fix Galaxy and LG phones. My sister had her LG G3 completely destroyed, the screen was just black, we thought its done, but he came back with a new Lcd for it and in an hour my sister's LG was like brand new, we were shocked. And to put a cherry on top we gave him my dad's Galaxy s 4 that just had cracked glass, and he put a new glass on it as well. He gave us discounts, since we had so much devices to fix, and we were thrilled. And the best part all of his work comes with warranty. I have called another guy on yelp and he wanted to charge more in order to include warranty. Don't look anywhere else, this is your one company for all your phones and tablet problems. Thank you so much Funny o Useful 1 Cool 0 Compliment a Activity Nearby Search More

The new edition to the Tunnel Espresso brand is fun and they make full use of the additional space they have. 
They have a couple benches and a nice big coffee table. 

At the time of this review they were serving espresso and filter drinks from Toronto roaster, Detour.  

The baked goods also looked appetizing and fresh. They have a wider selection then their original location. 

The espresso I received on my first visit was well pulled, given it was not from one of my favourite roasters (over roasted for my taste). The barista managed to hold off the acidity and keep it smooth. 

Overall an enjoyable experience.

so the newest tunnel espresso location located, like you expect, in a tunnel leading to the peel metro station. truth be told, i got lost as i went out the wrong way at the metro station. instead of going out by the les cours mont-royal shopping center, you go to the opposite exit (the stanley exit) and head into the tunnel which is where you'll find this café.

it feels like a fun treasure hunt, the kind you enjoy but at the end of it, there isn't a treasure. well, for me, the treasure was underwhelming.

as you may know by now, i've been very hard on new coffee shops as i expect them to change the coffee game instead of just jumping on the wagon and simply do coffee for the mass because that's what tunnel is doing.

the coffee they serve is from detour roaster which is no good to me. while it is easy to drink, there's barely any flavor or interesting notes besides being very similar to pilot, another GTA based roaster. i like my coffee strong, not bitter, just strong with a full body. that has notes, flavors that evoke a journey, something that pulls you in and makes you want more of it. i get nothing of such with tunnel.

on top of that, the price. it is pricey. its up there with the most expensive ones and similar to some, its not worth the asking price.

anyway, they are part of the indie passport so that was a good way to try them without spending your lunch money and i'm glad i didn't as it wasn't worth it in the end.

This is the second iteration of Tunnel Espresso Bar, the original being located in the tunnel between Eaton Center and Place Ville-Marie. 

Purposefully located in the tunnel leading to the Stanley Street exit of Peel metro station, breathing life into a semi-dead and dubious section of the underground, the coffee at this new Tunnel Espresso Bar is just as delicious as the original location. In fact, my husband and I are such fans that we stopped twice in the same day, before and after our visit at the Museum of Fine Arts. They serve one of my favorite latte in the city, featuring a finely tuned, creamy and balanced taste. Their chai latte is also very good. Their chewy and thick chocolate chip cookies are also trying.

Note that this new Tunnel Espresso Bar also features a resting area with benches and a table, a definite improvement that is much appreciated.

From now on, I'll only exit Peel from Stanley Street; a perfect excuse to grab a good coffee, matched with a friendly service!

You want your hair done right? Ahreum at Regis inside Paradise Valley Mall is the place to go!   Not kidding!   I've been to soooo many salons and not one stylist (don't even want to call them that, they were that terrible) could do my hair right.   Always uneven cuts.  Always picking the wrong hair color.   But Ahreum always gets it right!  I am so thankful I found her.   Great customer service great personality and professionally talented.   She has the skills that make me an average chick look chic and beautiful.   I always leave her chair feeling fresh and fashion forward!  She is my hair's hero. I go to her every 3 months for color cut wash and style.   Lets put it this way, she is so worth it to me that I live in Peoria and drive to Paradise Valley just for my hair but that's how much I trust her and that's how much I love what she does with my hair! 
Thank you Ahreum for always knowing what to do with my hair!!

Ahreum is simply AMAZING! She knows exactly what I wanted and also gave me advise on what color will look good on my skin tone. I'm happy with the results each and every time. She is very knowledgable and highly skills. She always made sure I leave happy and looking splendid. The price is so affordable for the quality of work she does. I highly recommend going her!

I would come to Ahreum every day for a wash and deep conditioning if I could! She always does a great job and I always feel like she really listens to what I want. It's hard to find good customer service and she is amazing! I'm so happy to have found Ahreum. She doesn't try to push products on you and she always takes her time and is very talented!

I live in Alaska and every time  I stop by Arizona, I get my hair done by Ahreum. She always knows exactly what I want and I absolutely love my hair every time! Thank you so much Ahreum! I'll see you soon!

L'événement était super! Belle ambiance et le personnel est tellement ''chill''! Je ne connaissais pas cette boutique avant de participer à cet événement et je suis ravis à l'idée d'avoir ce type de commerce à Montréal. J'y ai trouvé un polo vraiment chouette à un prix bien abordable. Francesca  a été très serviable et patiente. 

Merci à l'équipe Yelp pour cette soirée!


The event was so cool! Nice atmosphere and the staff is so '' chill ''! I didn't knew this store before participating to the event and I am glad to have this type of business in Montreal. I found a really nice polo at a very affordable price. Francesca was very helpful and patient.

Thanks to Yelp for this cool evening!

I've never been to Frank & Oak before, but I've seen the name and I was curious, so when I saw Yelp was hosting an event for the new store launch I was very excited.  This is also my first official Elite event, double yay!

I'm keeping the focus of the review on the event, but there will be some overlap with regard to impressions of the store.

Firstly, I really liked the store itself.  Being on Stanley between de Maisonneuve and Sainte Catherine, you're already in a difficult position if you drive, because parking is in short supply, and construction has cut down the number of spots even more.  The inside of the store makes it worthwhile, it's really beautiful, and it was a great location for a Yelp event.

I really liked the clothing donation aspect as well.  Frank & Oak are starting a program where they will match clothing donations, so we were all encouraged to bring coats, sweaters, and socks!  It really made me feel included, and allowed me to give something back, which you know, gives me that warm fuzzy feeling inside.

It was great to see other fellow Yelpers and meet new people, I always love the Yelp community spirit!

The food and drinks were very nice too, I haven't had a maple cream in a really long time.  It was also nice to have a few vegetarian options (mind you, for all that I love grilled cheese sandwiches, a few vegetables would be nice too).

Thanks again to the Yelp team!

Frank & Oak est une jeune compagnie montréalaise en pleine expansion. Cette nouvelle boutique en est la preuve. Trois étages de vêtements pour homme de qualité, des accessoires et des produits pour le corps, un barbier, un bar à café Névé, tout est conçu afin de rendre l'expérience de magasinage plus agréable pour ces messieurs hipsters. Tant mieux, car personnellement, je trouve qu'il n'y a pas grand choix en guénille pour le sexe opposé! 

Le party? Super sympa, ambiance très relaxe, j'ai beaucoup parlé avec les employés--employées (très gentils et gentilles, en passant!) Au troisième, il y a ce salon hyper confortable, comme à la maison, avec de bons fauteuils. Très populaire auprès de la gente de Yelp! Au deuxième, il y avait de la musique avec deux DJ endiablés et des gars qui se faisaient faire la barbe ou le toupet par les coiffeurs de la place. Zut! Ça avait l'air tellement bon que je regrette de ne pas avoir de poil au menton. Les gars, c'est un must à essayer! Finalement, au premier, il y avait de bonnes bouchées de sandwiches. Coup de coeur pour le grilled--cheese et le banh mi! Miam! Un photomaton était également à notre disposition. J'espère qu'ils le garderont, car c'est amusant se faire tirer le portrait et l'envoyer par courriel! Bonne idée! Vin chaud et bières locales de Saint--Ambroise et Mc Lauslan nous ont rincé le gorgotton. J'ai terminé la soirée en beauté avec un café latte pour adulte (aka avec de la boisson Sortilège, une crème au whisky et sirop d'érable). À boire entre grands quand les enfant sont couchés... 

Merci à café Névé, aux employés--employés de Frank & Oak, à Yelp et à Risa. Soigne--toi bien ma belle et revient nous en forme pour 2016! Yelpeurs et Yelpeuses: Keep Calm and Write More Reviews!

L'événement était super ! Je connaissais déjà Frank & Oak, ayant "découvert" par hasard leur boutique sur St-Viateur en allant au café Névé, mais cette succursale sur Stanley est beaucoup plus spacieuse ! Au cours de l'événement, j'ai eu l'occasion de visiter la boutique en compagnie d'un styliste (Arkadi, vraiment attentionné !) qui m'a donné de judicieux conseils et un bel aperçu des services et produits disponibles en boutique (et en ligne). Dès notre entrée, on peut prendre un petit café à siroter pendant notre séance de magasinage. Il y a aussi un barbier au 2e étage. Leur Hunt Club me semble un service vraiment intéressant : pour 20$ par an, on peut recevoir des vêtements à essayer chez soi. On ne paye que ce qui nous plaît et le reste peut être retourné sans frais ! Les vêtements sont à bon prix et de belle qualité. C'est vraiment un lieu qui mérite d'être découvert. Merci à toute l'équipe de Yelp Montréal et aux employés de Frank & Oak pour cette belle soirée !

grrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrreat event!!!!!!!!!!! 

Firstly, I am HUGE fan of Frank & Oak since the beginning when they were subscription only. I signed up with my brother's name for email newsletters. Nobody I know wears Frank & Oak, you know why? Because no man I know is stylish enough to care.

If I can support our Canadian brand in any way, I would. I love the idea behind the company, I love the clothes they make. So when Yelp partnered up with Frank & Oak, I was beyond happy!! But wait a minute, I still don't know any man stylish enough to care!!!! (even though I talk about you all the time!!!)

Then it occurred to me that my Belgium classmate receives compliments about his style EVERYWHERE he goes. I signed him up as my +1 and OMG did we have an amazing time.

The store is fabulous!!!!! THREE FLOORS, you must be kidding me!!!!!!!! This is unreal! Most delicious sandwiches ever, I had seconds! In fact I had four "seconds!" The warm wine upstairs is delicious. I also had seconds.

Staff is courteous. So fantastic. And WOW thank you so much for the generosity with donations!!! What a beautiful idea and just in time for Christmas! Even though I moved recently with little precious clothing, I managed to find something to donate. Again if I can support this lovely Canadian brand in any way, I would! I'm super proud of you.

Thank you Risa for this incredible evening! LOTS OF LOVES XO

I was introduced to the Frank & Oak brand about a year ago, by a friend. However, not being a dude myself, I never really felt a pressing need to check these guys out until this event. 

First, I love that F&O are a local brand. Second, I like that they incorporate other local brands into their concept - think Nevé and Cherc's, for example. Now let's get down to business. The space is spread out onto three floors; on the main floor, you'll find some awesome quality clothing and the café. Next up, the barber shop on the 2nd floor - I think there might be some clothes up there too, but I was distracted by all the beards around me so can't say for sure. Finally, the 3rd floor is where the fellows can try on their gear and get more personalized service such as the help of a stylist. The shop is simple but cool, urban, most definitely hipster-inspired. It's basically a one-stop shop for the guys, in the downtown core, something that was lacking.

The F&O guys were super friendly, the DJ kicked ass, and the food was damn good! I went back for like, five helpings of 'seconds.' Hey don't judge! Grilled cheese. Mmmmm. Anyway, we also got to try some mulled wine and the barista was ready to whip up your coffee of choice, on demand. 

I'm pretty sure I'll pop in for a quick coffee once in a while. OK, maybe be it'll be for the eye candy...

Great event - thanks RD!

Like a child on Christmas Eve, eager, anxious and hopeful, I've anticipated the grand opening of this particular Amelie's for months. Let's just say, good things, without a doubt, come to those who wait! My first step into this Amelie's was equivalent to rubbing your eyes Christmas morning to reveal a mountain of shiny presents. I was utterly delighted with a spark in my twinkling eyes. 

Let's begin with the space. This used to be an old cafeteria that lost its spark years ago, and lacked the tender, love and care it needed. I would constantly walk by when it was being renovated. Seeing how Amelie's has transformed the space from its nascent, melancholy state, to the beautiful, artistic ambiance it now radiates, is amazing. They did a great job of utilizing all of the space and even implemented an event/banquet space upstairs. There's plenty of room in the open space and even quieter areas if you need to study. I can't wait to use the patio when it's warmer! Without a doubt, I'm in love. 

Now to the important part, the bakery! Despite the novel space, Amelie's still retains its roots of delicious macarons, salted caramel brownies, fruit tarts and everything near and dear to its origin. The delicious, creative drinks still linger on the walls inside golden frames and yes, the kitchen still makes those delicious soups and sandwiches! Actually, I believe this where they are making most, if not all, of the delicious treats to be distributed to their other stores. 

Last, and possibly the most highly anticipated part, this Amelie's serves wine and beer! And you thought Amelie's couldn't get any better :)

I'm so proud of Amelie's and how far it has gone since its first opening. I saw Amelie's when it was the local's best kept secret gem. Now, they've expanded to several locations, and even cities! I hope they continue to expand and one day, I'll have the opportunity to say that it all started right here in my hometown, Charlotte, North Carolina!

Lots to say about the new uptown Amelie's! Foremost: I am glad it's arrived. My office is conveniently nested 22 floors above, so it's nice to have a new joint for grabbing a cup of caffeine in the morning. That they sell pastries and (hooray!) wine* is icing on the cake. 

That said, I have mixed emotions, which are due entirely to the fact that I "grew up" with the flagship store in NoDa. I spent many a'night crammed into the original, tiny space, reading a book that I didn't understand, pretending to be way more hip than I was. It has a special place in my bank of young-20-something memories and that makes the standards to which I hold any Amelie's location very high. 

Specific to this location: certain aspects of the decor feel a little forced; while others seem very natural and suited to the Amelie's brand. The service is still getting it's legs beneath it, which is to be expected, but of the three times I've been in this week, two of those times came with flat-out terrible service. And the food menu is more limited than I expected, and a bit pricey (no real surprise there, and for the occassional treat it's totally worth it).

Still, it's a nice change of pace in the uptown area. And poor service and high prices be damned: I will never not crave any given one of their pastries, sandwiches, tartines, and soups. The bar area is being executed nicely, too. I think the addition of booze (wine & beer) was a very wise choice, and probably my favorite part about this new location, but that could be because I'm a wino**

In summation: the Amelie's brand is an endearing one, and I am proud that it got its start in the Queen City. I'm optimistic that, as this location grows into its own, and some of the new-store-shine fades, it will deveop it's own rhythm and character, and turn into a new favorite. 

*but not before 5pm, right, suuuuure, nudge-nudge-wink

**okay maybe not a bonafide wino, but kudos, Amelie's, for offering a nice place to "wine" down (see what I did there?!) after a long day in the office

I love it! 

Of all 3 other Amélie's locations in Charlotte, this brand spanking new one is, hands-down, my favorite. The decor and ambiance is true to the Amèlie's brand (blue, quirky, flea-market-chic and whimsical), but everything is just newer. All the employees are obviously excited to be there; it's got that "yay! We've just opened and we're all excited!" vibe to it. 

The split-level layout makes for plenty of seating and there are plenty of nooks and crannies that allow for privacy if you're wanting some quiet to study/work or converse. 

My rating is more 4.5 stars because I've had better pastries. They try to be authentically French, but I find something amiss. I mean, it's still good, but bring a native French person here and I could see them saying something similar. 

Tons of gorgeous natural lighting thanks to the tall windows, wonderful aromas and tastes of coffee and pastries, whimsical music. What's not to like?

(Tip: try the Brown Butter Pecan café crème! It's divine!)

Visited this new spot of Amelie's in Uptown. Consistent design and very spacious place as all their other locations. Staff tries to be friendly but very unprofessional. I had to pick my pastry and stay in the line to pay for it (with it in my hands). At the register I ordered one drink ( I was sold for its extravagant name) but couldn't get information about its content, 2 of the register attendants did not know the product. After I paid I went to the bar to wait for my order. Since it was 10 min after I ordered my drink, I started eating my desert, that unfortunately looked much better than tasted. Really heavy and flavorless filling in a soggy burnt shell. It definitely stayed in the fridge for a couple of days. Finally when I got my drink it wasn't what I ordered and it took them a while to figure out why it happened and to exchange it for the right thing. I think the general opinion of this place is overestimated.

Amelie's new location is the best thing that's happened to Uptown Charlotte since Romare Bearden park opened! 

I met a colleague for breakfast at Amelie's this morning and could not have been more pleased with the location! The space is huge, beautifully decorated, and can accommodate a lot of people without making patrons feel cramped or claustrophobic. 

Amelie's uptown location serves the same stellar food, including amazing baked delectables and stellar tea and coffee as the NoDa location, but is smack in the middle of Charlotte's central business district. 

While I didn't partake in the consumption of any adult beverages this morning, Amelie's is definitely going to be added to a list of places to duck in for a glass of wine after work or before attending an event at one of the nearby cultural venues. I'm not sure how extensive the wine list is, but I know they serve bubbly -which is all I really need. 

Amelie's checks a lot of boxes for me... If you're uptown and in a rush for a quick bite or some caffeine, get Amelie's to go. If you're uptown and need a quiet space for self reflection -find a quiet corner of Amelie's, bring some earbuds, and enjoy the free wifi. If you're uptown and need to have an informal business meeting, go to Amelie's and enjoy their diverse selection of couches, bistro tables,  and other seating options. Whatever you do, just go to Amelie's!!!
The. Best. I love this new location, the staff is amaze balls and of course, everything is delicious! Great chefs, great management, great spot.

This is the brand new Cafe Rio right of 215 beltway on Durango. It's big and beautiful inside. The food is amazing just like all the other Cafe Rios. Because it's new, the lines are long around lunch and dinner time so expect 10 mins or so. The line keeps moving though so don't sweat it.  Also parking is limited due to construction but there are more spots out behind the building. 

I really enjoy the salads but make sure and tell them shredded lettuce because its more bite sized. Also ask for a scoop of Fresca sauce if you want to add a little spicy salsa.

Burritos are good too but get them to put pico and lettuce inside. Always get it enchilada(smothered) style so they send it through and melt down the cheese and sauce. I usually do mild(green sauce) with the chicken or seafood and the red sauce with Pork or beef as its a bit sweet.

So happy to have a location down the street from my house now. Gonna have to start walking here to work off all the calories. ;-)

I got the tostada bowl and wasn't too impressed. The tostada wasn't what I expected with a flat round on the bottom. The chicken is way too spicy for my liking. Guac is also over spiced. Skimpy on filling the bowl but over flows with lettuce unlike other locations. Gave us a punch card but didn't fill it out for today's order. I'll stop by again in a few months after the newness wares off.
Heckkkkkkk yesssssss they finally opened a location near us!!!!!!!!! I'm so happy!!!!!!!!  I love cafe rio it completely craps on chipotle!!!!!!!!

Just tried cafe rio after seeing that it just opened and reviews seemed to be pretty good so far. I ordered the grilled chicken burrito. .. rice was over cooked and bland, the meat and salsas were also very bland. I had them load up the hot salsa and it was milder than the mild from Chipotle. Yes, I'm going there. .. I'd drive the extra 3 miles to get a Chipotle burrito over the cafe rio one that is right down the street from me. 
The place is spacious and set up well and the staff is friendly. However, I go to restaurants mostly for the quality of food.

I have been to all the Cafe Rios in Vegas, this new location is BY FAR the most CUSTOMER FRIENDLY, freshest food, AND has all products on the menu even close to closing!! I will make the drive to this location every time!  THANK YOU to the friendly staff with great smiles and politeness you can't find in too many places today.  It's nice to served by people who get along and enjoy what they do.  Loyal customer from this day on!!
Mediocre at best, overpriced!! $15 for a burrito and drink. What restaurant charges extra for "grilling" the meat???? These guys do

Over priced el polo loco ..only thing that's pretty decent about this chain is the home made , fresh tortillas otherwise I really don't understand the big boner , hype about this place ! Please !! Eat some real Mexican food ppl you wouldn't even know what good , authentic Mexican food is in this town

This is a brand new Cafe Rio and I am ecstatic that they finally opened one in this area! Cafe rio has always been one of my favorite dine in mexican places!!! Of course, go for the enchilada style burrito, steak salad or shrimp taco special only on Saturdays! The BEST dealis always going to be the special of the day. Remember to bring in your stamp card for a free meal after 10 stamps. They need the strawberry lemonade in the drinks area just like the Summerlin location.

Talk about a Grocery  Store Concord NC you finally got a Publix 
Do Not take my word for it check out the new Publix  on Weddington  Road just down the road from Afton Ridge. YOU will be surprised  there are grocery  stores  like this

This is a Publix Household Now! Let me tell you why:

Quality. The freshness of produce you find at Publix is second to none. It actually reminds me of a CERTAIN grocery store chain that has their roots in Charlotte, that unfortunately have slipped over the years in freshness of produce. The meat department and deli also has the best selection and quality I have seen.

Service. Blown away by the staff here. It is an absolute pleasure to talk with the people in this store. Helpful and friendly, the staff I have talked to are also very knowledgeable in their department.

History. Publix cares about their brand, people, and community. Unlike virtually every other chain in the Charlotte-Metro, Publix is an Employee-Owned company. Whereas the other major grocery stores in Charlotte are publicly traded and your average shareholder has no interest in the actual business, only the profits it produces. Publix is so passionate about their business because they put their money where their mouth is and are truly invested in their own success!

My career path gives me a distinct opportunity to see what every major chain is doing, and Publix is above and beyond the competition; in fact, they set the bar and put it on the shelf where the kids cant reach it! Congratulations to Denise and your Team, looking forward to many visits here!!!!

My house is a Publix Household Now! Let me tell you why:

Quality. The freshness of produce you find at Publix is second to none. It actually reminds me of a CERTAIN grocery store chain that has their roots in Charlotte, that unfortunately have slipped over the years in freshness of produce. The meat department and deli also has the best selection and quality I have seen.

Service. Blown away by the staff here. It is an absolute pleasure to talk with the people in this store. Helpful and friendly, the staff I have talked to are also very knowledgeable in their department.

History. Publix cares about their brand, people, and community. Unlike virtually every other chain in the Charlotte-Metro, Publix is an Employee-Owned company. Whereas the other major grocery stores in Charlotte are publicly traded and your average shareholder has no interest in the actual business, only the profits it produces. Publix is so passionate about their business because they put their money where their mouth is and are truly invested in their own success!

My career path gives me a distinct opportunity to see what every major chain is doing, and Publix is above and beyond the competition; in fact, they set the bar and put it on the shelf where the kids cant reach it! Congratulations to Denise and your Team, looking forward to many visits here!!!!

Like most people around here, on Dec 2nd when they had their grand opening I checked it out and yes the store is new and clean and they were giving out free samples but the prices were scary expensive. Don't get me wrong, there were some deals like the buy one get ones but overall I'd say Food Lion is cheaper by far for the same exact thing. With stores like food lion, aldis and trader joes I just don't see them doing that well here. Sorry I just can't afford almost $2 for a yogurt and expensive wines and cheese. Pretty disappointed when I saw how inflated the prices were... No thanks.

Love the breads and pastries! My favorite was the chocolate croissant. I have been a few times now for lunch too and have to say my fav has been the BBQ chicken pizza. Such amazing flavor to the chicken; and the BBQ sauce is my kind of sauce! Perfect amount of sweet and hot.

The ambience is so nice all the decor is so neat and vintage. Oh and sodas!!! Vintage rootbeer brands you cant find anywhere...all in one place for just 2 bucks, I took a few of those home for later. My wife may of had to tell me to "Mucho take it easy" with the soda purchases. 

They also have a little bakery attached with a window where you can watch all the deliciousness come to life...that was my kids favorite part, made it a fun experience for them.

Im so glad Merchant Square added this restaurant and cafe; it will be an even better experience going there....one with dripping BBQ sauce and needed napkins. 

Did I mention the rootbeers?

Oh man, this was so good. I can't wait to go back! I had the pulled pork sandwich, which was absolutely perfect. The pork was cooked perfectly, wasn't greasy or drippy, the slaw was so fresh, the baked-in-house bun was toasted just right, and the BBQ sauce was the perfect blend of sweet and spicy. We also had a Pero latte, which was so nice on a chilly morning, and oh maybe 4 chocolate croissants. So excited about this original new place to eat!

Where do I even begin? This is going to be my new favorite spot, how about there? We had the cheddar ale soup. We had the tri-tip chili. Had several of the sandwiches. (We got several and shared). The Cuban was great. The Pizza looked great. They have a barista that is amazing. They have a salted caramel brownie that I named crack. Wow. I can't wait to go back and try more. One thing that I love is they have a ton of different bottled sodas to choose from too. The candied bacon cream soda was my favorite. For
