Reals. It's good. If you are looking for some great BBQ. Some great sandwiches. Soups, chilies. Desserts. Whatever.  They have it. It's a place I will keep visiting. I'm posting several pics too so you can see but this place is better than 5 starts. If you live anywhere near Chandler GO NOW!!!

Fresh baked bread, any soda you can think of, and some local history to boot. And oh yeah, the food is amazing! We ate here for lunch while antiquing in Merchant Square. The food is fresh and the staff was great. They said they will be expanding the menu soon so I will definitely be back to try the new stuff.

My first time here so I can't speak for everything but I got the 1/2 salad/soup lunch. Chicken Caesar and Cheddar Ale. The salad was very good, but the soup was awesome!  Staff was super friendly.  They have amazing selection of craft soda. I don't drink soda, but for soda lovers you will like it. Will be back on AM to try coffee. Great atmosphere.

I've been wanting to try this place since it opened and did not disappointment.   Rustic homemade bread for their sandwiches, gourmet salads, and more.   Look forward coming back to try the rest of the menu.
This was the location of the original Fuzzy's Pizza which was outstanding! Gave it a try. Its pretty good. Worth a try

Great food and even better people! A huge improvement over Fuzzys. The veggie pizza was amazing, and wings were fantastic. Will definitely be coming back. It's a breath of fresh air having a great pizza joint in the neighborhood.

If you think your calling Fuzzys your not.  Same number as they took over Fuzzys  and the phone was answered with "please hold" ... Not thank you for calling Vinnies. We ordered our regular Fuzzys thin crust (thinking we were calling Fuzzys as usual!) and thought all was good until the pizza was delivered.  It was not thin crust or cut in Fuzzys squares..that was our first clue..when I called to tell them the crust was wrong, I was informed they were no longer Fuzzys and they didn't have thin crust...  Only hand tossed. Oh really???  You would think that at least the phone would be answered "Vinnies" to let people know they are no longer Fuzzys... Also why not tell us when we ordered thin crust that they don't have it? The pizza was cold and the crust was not cooked all the way and tasted like raw flour...yuck!  The sauce tasted like spagettios... Yuck! They even forgot the requested crushed pepper.  Fuzzys thin crust and great sauce will be missed...  As for Vinnies...I thought it was very misleading and I was very disappointed with the pizza.  If I could ask for my money back I would.

It's not surprising to me to hear this place's original location is known as the "Best Pizza in Cottonwood Arizona" because Cottonwood isn't exactly a mecca for great pizza or food. 

The most honest review I could give this place is that I think they should have taken their time and not rushed so quickly to open. They just don't seem ready and polished at this point.

I really loved Fuzzy's, and am sad to see them go. Because I live right across the street, I will keep giving Vinnie's another try until they truly disappoint me, but so far everything I've gotten from here has been decidedly "meh".

So, I've been stalking this place for months waiting for it to open. Seriously. And I'm so happy to see it finally open!! What a gorgeous restaurant! And great food! I can tell already that they will be a wonderful addition to the Madison food scene. 

First up, the atmosphere: It's beautiful inside. It feels like a place you'd want to hang out. More tables than bar space, but that works considering their menu! Asian themed without being too in your face or stereotyping.

The drinks: I loved the Tokyo mule! Just the right amount of spice for me, with the fun choice of soju instead of vodka. I also got the mono no aware, which was good too, but perhaps a little too complex to have with dinner. Lots of good flavor layers. Andrew at the bar was very nice and checked in with me to make sure everything was good.

The food: Woo! All your favorites from Umami are here too! The classic pork buns, renamed the "o.g." pork buns here, accurately, are still on point. I tried to get the new and different options though, so I left the awesome ramen for another day and sampled the korean spicy wings (split with another), the chicken bun (split), the sashimi, and the beef noodle soup. Amazingly, it didn't end up being too much food... Not sure if that's a good thing or a bad thing, but definitely good for this trial experience! 
The crispiness of wings was very good, but could have just a little more time in the marinade. The chicken bun was very yummy, but... I think I would choose the pork bun over it. How can you pass up those pork buns?!?!? Definitely worth getting though, and now I'm considering a future where I just get buns for dinner... The sashimi was good, but a little expensive for my tastes. 6 pieces for $16 is a hefty price tag, even though they were fresh and good sized pieces. Finally, the beef noodle soup. Pretty good! Udon noodles, to me, aren't exactly the right noodles to go with that soup (I prefer skinny noodles) but the broth was very good. I was hesitant since the menu mentioned some spices I don't normally associate with beef noodle soup, but it was very well balanced!

The service: The one drawback to our experience. Not that this was bad service at all (but my friends also tell me I'm too nice about this sort of thing, so be your own judge)! Seems like they've just got some kinks to work out. Our group of six first got seated at the sushi bar. Okay, cool view, but kind of odd because then we couldn't actually talk, so we requested to change to a table, which they were very nice about. The ordering was a bit hapazard--my side of the table ordered appetizers and the other side ordered their full meals, which we figured out after a little while and caught up on ordering, but that meant our food came out at weird times. There also was some confusion on what we ordered and who ordered what; one of my friends got served another table mates' order and proceeded to eat it, thinking he misordered, and we only discovered the mixup when his original entree showed up. Again, they were very nice about it and comped the meal of the poor guy without a dinner, but definitely unexpected!

First night jitters? Overall, TL;DR: we will be back! Good food, great atmosphere, they might just need a little time to settle into being open!

Amazing atmosphere and concept. What a beautiful and welcoming place. The menu is a delight, it doesn't often happen that I come across this many options that I'd like to try. 
Highlight for me was the ponzu steak with frites, incredibly tender and tasteful steak. Mushroom skewers were another highlight, with a delicate taste of their yakitori grill. 
I was delighted to see that their amazing buns from Umami made it onto the menu. Prices are very fair. 
Can't wait to come back.

I wanted to love this experience because I was SO excited for Tavernakaya to open. Of course I had to go opening week, and perhaps due to that newness factor, I had the unfortunate experience of suffering through some definite issues that need fixing. First, positives- the space is strikingly beautiful, the menu had something for everyone, and our server was very sweet and attentive in the face of what was probably a really stressful night for her.  My boyfriend declared his General Tso's Chicken ($14) flawless, and my daughter went with the classic miso ramen, which was every bit as good as it is at Umami (Tavernakaya's sister spot).  

Now, the issues- the one thing everyone in our party was irritated by was that it was absolutely freezing in the restaurant.  Most tables around us complained; we just kept our winter coats on. The glass doors which make up the front of the space, seemingly designed to give TK (as our server kept calling it) an inside/out feel in warmer seasons, don't shut all the way- or weren't properly sealed- whatever the issue, a 32 degree breeze was drifting through the dining room the whole time.  Secondly, when my friend ordered her sushi roll, we were warned that it would take some time. Our server said sushi was running 40 minutes to an hour wait. She ordered it anyway.  Her roll (just one maki roll) did indeed take an hour, but to Tavernakaya's credit, they did not charge her for it- which was a welcome and appropriate surprise.  

I've been to several other izakaya style restaurants and totally love them- I especially like robata skewers and the shareable plate style menu- so I appreciate what Tavernakaya's trying to do, but the skewers I ordered were both problematic. Shiitake mushrooms were bone dry and extremely salty- and $8 for 8 small mushrooms total (about 4 to a skewer).  That portion at that price didn't seem apace with the pork belly skewers, which were also $8 and probably twice the size, and accompanied with a fantastic spicy mustard. Alas, the pieces of pork belly- nearly all of them, all but one in fact- had tiny chunks of bone in them, which made it hard to enjoy, especially off a skewer.  I ordered hot sake; it came out cold; I said I'd drink it anyway.  Second hot sake also came out cold.  Our poor server finally admitted they didn't really have a "hot" sake- only "warm" and chilled. Timing and service aside from our main server was weird- over the course of the night, 3 other people dropped food and drinks at our table, and I do mean dropped. Everything came out separately (not a single plate came out at the same time) and was set on our table unceremoniously and silently (followed by the surly expediter abruptly turning away).   After eating the two sets of skewers, I was still quite hungry, so figured I'd pony up for a large plate.  I ordered the Miso Salmon ($19) which was described as broiled miso-marinated salmon with bok choy.  That's exactly what it was. What it wasn't: a "large plate." I wouldn't even call it a lunch portion.  The salmon was okay- good flavor- but the bok choy was literally one stalk of baby bok choy, sliced in half, steamed to a slightly tough al dente with no sauce, butter, or seasoning to speak of.  Quite bizarre- almost as though it had been microwaved.  The salmon itself was about half the size I'd expect for that price. (or as my friend pointed out, about a third the size of Tempest's entree salmon- maybe 3 ounces?) It also came with a side of rice, which hadn't been on the menu... I don't eat rice so left that aside.  Finally, my friend's sushi roll ($17 for the T.K. Bay:
Scallop, cucumber & tempura crunch topped with wasabi shrimp salad) came out, which she said was alright, but definitely smaller (8 pieces) and less filling than cheaper rolls at Red or Muramoto. 

I think there's a TON of potential for Tavernakaya, but I hope they figure out portioning/pricing /staffing soon.  Other friends who also saw fit to eat there in week one had better experiences ordering some of the more "standby" options like pork buns, dumplings, etc. It would be great to be able to enjoy the beautiful atmosphere and leave full and happy- I predict that once the kinks are worked out, I'll be there all the time.

My wife and I were venturing out on our first date since the birth of our daughter. So our expectations were a bit high and Tavernakya did not disappoint. It was their first Friday night since opening and there were some service related signs of being new. I think at least 3 dishes were brought to our table that we did not order, only to be immediately removed. But overall service was quick, attentive and friendly. 

And the food, so good. We ordered the chicken wings, steak and beef noodles. All excellent and just the right amount for two hungry, sleep deprived and overly excited to be out of the house adults.

I've been here twice already during their opening week.  So far everything I've tried has been pretty good.  Chicken wings, pork buns, spare ribs were solid.  The best thing on the menu is there three cup chicken.  I can just order that as my meal and be very happy.

I would go back and would recommend folks to try.

We went on a Friday night. The waitress explained the restaurant as a fusion between Japanese and a Wisconsin tavern. 

If 3.5 stars were an option that is what I would give them.
I ordered a Toyko Mule which had so much ginger I could barely drink it.  We decided to split some dishes. First we ordered the gyoza.  The pork dumplings were okay.  They had a lot of fluid in them which made them virtually impossible to eat with chopsticks. I dropped one of mine on the table but ate  it anyways.  Next we ordered the TKO sushi roll. It had bacon, pineapple, avocado and seared tuna. It didn't taste bad but with Muramoto around the corner you have to do better.  Next up was a pork belly skewer. Dry and boring.  Finally we got the Udon XO which was the best dish of the night.  It was flavorful and tasted like great lo mein.

The service was pretty decent considering how new they are.

Worth a second try but they need to up their game if they are going to survive on the square.

So this is a mixed review. The waitress was not good. We sat at the sushi bar and everyone was getting service except for us. At about 10-15 minutes of waiting we talked about leaving. The guy making the sushi saw that we hadn't had anyone to see us. He got our waitress and got service. They gave us a free night time appetizer for the wait. The popcorn chicken is really good. We had sashimi and a couple of rolls. The food was very good. We had to remind our waitress that we got soup. Overall everyone was very nice and welcoming. The food was so good that it is  worth another try. We will go in the evening. Nice atmosphere. No low sodium soy sauce but they are new.

This is a tough one. I really wanted to give them a better rating. 

I ordered the shrimp tempura udon noodle bowl. Noodles were very chewy. I sent it back and ordered the 3 cup Taiwanese Chicken instead. The chicken coating was gummy and the dark meat inside was very fatty. It arrived lukewarm as the replacement for my previous dish. 

My daughter loved the chef's choice sushi she ordered. It came with a California roll. The hub had veggie fried rice. He liked it because it was moist and not greasy. They shared Korean fried chicken wings, which they said were very, very good.

On a previous visit I did try the veggie bun with crispy tofu, and that is by far my favorite right now. 

The atmosphere is mostly ahead of the food that I have tried so far. I'd probably come back to the veggie bun, but that's about it.

It's nice not to chase the truck around town. Got here on the second day of soft opening. Nice decor. High tech menu board. Simple menu of five specialty burgers and a few additional items. Went with the Kinoko Burger because of the mushrooms and teri sauce. Flavor was spot on. Fries were crispy. Food took a while to come out but it was worth the wait. The owner, Noel, is a friend. Was nice seeing him there. Good luck, Bro. Nice job! This location is on Jones in China Town in front of 168.

Huge fan of Fuku, Not a huge fan of food trucks. Thrilled that the Fuku gang opened a location off the strip and not in a truck! Great new location, same amazing food and service.  Honestly one of the best burgers I've had.

OMG finally! I am so beyond thrilled that this location is finally open. I love the truck but always trying to track it down and find where it's at is not so great.

I'm a creature of habit so I always go with the spicy burger. Never a disappointment. I also recommend the Jazz fries, so good! 

You won't find anything else like Fuku in Vegas and it's worth the wait if you end up with one since it can get easily super busy in a flash.

The only advice I have is to get there early before the dinner rush or take it to go since it's pretty tiny in the dining room.

This location opened just a few days ago, so expect it to be a work in progress

great to have a second location and not have to go to the strip to enjoy a Fukuburger

In any case, like I said, they are new at this location, so expect a few bumps
ordered 3 burgers to go, a fukuburger with sauce on side, a tamago burger, and a kinoko burger.....wait wasn't too bad, but they did serve in trays for dine in rather than containers to go. not a big deal, but still?

also ordered a side of garlic fries, and the one with fuku sauce and brown gravy
they did pack these correctly in to go containers

the burgers were good, maybe a bit on pricey side, but still decent value
burgers and fries came to a bit under 40 bucks

my friends had the fukuburger and the tamago
they both said they were good, not spectacular, but pretty good burgers none the less

the garlic fries were a bit on the plain side, but the sauces that came with them fixed that
the gravy fries were good too, just not sure if I liked the fuku sauce on them in addition to brown gravy.....we finished em though!

I had the kinoko burger, and am still undecided on this one
I enjoy mushroom burgers, but not sure if the shitake mushrooms are better than a good mushroom swiss burger!  It was decent, I liked the amount of pickled red ginger on it as well. Not too much, just enough to accent the burger.

will be back for a visit again soon, definitely worth it, especially since the location doesn't require an awful visit to the Hawaiian marketplace! enough said!!!!

FINALLY there's Fuku burger in China town!!! 


Saw the sign few days ago but yelp wasn't showing it up. But they are now! Honestly I'm stoked they open a one in China Town besides the truck and the one in Las Vegas blvd. One beacuse tracking fown the truck is hard since it's no where near where I live and two driving in LV blvd is just asking for a never ending migrain. So today had the pleasure having fuku burger for lunch with my sis. Had to warn you though you will not find parking closer to the restaurant. I had to park way on the other side of the parking lot on 168 Market. But its worth it! 

Ordered Tomago burger, Katsu burger and Togarashi garlic fries to go and glad I did beacuse the restaurant was packed! What can I say they except were bomb! Chicken katsu was so big my sis had to cut it in half. But hey no complain here. Tomago burger is exactly the way I like it! Crunchy fried onions, slightly runner egg and well done patty. Had to say I am still full and this would be my go to burger place from now on.
Amazing food my wife and I love Us Some Fuku Burger We Used to go to Vegas STREATs just for them hands down creative with burgers and now they have a restaurant by us awesome sauce!!!!!
Excellent burger with a fusion twist. Tried the Kinoko (mushroom) burger. Was cooked perfectly, nice and juicy. Great fries too.

This place is so good! It just opened up and I loved it. It's really chill which I love. The burger isn't as big as I thought it would be, but it's super filling. Especially with the amount of fries they give! Looks like Fuku just got a new regular. (;

Not bad but not good either. Food tasted alright but doesn't justify how much I paid. $7.99 is not bad for a burger but I think fuku can step up the quality a bit. I still dislike the bun. It was like those "great value buns". May I suggest Kings Hawaiian buns? But that might bring up the price. Also the overall size of the hamburger broke my heart a lil bit lol but I get it..gotta make $$. What I don't understand is the -meal upcharge- $5 to add fries and a drink? I'm no expert but that doesn't make sense? 

Everyone seem to have a problem w there service but on my visits everyone was friendly and personable.

New location, same great burger!! Still hands down the best burger town. I'll be perfectly honest...it's the BEST burger I've ever had. My usual is the Tamago with bacon but will venture off sometimes. Either way I've never had a bad burger. I do highly recommend getting the Tamago with Bacon 
The staff is always really friendly.  The locations are always clean...the downtown food truck is tucked around the corner from the crowd across from Common Wealth.  Which ever location you'll get a great burger.

I must admit, I was excited for Fukuburger to open in my favorite part of town. Having been to their truck at First Friday and waiting over two hours for a burger, I no longer had to stand awkwardly in a crowd of hippies and deal with the ridiculous wait. 

ATMOSPHERE
Super hip with loud ratchet music LOL Vibe resembled a lot like the atmosphere of First Friday. The artwork displayed here were definitely the highlight. Four LED displays above the counter featured their menu as well as some cool videos. 

SERVICE
Not much to say about this department. I tipped them anyways and everyone yelled "Tip Jelly!" , then gave me a jelly. You also get to choose your funny nickname just like how it's done at the truck. Don't ask what mine was. 

FOOD
This is where I questioned myself whether to give three or four stars. I ordered the Buta Burger which is my usual order at Fukuburger. Juicy, mouth-watering beef patty with bacon, cheese, onions and red ginger. I did enjoy my burger. However, for a burger that is as small as my fist (and I have a small hand), its $7.99 price tag is not cute. 

I remember paying $5 at the truck and it was the same exact portion. Please do keep in mind, I have been to Bachi Burger and have no problem paying $12-26 for a burger because given the quality and portion, the price is justifiable. If you are going to charge $8, at least give bigger portion than the truck. Burger is good, just not worth $8 for such a tiny burger. 

In addition, $2.10 for a small drink. Am I at Disneyland? 

CONCLUSION
Come here for the atmosphere and amazing burger but prepare to pay around $10 and leave hungry.

This location has just opened and the staff is awesome. Willing to stay open when the hubby and I had a late night craving by calling and letting them know we were 5 mins away and they stayed open for us. Thank you and this will definitely be our first stop for cravings especially for their jazz fries. So amazing!!! So thankful for this location so close to our home.

Fuku has been a local food truck favorite- and I've enjoyed their food. One of the perks to their new brick in mortar location (besides being convenient to me!) is that their food quality is consistent and their service has improved. The location also offers free wifi, as well as fun music and videos playing for entertainment while you wait.

While their Buta Burger is still my favorite- always juicy, plenty of flavor!- the Naga dog is also a solid option. However, a flaw I've noticed with both is the bread. The burger buns are bulk-purchase and don't stand out, and tend to fall apart. I'd prefer a sturdier version (maybe an onion bun?), the King's Hawaiian buns would be a really great option, especially for the hotdog.

I'm a little disappointed to see that the pricing is still a bit high- $8 for a burger is fair, adding $5 for a drink and fries is steep, and $9 for the (admittedly generously-sized) Naga dog is higher than several local specialty hotdog spots price theirs. I guess I expect slightly inflated pricing for food trucks, but to see the same prices here as at their Strip location was unexpected.

After sampling some food from the food truck location (near the commonwealth) and feeling very impressed, we decided we had to try more once we were in a less inebriated state. The very next day. 
The burgers are unique and very juicy; I can't imagine anyone would ever complain of dryness to their food. The sauces and spices that are infused in the burgers make for a very different burger experience, and in this case different is good. Crack sauce is great too, goes with everything. 
Their portions aren't huge but it's definitely enough to hit the spot. However, Prices are a little high for the atmosphere and cuisine. A combo will run you $13.50 which are sit-down restaurant prices, so that may be enough to turn some people off. The location  is quite small as well so be prepared to push some tables together if you're in a group. 
Also, come with a "funny name" to give them when you order your food--they'll ask you for one to call when your order is ready. Some to try: 
Tits McGee
Boner James
ManWaffles
Justice Beaver. 
Happy Burgers!

This was our first time coming here and we had high expectations based on the other reviews we read those expectations were not even remotely met as the burger was rather bland and greasy and most of all overpriced.  We ordered garlic fries and it had no garlic taste. I don't think we will ever be returning.
Love this small hip vibe they carried over from the truck! From the anime on tv..and the tacky karate tv..just  oozes "cool"...well. .the flavors..no need to go there. ..great as always!
The burgers were umami and the fries are just crisp and delicious! I can never get tired of eating Fukuburger. Glad they opened up another location at Chinatown
Went in for a double steak bowl and ended up with this frail looking sight!  Won't come back here again

We've been here a couple of times since the opening. We've had good service every time with friendly people. Plus our bowls were massive, more than any other chipotle has given us. This one is a winner.

Best Chipotle I've ever been to! The crew members are always friendly and smiling and the food is simply amazing! I got a chicken and barbacoa bowl (gotta love extra meat) with brown rice and pinto beans, then added some corn salsa, sour cream, and guac. It was enough food to last me two meals! Love this place and will definitely return everyday!

We love love love chipotle but, this is the absolute worst location we've ever been to. The cashier carried a dripping garbage bag through the kitchen which was pretty gross. When we got to the counter to order they were basically out of three different kinds of meat. As we got to the second part of our ordering process the woman told us that they were out of cheese and it would be about a 15 minute wait. A 15 minute wait for cheese? Bring up what you're shredding as you shred it. No apology and you bet they were quick to slap that $1.95 guacamole charge on us when we added it to make up for not having cheese. Never ever going back to this location. Never!
These people rock cleaning. I am super picky and the work they did just blew me away. Have signed up for service every 2 weeks. It was perfect

You have to be able to trust who cleans your home, and boy can you trust this service. The cleaners are thorough and reliable. They do AWESOME work. The owner is detailed and knowledgeable. I feel like I am dealing with the best of the best here. You have to give it a try for yourself!!!
Extremely pleased with the professionalism and quality of their work. Very accommodating to my needs. Highly recommend.

Since I escaped with no charges for repairs to my Cadillac's splash pan the day before, I thought I was on a lucky roll, and might as well bite the bullet and take care of the car my wife regularly drove--a 2002 Mercury Cougar--until it began to make repeated clunking sounds as if an axle or some other key part was about to fall off, even over smooth surfaces.  Filled with apprehension and wonder whether my journey would be successful, I drove the automobile to Findlay Lincoln, the same dealer that resurrected this car from the near dead three years ago when I absent-mindedly drove it over the cement curb of an unnoticed left turning lane in the wrong direction while on a detour, landing at an angle on the other side and bending two wheels and the struts supporting an axle.  Around $3,000 later, Humpty Dumpty was made whole again!  

This time I feared another major repair, but was pleased to hear, after a test drive and visual inspection by the service department, that only the front sway bar needed to be replaced.  The clunking noise was the result of instability caused by disintegrated front sway bar bushings.  No needed part was available in the Las Vegas valley, so the car had to stay overnight to be repaired after required parts arrived from other environs the next morning.  

I was whisked off in a complimentary van, to be driven home by a man who I soon learned had been on stage as a regular member of Little Anthony and the Imperials, singing tenor and serving as the group's choreographer.  On a pleasant ride home my driver regaled me with true tales of Old Vegas and what it was like to play the lounge at Caesars Palace.

Upon reaching home I just coincidentally retrieved from the mailbox a coupon that was good for $20 off any maintenance performed by the dealership.  It was fortuitous timing, and the next day I tendered the coupon to my friendly and helpful service advisor, Doug.  After deduction of Owner Advantage and all other eligible discounts, the price for repairs and an oil change dropped about $150 to just over $250 total.  As I drove the newly washed and once again tightly wound vehicle home in an ebullient mood, without hearing any more audible sounds of clunking, I reflected that the peace of mind and restored faith in the dependability of the car alone were well worth what I ultimately paid for the needed repairs.  I had truly received five-star service.

This was my first time for an oil change and tire rotation at Findlay Lincoln.  My appointment was on time, the guys made me feel comfortable and treated me with respect, the price was competitive, and the 2 lounges were nice. I got a custom colorful report with all the inspection details and recommendations. Enough said. The search is over, this place is great!
Jessie in service is a rock star!!! Always kind, helpful and very customer service friendly.

This place us absolutely amazing.. The tamales are spot on authentic and delicious.. The cheese tamales were my favorite. The masa was thin and moist and seasoned well,and was stuffed with lots of cheese and chiles, as well were the pork.. Most tamale places are the opposite, all masa and no stuff inside!! Well worth the price! Thank god we have a place in town & in the east side that sells quality delicious tamales.. Thumbs up to pattys.. See you at xmas!!!

First things first.  These are not ta"masas".  You know what I mean, tamales made almost completely out of masa.  These aren't them.  Good sized and packed full of yummy goodness at 1.50 a piece, they are a good deal.  The fam and I tried the Chicken Green Chile (spicy).  Not our first choice but they were out of nearly everything else.  They were not kidding.  They are quite spicy but delicious nonetheless. I have knocked off a star due to not having the full experience of the other flavors that would have been my primary choices.  I look forward to trying the other flavors and possibly upping my score.  If you find yourself in need of tamales you need to check this place out.

Truly authentic Mexican tamales, great taste and texture.  This is from someone who grew up in South Texas, 7 miles from the Rio Grande. Say hello to Javiar from Tijuana.  Great food great service. Muy bueno.

Just sent my husband over to buy a couple...he brought home a dozen. Let me tell you these tamales are huge, moist and DELICIOUS!! Every bite had meat! The cheese was packed also! I will be putting in my order for Christmas Eve dinner!!
Tamales had lots of flavor and were very good and fresh....owner very nice and good personality

Well I decided to check out this new place that just opened.  I pulled up and from outside it doesn't look like much and even though the open sign was on I wasn't sure if anyone was in there. I went in around 345 and was told there were only a couple kinds left so I got the spicy pork and spicy chicken tamales. I have to say they are VERY good, I definitely love the chicken ones better but they are both worth it. I really have to say the are stuffed with filling and WORTH the money. I will definitely go back when I'm  craving some tamales.

I have found my new favorite spot, it's been open about a month or two. Everything is made from scratch. Tasty chicken tacos, delicious burritos, quesadillas, etc. Grilled wings with homemade hot sauce, a generous salad with lots of fresh toppings and yummy cilantro ranch dressing. Fresh salsa bar with the best pico de gallo, can't get enough!

Prices are great too! I can easily afford to feed my family of six. Been coming here every week since they opened. Nice little family run business with great service. The owners, brothers Jose and Elio, are always happy to see me every time I walk in the door. Can't wait to bring my mom here for some authentic food next time she comes to visit.

OMG!!! BEST TACOS IN TOWN!!!  Located in the barrio, where all good Mexican food is made, this place knows how to make tacos!!!  Everything is made fresh and so delicious. Joytaco and America Tacos don't know tacos like Kiss Pollos.  Prices are right, food is made fresh and I'm sure glad I found this place. Will be here a lot more and can't wait to bring the family.
The food is great. I love the kiss tacos. So glad I work in the area so I can come for lunch!
Awesome annual event! Bring the pooch. Open today until 5:00. See Hailey's event post.

6th Annual Holiday Festival! I'd been wanting to go here since I found out about it 1 or 2 years ago so we made sure we had our schedules cleared to go. Held inside the spacious Westworld indoor building, there was a lot of room for the vendors and booths. The event helps the wonderful Tranquility Trail Animal Sanctuary, and there were a ton of booths to browse through and a lot of raffles you could enter. Several rescues were there too with dogs for adoption. I saw various cute yorkies, corgis, pugs, and great danes, just to name a few rescues! There were also non-dog rescues such as a rat rescue and a sugar glider rescue.

Some other notable booths was a DNA breed testing program, dog accessories, veterinary hospitals, and a dog friendly restaurant (OHSO).

There were all breeds of dogs in various shapes and sizes with their owners. It was cool to be there just to look at all the cute dogs. :) We didn't bring our dogs but all the ones there seemed very friendly and well behaved.

Food options are limited to one small corner of the building with overpriced hot dogs, burgers, and some dessert. 

The event itself is free, but parking is $5.

Such a well thought out, witty and detailed experience. I've been to "live escapes" that didn't cut it but this business has gone above and beyond to make sure that every customer leaves with a thrilling, challenging and fun experience. This family owned and operated business is run by two sisters who really made sure to think of it all. Everything from the props, clues and space is amazing and they didn't skimp on any area. There's even a space to hang out and a full picture room with props of wigs and masks so your team can show their personality and take a funny or scary winning or losing team photo! If you and your friends are looking for a unique activity that forces you to use your brain then check out this awesome gem in Vegas!
-Sarah-

I went with three other friends and had the greatest time. The room we chose was spooky and challenging. It was a such a fun game to play with friends. I will definitely come back and do another room.

What a great time!  CREEPY...in exactly the right way.  Such a fun and challenging experience; we really had to stretch our brains to figure out the cleaver clues so we could escape the room.  There are three different rooms and I can't wait to go back and do the other two.  Thanks Escape or Die!

Best escape room in town. Fantastic props and a very cool story line. Not going to reveal much but let's just say that they do it right. 
We loved the hint system....

We did biohazard. Highly recommended!

You drive to an out of the way part of town, off the beaten path.  The space is isolated, which adds to the ominous tone of the "game."  Your hostess(es) is/are easy on the eyes and everything seems like it's going to be fun. . . .until . . .  you're told that there's a Zombie scare and the emergency broadcast system is playing a news clip with a warning of the danger you're facing, You are ushered into a room . . .  then the door closes and you are locked in with no way out . . . or is there?

First time in an escape room.  So I didn't know what to expect, Would it bee too easy?  Corny? Cheesy?  Not at all.  
The clues were just hard enough to find, and the puzzles just difficult enough that I didn't feel like my intelligence was being insulted.  They were not so difficult that I felt like an idiot,  Just  the right level of intensity.  
It doesn't hurt that the owners knew what they were doing when it came to set up and execution.
I will go back and try my skill at the other rooms and you should too!

This was such a wonderful team to start out with as a new agent.  I had tons of questions when I started and always had great support with Dustin and his team, it makes that first year much easier and now having been there a few years, it's still a great team with systems in place to help make buying and selling a home easy and stress free for everyone!

The Dustin Nulf team rocks! We had Nick, and he helped us every step of the way, and was there whenever we needed him. He was very professional and he got things done! I  have recommended this team to others and will continue to do so.

We worked with Nick from the Dustin Nulf Team and had a great experience. We had a couple of offers fall through, and though we were getting discouraged, Nick was great in keeping us positive and encouraging us to find new places. He was awesome in letting us suggest some properties to visit as well as looking at our laundry list of requirements and finding us places that were appropriate and in our budget. 

I also appreciated that Nick worked with us a lot over email because I couldn't always take calls, and also he worked really well with my mortgage company. Nick even recommended a home inspector that we loved and thought did a great job. 

We moved in April 2015 and we know that we ended up with the perfect house for our family.

What a great and easy experience buying our first house.  Nick Nulf was a great agent.  He answered all of our questions and concerns.  He was prompt and truly cared that we were happy with the right house.  Nick made sure the seller was doing their part and did an extraordinary job representing my wife and I.  Thanks to Nick Nulf and the Dustin Nulf team.

Being here a year training under coach Mark has been a very wonderful experience. Preparing to ship off to the military soon, really gotta say he's helped me out with my wrestling fundamentals and Jiu-Jitsu. Now MMA added.....highly recommended!!!!

This man knows his stuff! I thought I had a solid base of knowledge when it came to defensive  tactics before but now my skills has been fine tuned. Mark is a very clear and concise instructor. I was a little intimidated learning from such a accredited fighter but he made me feel comfortable in my abilities. I would recommend him to anyone trying to fine tune a defensive skill set.

My son has been training with Mark for a couple of years now and we absolutely love this gym! Mark Dickman is a great coach and great with the kids as well as the adults! My son and all of the other kids in the gym for the most part win all of our competitions! And the gym is huge and very nice!

What a way to finish off my first year as a Yelp Elite! A HUGE thank you to Nate and the GM of BLT Steak Lawrence for a fantastic evening. The drinks, the food, the service and of course my fellow Yelpers all made for a dinner to remember. The theme of the evening was celebrating Sinatra's 100th birthday, and of course including Frank's favorite drink, Jack Daniels. 

As we arrived we were escorted to our tables in the restaurant. BLT Steak is a classic LV steakhouse and proved to be one of the best. After checking in and receving our Yelp goodie bag we were served "My Way", a special Sinatra select Jack Daniels with a splash of water and an ice cube molded in to a copy of one of Frank's famous hats. The glass was a souvenir for us to keep which was a thoughtful gift.

The courses then began to appear, one after another in perfect timing. The courses were all paired with a Jack Daniels cocktail but if that wasn't your thing BLT also offered a wine pairing option which I chose. 

A quick review of the food:

Gruyere popovers. Enormous popovers with gruyere cheese, baked to perfection. Served with butter and sea salt. A great start!

Jack Daniels maple glazed bacon. Delicious, smoky bacon goodness. 

Brussel sprout salad. Presented beautifully. Although Im not a huge brussel sprout fan I enjoyed the dish. 

Crispy Red snapper with white beans. Loved this dish! Cooked perfectly with crispy skin but the fish was super moist. The beans and chorizo broth were a perfect match. 

Jack Daniels Braised short ribs. Very tender and delicious. 

All of the sides were enjoyed by our table as well. For the dessert a warm chocolate bread pudding with Jack Daniels Maple ice cream. Another winning combination. 

Although I did choose the wine pairing I really enjoyed the final Jack Daniels cocktail, "Sweet Loraine". It was a dessert cocktail with Jack Daniels, rumchata, maple & cinnamon syrup. Another perfect pairing with the bread pudding. 

Throughout the evening the service was flawless, the wait staff could not do enough for us.  The courses came out in perfect time along with your cocktail or wine and water was always refilled quickly. Our host Lawrence also described our food and drinks and told a few Sinatra stories. A perfect dining experience and YEE that I will not forget.

Another fabulous event thanks to Nate and the wonderful staff and management over at BLT Steak! What a great way to book end this year on Yelp!

The theme of the evening was to celebrate Frank Sinatra's 100th birthday with libations crafted from his drink of choice, Jack Daniels! Each course (5 total) was paired with a cocktail made from different Jack barrels/makes. To be completely honest, I'm not the biggest whiskey fan but I had a great time sampling all of BLT's cocktails! The highlights were probably the Sinatra Select with a fedora-etched ice cube and the spicy jalapeno/lemon cocktail!

I've been talkin about the drinks, but the food deserves much attention as well. I uploaded a pic of our menu and to say it was extensive would be an understatement. I particularly enjoyed the maple glazed bacon (who knew bacon could get even BETTER), the braised short ribs and sides (hellllllo truffle mash) and the bread pudding and maple ice cream (although admittedly my dessert was a little more room temp than I would have liked). 

There were also wine pairings available for all courses if you asked. I had the pairing for the short rib course and it was a 96' Bella Luna that the sommelier came over a gave a brief spiel about. 

Shout out to Lawrence, the GM of BLT, for guiding us through the night and shout out to all of the amazing staff/waiters and the chef for a great time. 

My last YEE for 2015 and I'd just like to say thank you all of the wonderful Elites and +1's I've met here in Vegas and a big shoutout to Nate for putting on some great events. Cheers and see you all in 2016!

I haven't been attending many YEE this year, but am glad to partake in this one!  The drinks looked delicious (as I can't sip to truly describe), the food was flavorful and cooked to perfection, the service was stellar, and of course, meeting other Yelpers made the night unforgettable.  Nate also handed out a super cool Yelp Bag with awesome swags for the Elites.

Hubby and I were first to arrive and Lawrence welcomed us, and took us to the area where there were three long communal dining table and said to sit wherever we like.  Because the theme was "Frank Sinatra's 100th Birthday," all the courses were paired with Jack Daniels cocktail, and even Lawrence were dressed Frank Sinatra-ish.

The courses consisted of:
Amuse bouche - duck mousse with crostini.  This was a small bite that got me ready for the courses to come!
Gruyere popovers - served with butter and sea salt.  These were the biggest popovers I have seen to date.  It was made with gruyere cheese.  There was a recipe for this and I grabbed it.  I just have to find a popover pan to replicate these yummy popovers...or, just return for some more. 

Jack Daniels Maple Glazed Bacon-Thick slices of heaven.  I am glad Lawrence had mentioned to save some of the popover to eat with this bacon.   

Brussels Sprout Salad - a bit of sour, sweet, salty, nutty, and bitterness made this dish super refreshing, and my palate did not get bored.   It was beautifully plated. 

Crispy Red Snapper - Indeed crispy, served with braised white beans and chorizo broth. Fish was cooked perfectly!

Jack Daniels Braised Short Ribs - served with oyster mushroom, fried yams, truffle mash potatoes, creamed spinach, mac and cheese, and thumbelina carrots.  Everything was delicious, but the truffle mash potatoes deserve a call out.  The best mash potatoes I have had...better than Robuchon!  Now that's a bold statement, but is true, at least to me.

Warm chocolate bread pudding with Jack Daniels Maple ice cream - Unfortunately I cannot eat the ice cream, but I did taste the chocolate bread pudding.  Decadent!  Once I have my baby, I am coming back to enjoy this dessert wholeheartedly.

Before dinner ended, the chef that made all the courses happened came out to speak to us.  That was super cool.  In addition, we each received a goodie bag, compliments of BLT (Jack Daniels glass and two very cool Frank Sinatra coasters).  

A big thank you to Nate, our awesome CM, Lawrence, GM of BLT Steak, amazing chef, and the staff for making this night, one to remember!

Incredibly event filled with delicious food and fabulous cocktails!!

I absolutely loved this event! I have always been a fan of Frank Sinatra's music and was so happy to see that the pairings and style of this event was themed in honor of his 100th birthday. 

The managers all had Sinatra style hats and we sat down to a menu of food and drinks paired to Mr. Sinatra's liking. The first drink came in a souvenir glass with his drink of choice and was a great way to start the night. I appreciated Mr. Silva giving us some history about Mr. Sinatra with each drink being served. The cheers we were able to do really brought our table together and was a great way to interact. I also learned a thing or two. 

The food was all delicious. I appreciated that it was all individual small plates and we were able to try so many things. My favorite dishes had to be the Gruyere popovers and Red Snapper. The popover was the first one I've ever had and will be tough to beat. Crispy cheese and fluffy warm insides served with Vermont salted butter. I could have eaten two in all honesty. 

The service was excellent. The servers were prompt on keeping water glasses full, cocktails flowing and everyone was served at the same time. That was a huge plus for such large tables. 

Thank you Nate and the staff and management at BLT Steak. My plus one and I had a really great time and feel lucky to have had such a fun experience!

Again, I have to emphasize how much I enjoy this type of event. Sit down dining experiences are just the absolute best!

This experience was designed all around Frank Sinatra's birthday, which was a pretty cool thing to do. The staff dressed the part. The cocktails all featured Frank's favorite: Jack Daniels. We all got a souvenir Sinatra glass to keep. And it was clear that a lot of thought and prep was put into the creation of the cocktails and pairing them with the dinner courses. It was great to hear from the mixologist about each cocktail. And each food item was also explained by staff to us.

It was a wonderfully thought out and planned event! A definite 5 stars for the event. The food and cocktails, though, were a bit underwhelming. James O. (my +1) and I have dined before at BLT Steak in Washington, DC. And it was absolutely amazing food (http://www.yelp.com/biz/blt-steak-washington)! Let's be real, the reason you come to BLT Steak is for the steak.

The popovers were delicious. The bacon was delicious. The red snapper was quite good. The mac 'n' cheese and truffle mashed potatoes were delicious (and honestly, probably my fav things). All the other food was ok - good enough to eat and prepared nicely, but not good enough to crave. 

The "Kings of Cool" cocktail with jalapeno was my favorite. It was both tasty and unique. The "Lingering Spirits" cocktail with amaretto and cherry was decent. The other cocktails I didn't really want to finish. Now, to be fair, I think if these cocktails were made with a better whiskey (sorry Jack Daniels), I have little doubt I would've enjoyed them quite a bit. And again, they were paired nicely with the courses. 

This was a great way to experience some of the other menu items, besides steak, that BLT Steak has to offer. And a great way to experience the new-ish Vegas location. But again, if you're coming to BLT Steak, I highly recommend you get a steak (the one I had in DC was seriously one of the best steaks I've ever had).

The event at BLT was, like the icon whose birthday we were celebrating, a class act from beginning to end.

From the attentiveness of management and staff, to the fedora ice cubes, giant popovers, Jack Daniels pairings with the exceptional food, the exquisite dessert, and the souvenir Sinatra rocks glass, this was one spectacular event.  The photos tell the story.  Wine was also graciously provided for those of us whose delicate constitutions don't tolerate whiskey all that well :) 

A great big Yelp thanks and fedoras-off to Nate and GM Lawrence for a memorable sit-down experience that my +1 also greatly appreciated.  It was the perfect way to finish off my 6th year as a Yelp Elite. Over the top!

The Elite event at BLT Steak was over the top. The theme Happy 100th Birthday Frank was a tremendous tribute. As a Frank Sinatra fan I was especially impressed  by the salute to the Man. From the great service to excellent paring of food and Jack Daniels Drinks, the BLT management and staff made it a memorable evening. The option of wine instead of whiskey drinks was well received.

A nice touch was the background information provided on Frank as well as the introduction of the specialty cocktails throughout the 5 course service. Each of the cocktails was unique and delicious. It appeared that the Kings of Cool cocktail -Gentleman Jack, St. Germain, lemon juice, jalapeno slice and basil was a little to spicy for most. My take is mo hotta mo better. 

The service was right on point. Management pitched in to assist with the serving. Water glasses were continuously refilled and empty plates removed promptly Each course was beautifully prepared and cooked perfectly for my taste. 

This Elite event was perfect to round out 2015. It was great to meet new Yelp friends and renew with others. 

Kudos to Nate for organizing another great Elite plus 1 event.

This was my first Yelp event and I was blown away by how over the top everything was from the food to the service to the company. 

The entire BLT Steak staff was very welcoming and made the Frank Sinatra theme come alive. The GM dressed like Frank and even read us a quote from Frank in his welcoming. The service was over the top. Drinks were always full, plates cleared quickly, and the servers were very friendly, even conversational. They definitely made us feel like guests in their home more than diners at a restaurant. 

There was more than enough food and drink to go around. The quality and taste of the food was also over the top. The popovers to start the meal were huge. I loved the taste and texture which was definitely better than the average dinner roll. The Maple Glazed Bacon was my favorite food of the night. The smoky bacon with the sweet maple was delicious. I could eat just a plate of this as a course. The Brussel Sprout Salad was another unique dish that they really delivered on. The combination of brussel sprouts, hazelnuts, cranberries, blue cheese, and apple vinaigrette was delicious. I love when restaurants come up with unique twists on the usual and do it well. The Crispy Red Snapper was perfectly prepared with a perfect crispy crust. The chorizo broth with beans around the fish was delicious as well. The Braised Short Ribs was a great array of flavors. The short rib was tender, meaty, and flavorful. Everything on the plate was a perfect complement to the short rib. The mushroom, sweet potato dollop, and onion were full of flavorful. Last, but definitely not least was the Chocolate Bread Pudding with Jack Daniels Ice Cream. The bread pudding was tender and had a nice chocolate flavor without being too much. The ice cream was my favorite part of this dish.

The drinks were abundant and perfectly prepared. The bartender was right on point with the drinks. There was way too much alcohol to consume all of it, but I wish I could have because I loved them all. My favorite drink was the "Lingering Spirits" with Jack Daniels, amaretto, and cherry hazelnut bitters. I liked the slight sweet with the bold taste of the Jack Daniels. The most interesting drink of the night was the "Kings of Cool" which was largely jalapeno based. This was the hottest cocktail I've ever had, but it didn't overpower the flavor. I love spicy foods and this drink really satisfied the need for heat. The final drink, a sweet dessert cocktail was a nice finish to the meal. 

Since I'm new to Yelp it was nice to finally meet some other Yelpers in person. Everyone was warm and I enjoyed getting to know the few people I was able to meet. Hopefully next time I won't hit terrible traffic and I'll arrive early enough to mingle and meet others. :) 

If Yelp events are usually half this good then I definitely want to attend more! Thank you so much to BLT Steak for an amazing evening and to Nate for organizing this event. I really appreciate all of the word that went into planning and executing this event.

Friends, food, whiskey and stories about Frank Sinatra...can an Elite event get any better? I submit that it cannot! 

But before I even get into talking about the food or drinks, I want to give a huge shout out to the entire staff at BLT! This entire event from start to finish was just perfect in terms of service. Not only was GM Lawrence an incredibly nice guy with an obvious passion for this restaurant and Frank Sinatra, but every staff member was knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. I particularly loved hearing the stories about the man himself, and getting details about nearly every course and drink really added to the experience. Getting to hear from the chef responsible for our meal at the end was just icing on the cake. 

Now with this being a sort of celebration of Sinatra, it's no surprise Jack Daniels was at the forefront of every course, especially when it came to the paired drinks. Thanks to some fellow Yelp pals, I'll admit I've leaned a little more to drinking straight bourbon over the last couple years, but I still enjoyed trying all the drinks at this event. Some were a bit too sweet for my taste, and the 'Kings of Cool' with jalapeño was definitely interesting...but my favorite had to be the 'My Way' which is just whiskey, a splash of water, and the coolest fedora imprinted ice cube I've ever seen. What made it even cooler is we got to take home the glass it was served in! 

The JD theme continued on throughout the food as well. Our first course, Jack Daniels Maple Glazed Bacon, was one of my favorites from the night. Some of the best bacon I've had...with all the elements of smokiness, saltiness and a just touch of sweetness. I also really enjoyed the Jack Daniels Braised Short Ribs, and the sides accompanying were equally impressive. My most anticipated course from the night, believe it or not was dessert. The Jack Daniels Maple Ice Cream was absolutely delicious, and although the flavor of the bread pudding was great, our tables section all came out cold. Had the bread pudding been warm, I think it would have been an absolute home run. 

My favorite dish from the night was the Crispy Red Snapper. The fish was incredibly tender, and the chorizo broth just brought everything together to make it the most flavorful plate of the night for me. It was probably about the only time I've been thankful the lady doesn't eat seafood, as it just left more for me. Other stand outs were the Brussel Sprout Salad and the pop over toast during the starter. I'm not sure if it's a good thing they put out the recipe for those things, cause I could probably eat an entire batch myself. The addition of a little cheese spread and some sea salt is incredible!

It's been a while since I've been to an event, but for me, this one was up there with the best. Cent'anni to Nate, Yelp, my lovely lady Lore D. for allowing me to be her +1, and the entire BLT crew for an unforgettable evening! I am definitely looking forward to a return visit to try more from their menu!

These are the kind of Elite events I love: going to a restaurant that I've never been to before and getting the golden treatment!  A five course tasting menu with whiskey pairings?? Just looking at the menu in the email we got beforehand made me shiver with antici...........pation.

The fight through traffic was a bear to get to the restaurant, but we made it on time and were taken back to three beautiful, long tables.  It looked like a royal feast was about to take flight.  And what a feast it was!

1.) That duck mousse something in the little jar was my most favorite thing of the night.  I may have had three scoops of it...or four. 
2.) The maple glazed bacon was chewy and thick.  I am not a bacon lover like so many others, but I enjoyed this sweet treat.
3.) The Brussels sprout salad was cruciferous and refreshing.  I liked the tangy dressing and the slight blue cheese flavor that wasn't too over powering.
4.) The snapper I think was my favorite entree.  The crispy top was a nice texture.  The carrots and spinach that came with it were also very tasty.
5.) The short rib was flavorful, but mine was a bit on the dry side.  And can we talk about the truffle mashed potato??  Holy moly, that stuff was good!
6.) The bread pudding was dense and I couldn't finish it all, but the Jack Daniels ice cream was a very interesting flavor that I enjoyed.

As for the cocktails...well, I'm sad to say they weren't my favorite.  I love a good whiskey cocktail but could barely taste the whiskey in the drinks (save for the first one in the souvenier glass)! I felt like they were overpowered by the secondary ingredients, but at least I tried some new cocktails and ventured out.

When the chef came out at the end, I was surprised by how young he was!  I expect he will grow, experiment with food, and create even more beautiful dishes in the future.

This was a very fun event, and I met some GREAT new Yelper friends that I hope to see soon at other events.  Side note: the most interesting thing from the event was that I learned your taste buds change every 7 years.  Who knew?  I guess I should maybe try that vile fruit pineapple to see if my taste buds have changed to like it.  But.......probably not.

One of the better Yelp events I've been to. I love the sit-down dinner events because it gives you a great opportunity to get to know the people around you. It was a pleasure sharing a meal with my plus one and our table mates -- Gina, Alexis, Ghia, Erin, and Michelle from Edmonton and their plus ones. The only drawback is not getting a chance to chat with everyone else in the room. 

The event was slightly over 2 hours and the BLT staff managed to move the dinner along quickly, with a brisk 5+ course dinner with whiskey based cocktails paired with each dish  in honor of Sinatra's 100th birthday. The maple glazed bacon and brussels sprouts salad (served two ways) were the highlights of the meal for me. The short ribs and bread pudding were unfortunately luke warm, which isn't unexpected because of the size of the event. But temperature issues aside, the food gave us a glimpse of the well conceived food the kitchen can produce.

The service was incredibly friendly and accommodating -- serving wine for those who weren't fans of the cocktails. And, it was nice to hear from the chef and general manager.  I haven't been to too many Yelp events this year, but Nate seems to do a fabulous job of putting them together.

You know the UYE is a success when you anticipate 10 and 16 show up!  The turnout was such a wonderful surprise in a city known for people flaking out and pulling a no-show. Shout out to Renzo for taking the lead on getting us reseated in the large, private dining room and to Phillip for handling the ordering for our table.

Once we got situated and ordered, conversation got flowing and the food started rolling out- surprisingly, the dumplings were not my favorite part of the meal, but rather the cumin lamb dish (bomb!) and the noodles! We had a great mix of dishes at our table, and an awesome mix of people in attendance- it was great to finally put a real face and personality to a few folks, and to catch up with friends.

Dumpling King was fairly good at helping us, though there was a bit of a language barrier with one of our servers (but perfection from the other!) and a delay to get our checks- but we were having a good time, so I don't think anyone really minded too much. Definitely looking forward to doing this again soon- follow up with Antonia for upcoming AYCE sushi plans!

I popped my UYE cherry at this event!!!! Woooooooooo!!! 

Thanks to the super reviewer Stefany V., I was able to partake in a wonderful gathering of fellow food lovers! I had already tried their cumin lamb and soup dumplings at my first visit, but carpe diem'ed on this opportunity to mingle in a more intimate, smaller group setting as well as stuff my face with a variety of foods.

I gotta say, UYE is the way to go, since I've missed out meeting fellow yelpers at the larger elite events. I have "friends" in my list whom I had never met, but have been following for quite some time. And what's nice is that there's more flexibility for a plus one, so your significant others can also attend! 

Some of the highlights for food were: 

Dimsum dumplings- LOVED the flavor of the inside. The skin was a bit poorly constructed, but it sure looked like a dumpling! 

Beef fried rice- gasp...didn't think it'd be great but it was surprisingly delicious and full of flavor. 

And of course the cumin lamb. It's packed with bold flavors, and the cumin definitely comes through. 

I shall pass on the crystal dumplings (kinda bland for my taste), crispy beef (which was overly salty with no other flavors), and the beef patty (which had a pungent oil smell that I couldn't really handle, and it was rather bland). 

The juicy beef dumplings are a hit or miss. I've definitely had better at my fave Din Tai Fung spot in Cali, but this is still better than other places in Vegas. 

They don't serve any pork here, hence their dumplings are all beef, as the owners are Muslim. But, me likes the beef so it's alllll gooooooood! 

Looking forward to more UYE's!!!!!!! :)

As the previous Yelpers mentioned...we had a variety of tasty Chinese foods, that arrived fast to our tables, after ordering from a friendly server w/ a bit of a language barrier, among a private dining room in the back of this interestingly decorated restaurant, consisting of well over a dozen Yelpers +1s. Conversation was constant fun, engaging, friendly, and humorous!

The glass lazy susan placed in the center of our circular tables were extremely helpful sharing a variety of tasty dishes among others.
 
The owner named Mary (who spoke perfect English) came out and was very appreciative of us choosing her restaurant. She shared a bit about the foods that her husband prepared for us. She is the one responsible for the bright red lively chair decor that very few places could get away w/ having patrons sit on. Personally, I liked her bright & cheery chairs :-)

This UYE (Unofficial Yelp Event) was truly enjoyable among a fun and friendly bunch of people, most of whom I've met before and some for the 1st time. I hope to participate in more UYEs in the near future.

See 7 photos below...

YELP 300 CHALLENGE 2015: #295

I have gotten to know more good people through Yelp events, especially UYEs, that I'm very appreciative of people who put the events together!

The UYE at the Dumpling King was no different.  Breaking into two tables of 8, the 16 of us enjoyed each other's company.  I met some new folks and spent time with some friends for a few years.

The people at Dumpling King were very accommodating to let us use the side room with this large number.

Now we have to keep the momentum going and make tasting UYEs a regular thing.

Thanks to Stefany V. for putting the UYE together!

Such a great little boutique tucked away in Bethlehem, complete and total eye candy! Clothes are elegant, unique, fashion forward, but a little pricey, most of it impossible to find anywhere,  absolutely worth it though.  Jewelry is fantastic.  They throw a mean party for their gallery openings and one of the best Halloween parties Ive ever been to.  Definitely worth a trip!

They have great stuff!  The present everything so nicely.  Their jewelry is so cute and so are their clothes.  I got my prom dress here for a nice price.  Defiantly a place to check out if you are in the area.
Cute clothes but definitely boutique prices!  Check out the sales rack for some amazing finds though!!  Will be going back when I am here again!
Another great Yelp event! I love meeting local owners of local businesses! Great vodka and pretty great distillers. We love you Liz and Andrew! And to me you are "Perfectly Prescribed!"

Another great event in the books! This was my first distillery, and I learned there is REALLY a lot of science that goes into making vodka. It was fun learning about the process with such a fun group of people. I met some new people, and met those who I friended through Yelp. It's always cool to put a face to a profile when I go to events like this. 

The distillery was charming and Liz and Andrew answered every question that we threw at them. My favorite part was when we got to bottle our own vodka. Furthermore, I knew it would be good prior to tasting it, but WOW it was better than I expected. someone even suggested it was better than Grey Goose, which I agreed 100%. 

Kudos to Nikki for putting this event together. We had a blast, all while supporting a local business!

Doc Portor Vodka is made from corn and wheat not potatoes like in Russia. The history of this local distillery is very homegrown and cute. The husband and wife are this adorable couple who know how to have fun and handle business. 

Porter is the last name of the couple, Andrew family history was quite interesting and makes for a great discussion while touring the facility.

The taste of the vodka is quite tasty and the laws of NC sucks but I must say its BETTER than my FAV (Grey Goose). Now that I reside in NC (Union County) I LOVE to support local so I'll be support the Porters when in need of Vodka Ana when I have friends and family in town as well. I would've LOVE to have had a cocktail made with the vodka maybe a Cosmo. The vodka was extremely smooth and tasty.

I was able to bottle my own bottle and purchase it afterwards. I also supported by buying a shirt with the controversial slogan on back but since it's a limited supply and temporary I had to have one and the 20% off was a good deal.

I'll be back in my terminator voice :-)

Wow Nikki, wow!  I don't think I'd be going out on a limb here to say maybe one of the best events ever?  Some may say that might be a stretch when not being spoiled by lavish amounts of food and drinks, but experience wise, few events can compete.  There is something to be said about these smaller events in general in my opinion.

This place felt homey the second I walked in the door.  As soon as you walked in you saw an obvious husband and wife(Andrew and Liz) sitting behind the bar, grinning ear to ear, in this small little tasting room.  The place felt so much bigger though, when you looked through the window behind them and saw the full on operation.

The tour was great.  It was an in depth description of the process and science behind it, but without going over our heads with specifics.  I love their attention to detail.  That is hard to find in vodka's when you can just charcoal filter the hell out of em and get rid of all the funky tastes.  That said, I can't wait to try the bourbon and the gin as the tour talked about them as much as the vodka.  I get that about the tour though.  Vodka is a little bit more straight forward(minus the heads and tails aspect), while bourbon really gets in nuances from the barrel and gin from the spices.  Letting us smell the different possible aspects and flavor profiles of the gin was quite a treat, but the bourbon was already striking my curiosity by this point.  As soon as we started talking about the bourbon I was going to ask if there was a waiting list for the used barrels.  I should have known every brewer in town would want their hands on those things.  C'est la vie.

On to bottling.  We got to bottle our own booze!  I'm talking about filling the bottle.  Stamping and labeling the bottle.  Even getting to buy said bottle!(Yes, its sitting in my house right now).  That is a personal experience.  One I can now literally can say, been there, done that, even got the t-shirt.

So yeah, I enjoyed it to say the least.  Great crowd, nothing but good vibes, and how much more local can you get.  I know this local distillery movement hasn't taken off near as fast as the local brewery movement has, but these guys seem to have the knowledge and the vigor to make this work.  Mad respect and will do what I can to help.  Thank you much!

Thank you Nikki for putting on another spectacular Yelp event for the entire community. Love the concept of Doc Porter's Distillery of "Grain to Glass". The wheat grass they use is from Charlotte.

The tour started at front of the establishment with the history of how Doc Porter's started it all. Best part was going through the sections of the distillery, with cool contraptions, and seeing their production facility. Everything perfectly mapped out. Definitely one smooth operation going on here and Best of Luck to Andrew and Liz for welcoming us to their distillery. The fun part was at the end of the tour-you get to bottle your own Vodka.

After bottling the Vodka, we headed towards the tasting room and had a sample of Vodka. Step aside Grey Goose, and Stoli here comes Doc Porter's Vodka for it's buttery and smooth taste.

All seems right in the world whenever you run into people doing what they love.... It makes all the difference in what they create and the people they influence.  The owners, operators, creators of Doc Porters are exceptional examples.  Right when you walk in the door, you could feel their passion for their craft and their distillery.

I felt so lucky to be a part of this intimate yelp event.  Being an engineer and craft lover, this hit my brain in all the right spots.  From the distillery tour and explanation of their farm to table (back to farm) process, this was hands down one of the most unique and fun experiences in my tenure as a yelper.

I rode the light rail and totally mis-timed my arrival so I was the "last to arrive" (just put a big "L" on my forehead) but luckily I arrived in time for the tour to start.  Liz welcomed all of us with open arms and toured us through the tap room.  Though not a very large space, they have put a lot of thought and effort into every single element:  local salvaged barn wood, lighting created by Andrew, and a crafted tasting bar... So many stories behind each element.  I loved their story and nod to Andrew's grandfather and their inspiration of this distillery.

Andrew took us through the entire process.  It was really interesting - especially since I've never been to a distillery before... Plenty of breweries, but this process was definitely new to me.  Being a chemical engineer, you can tell Andrew has a good grasp and working knowledge on what they are making here.

Thank you Liz and Andrew for hosting us and showing us your diggs!!!  Especially being able to bottle the product was super cool- I thought I was going to break something, but I ended up with a new bottle at home (and I got the tshirt... Mostly Kenny's fault).  It was great hanging out with my favorite yelpers and also meeting a few new ones.  Of course PopRock Photography was there to capture the moments!  Tonya rockin' it per usual.

I love the idea of visiting small businesses and meeting the owners and heartbeats behind a product.
It's easy to quickly get a sense of the Porter's passion for craft alcohol. Their use of locally sourced products shows their commitment to the area and I like that their waste goes back into the area feeding local pigs (who hopefully grow nice and big and eventually become my locally sourced bacon).
They definitely Tom Sawyered us into bottling up some of their product for them but it was fun and if I wasn't already flush with Vodka at home, I could have bought the very bottle that I put together which would have been a super neat purchase. In hindsight, I sort of regret that I didn't. No mind, when I'm done with my current Vodka, I can pop in for a bottle now that I know where to get it.
Thanks to the Porters for a very fun and interesting evening and Nikki for putting it together.

Had a great time with the Porters last night! I loved hearing about how they make their different products and the location is absolutely adorable. I even got to bottle my own vodka, which presents me with a dilemma: do I save it for the memories or drink that thing? I'm gonna have to drink it because honestly, it's a fantastic vodka. The flavor rings throughout without being too strong and the smoothness can't be beat. Congratulations on all the good things happening over there, Porters! And thanks to Nikki for another fun night! :)

What a blast! Small little events like this are always a great time.

I've had my eye on Doc Porter's for months now. Every time I would pass by on my way to OMB or Sugar Creek I would always peek to see if they had opened already - glad to know that they are finally up and running. Thanks to another great event that Nikki put together, a bunch of us got an awesome little tour of their facility. 

I've been to distilleries before, but this was the first time I ever had the chance to bottle up my own product. What a fantastic idea! Best part of it all was the fact that we could take our very own bottle home. The Vodka itself was delicious! It's no surprise that they are starting to pop up in places all over town!
 
With that said, thank you to Andrew & Liz! It's nice to see people doing what they enjoy. I'm sure their marketing/engineering jobs are cool and all but I wish them the best of luck, so that they one day wont have to show up to their 9-5's anymore.

Good Story - Great People - Awesome Product

Wishing them all the best!

It was truly an honor to have attended the Doc Porter's Yelp event last night. I use the word honor in the most literalist of senses. Seeing how passionate Andrew and Liz are about making good vodka in a local and sustainable fashion made the night so much then just a tour and tasting. I felt privileged to have had a glimpse into their lives and business. I would even go as far to say that last night may have been one of my favorite events this year. There is just something so special and amazing when you get to that grassroots level to really understand a business and the people behind it. 

Liz started the tour out with explaining the background and history of Doc Porters. I couldn't help but look around the room and notice how intentional every single decorative piece was. I mean, heck, the toilet paper roll in the bathroom was even designed like a pipe on purpose. Just from the start, I could tell this stemmed from a passion. We then went into the main production room. I learned so much about distilling. As someone who has been to many breweries, done many brewery tours, and has a home brewer as a husband,  I was looking for those similarities and differences in distilling. Didn't realize how much of an art form it was to get that perfect mix. Can't wait till 2017 to try some of that Bourbon!

Bottling the vodka was pretty cool. It was weird how easy it was to go from a plain old bottle to a cool looking product in a matter of minutes. We of course had to buy the bottle we filled and labeled ourselves!

The tasting was a nice little touch. You really can tell that the vodka is made from wheat (something unique about their vodka)! 

Thanks Nikki for setting up such a fun event. Thanks to Andrew and Liz for giving us a fabulous evening to explore and understand your products. 

This farm to bottle to farm distillery is going to be such a success in this city, due to the love put into it from Andrew and Liz. Amazing job guys. (Now for those reading this who haven't tasted their product, go to your local Mecklenburg ABC store now and try it! You won't regret it!)

Wow! What a great event. I loved the small and intimate setting with the yelp crew. There were about 20 of us so it was the perfect size! 

I've heard about Doc Porters for a while since they made their debut in the Charlotte agenda and being a vodka girl, I've wanted to check them out- so this event was perfect! 

The owners were amazing! It's truly remarkable to see how a husband and wife duo built this distillery! Props to them. They also offered a great tour to the yelpers, but most amazing part is that we got to bottle out own vodka!! This has always been a dream of mine (insert doors of heaven opening). 

Awesome job Nikki! This was one of my favs (but I always say that because you're the bomb!)

This event was truly a privilege!!! With each event I realize more and more what it TRULY means to be a part of the Yelp community. I probably say this with every event I review because our events are so awesome, but this is what it's all about! I'd never toured a Distillery or even a Brewery so I was so excited to be able to attend. My mom had been sick a lot recently [She's ALOT better now :-)], so i've missed a few events. I walked in, stopped at the door to open my Yelp app, then a hear a joyful voice say "Hello how are you!?". Is that my people I hear??? I looked up to the friendly faces of the Yelp community. Some familiar, some not. But I was happy to be back! I've missed seeing everyone!

I arrived just in time for the tour. Which was pretty amazing if you ask me. I loved the small intimate setting. Andrew and Liz are just the more adorable couple! They were friendly, fun & Humble. The answered questions and explained everything in a way even I could understand.  Then the best part, we got to bottle our own Vodka! I was so excited! To be honest, I give them props, they must keep this up, it is a GREAT marketing strategy. Now the Vodka was delicious! They compared it with Grey Goose but I thought it was 10x better than Grey Goose.  But I don't drink that much [outside of Yelp events;-)]. So I probably wouldn't have purchased a bottle if it weren't for the fact that I bottled it myself. Way to seal the deal!!
