That vodka was so smooth, and to be honest, it's the 1st non-fruity vodka i've tasted that I actually liked enough to want to sip on, no chaser. I'll definitely be supporting our Local distillery Doc Porter's any chance I get. Thanks Nikki for another amazing event!

Just opened and I really hope the locals help this place survive because I just had the chicken tacos and they were amazing. The best I've had in all of Queen Creek and they do their hard shells right. They make them. None of this pre made shell crap you find and some other local spots. The guacamole was fantastic, and the salsa was "ok" (not the best I've had) but I do like he homemade chips. They have a kids menu too and looks like a full bar (I don't drink so I'll be useless for info on that) but it looked pretty stocked. I will be making this a regular spot. This location seems to have a curse so Queen Creek let's help break that curse and help this new spot thrive. My wife had the steak tacos and said they were very good. So far so good. Can't wait to go back!!! I posted some pics of the food too.

As a long time local, I've seen this place fail as four different food places, I was pleasantly surprised when I stopped by there for a quick lunch yesterday. The family has put in extensive work into the interior and exterior. Noted are a kids play area, several picnic tables and a sand cornhole area with scoreboards and three sets of boards. 
    I came in, sat at the bar and spied the menu. Ordered a Bell's two hearted. ( one of my favorite) it came in a plastic pint cup. A glass one would have been a nicer touch. . I ordered the steak tacos which were seconded by the bartender. They showed up quickly in two nicely grilled street taco sized grilled corn tortillas. Stuffed with fresh pico and grilled steak with a hint of cumin. Yum!  Choice of pinto or black. My black beans were actually too smokey, making me wonder if they were burned. My side scoop of rice was pretty standard. 
$15.18 bill and I'm out the door. I'm really looking forward to eating my way through the menu and spending some outdoor time there this spring. I'm still wondering if location is going to be this places downfall as it can be difficult to get in to and out of.

Visited this restaurant for the first time. I believe they've been open a week. 

Atmosphere: Super cute & quaint! House converted into a restaurant. Beach themed throughout. Any & all clocks for decor are set to 5 o'clock. LOL They seat about 30 inside. They have a belly up bar for drinks. A few people were there enjoying themselves.  Outside they have a sand play area for kids, fire pits & picnic benches, seating at the outdoor bar. Pretty spacious outside. Today they had a band playing. 

Staff: friendly & attentive
Prices: avg. $10 for a meal with rice & beans 
Food: I had shrimp tacos. PHENOMINAL!!!! Hubby had the steak tacos & he loved them as well. Tacos are a little small but full, fresh & flavorful. Something unique about the rice, in a good way, is I usually have to add salsa to Mexican rice, but this rice I didn't need to add to. It's different, but good. 

Enjoyed very much, will be back!

Stopped by to check out this place for lunch today.  Very cute atmosphere  (think beachy). We opted to dine inside since it was a cool 55 degrees outside. Unfortunately the wait staff would leave the door open so that they could go in and out to serve people outside. It made it very cold inside and the food got cold quick as a result. We did ask if they could close it but as soon as they did another waitress would prop it open again. Now the food.....very good prices on apps and very good chips with guacamole. I had the three taco plate which was very good with shredded beef and husband had chicken tacos with rice and beans. He loved the tacos but not the rice and beans. Beans had a smokey flavor. We did feel the prices for the taco plates were a little high but all in all a good place, probably better when warm.
Food was excellent! I had the pork carnitas. Place was really cute. They put a lot of effort into the remodeling of this place. Staff was very friendly. I give 5 stars and will be back.

Just ate here for the first time and it will definitely not be my last. Had the best chicken tacos since moving here 2 years ago from LA. Friends had the Tortas  and loved them. Will be coming back again and again. Can not wait until the weather warms up because the outside looks like a great place to hang with friends and family.

Delicious! I got the chicken green chili tacos, beef taco, and the rice and beans. All excellent. The chips and salsa are really good. The guacamole wasn't the best and a little brown. Server wasn't very good (slow and not knowledgeable). Love the decorations and the draft beer selection. I'll definitely be back. So excited a place like this is in QC.

This is a really great local spot owned and ran by locals. Great outdoor space with corn hole, fire pits, kids area and even beach volleyball. The food is really good and Art the chef is great. The service was really good and I will definitely being going back! 
I ordered three different tacos steak, chicken and fish. The steak was my favorite! Art even brought me out a tasting of his marinade.... Fantastic. There are 4 salsas I liked the chipotle and tomatillo. The chips have a 17 spice seasoning and are delicious... I ate two bowls worth. 
Check it out!
Went back to try again on a warmer day. Tacos were still excellent and it was much nicer to eat and not be freezing lol.

Great little gem! Clean, friendly and quick service. The broth they use for this ramen is excellent! We also ordered the chicken fried rice and shrimp tempura. The tarter sauce for the shrimp was really good.

I happened to be driving down Sahara when I saw a "ramen" sign. In this shopping center.  I wasn't that hungry, but I had to try this new restaurant. The hostess/server was very nice and polite, which always is important.

The menu has a lot of choices for a ramen restaurant and they serve Yakisoba as well.

I tried the kimchee miso ramen, where they stir fry the kimchee and chashu together before adding to the ramen. I really liked the flavor, but I will need to try my favorite staple, shoyu ramen in the future

When I try the shoyu ramen next time I will be able to compare and contrast this place with others around town.

The noodles didn't seem harder than other ramen places, and I like the noodles better at Monta. 

However, this place is not crowded, roomy, and much closer to my home.  I will come back here for sure!

The gyoza was fresh and apparently it is made daily.. As well as the Kim Chee. 

I hope others find and try this place as it is pretty good.

Very disappointing. Ramen stock had no flavor at all--watery. We had the miso ramen, but I guess they forgot to add the miso!? Cha Shu tasted like medicine..not freshly made. I've been to every ramen place in Vegas, and many in Japan for years, this is not ramen. Save your money and buy top ramen at Smiths for a quarter. We told the waitress the ramen was watery and her reply was that we didn't know what we were talking about. Would have complained in Japanese, but she wouldn't have understood, she was Chinese. 残念！ So maybe this is the Chinese version of ramen, whatever it was it was terrible!

I eat here everyday just about... I love the gyoza, they hand make them fresh every day, and i cant get enough of the katsu, the mochiko chicken and their fried rice... The ramen is also very good, ive had a few different kinds, the chashu, tempura shrimp, and chicken katsu ramen are my favorites

Tried the House Ramen, and mochiko chicken for a side and was very tasty to say the least. Good flavor overall even if it's more on the bland side. I wouldn't want to compare to other Ramen places in town, but for a place that's brand new and still working out their kinks on the menu, (it's a good menu) it should only get better.

This guy hauled away some messed up appliances and better than I expected. He was where he said he would be when he said and I couldn't be there so I had to trust him with the site and 2 properties security. He has the tools to do the job and was courteous to a fault. I will definitely use his services again and recommend his cleaning services for heavy deep cleaning. I have a property with heavy grease and will let you know how it went later...go to guy from now on!!
I am very pleased with how efficient and professional Vince was. He removed washer and dryer even gave me same day service! I will be calling him again for work around my house. CZ

Vince is truly a professional,  honest, hard working and efficient.  Went well beyond the job to make everything work. Will be using his service again and again. His work goes well beyond what he is paid for. One phone call and he was there the next morning. 
He handled a two man job all by himself.  Impressive.

I always struggle with finding just the right mover, but this time I found a great mover who does a great job. First, Vince was upfront about what he could do and he delivered. I was moving my office and he took the time to make sure I was good with how he was going to do the job. Second, his price cannot be beat. When I move my office furniture into my new office I will choose Vince, and whenever I need to move anything he will be my first call.

What a way to end the Elite Yelp year.  I had so much fun at this event! Hailey is an awesome & sweet host. The sweet swag, the festive music,  hilarious shenanigans in the photo booth, delicious waffles, and fabulous Yelp friends made this an amazing night. The owner of Yo Waffle is super nice and welcoming. They even had vegan froyo options! 

We also got to write thank you notes to the troops. 

Thanks Hailey for a great Elite event! Merry Christmas to all!

Thank you Hailey, Yelp, & Yo Waffle for spreading all the holiday cheer! I absolutely love the Holidays so I was really excited to see this Ugly Sweater event come up ... and I was even more excited to see that it was going to be held at a frozen yogurt place that has waffles.

This event was filled with contests, my favorite being the fro yo eating, and cute activities like the Naughty & Nice wall, as well as a photo booth.

The waffle was delicious as was the fro yo! They had holiday flavors like candy cane & egg nog. The staff was super friendly & helpful in getting people drinks, sample cups, etc.

By far one of my favorite events! Thank you again everyone!!

Yo Yo Yo....what a great party @ Yo Waffle!   As soon as you walk in it smells so good. They have a great variety of yogurts birthday cake, salty carmel, California tart just to name a few. We got to sample as much as we wanted. Score! The waffle was delicious and it was so much fun creating a fun and delicious dessert. Great selection of toppings too,plenty of fruit option....which I really like.

Hailey and crew did a fabulous job with all the Yelp activities, photo booth, contests & giving us the opportunity to write letters to our servicemen & women. Thank you Yo Waffle for hosting, we will be back.

Thank you Tisha, and thanks to your whole team who kept this evening running so incredibly smoothly.

Thank you Hailey for being you, a natural born party hostess, who seems perfect for this role of CM.  You have grace.

Thank you Erica for your dedication in capturing all the little moments that comprise a special event.  Your talent is enjoyed by all.

What a smart way to choose a winning sweater.  Everyone was given 4 Yelp voting stickers, which you were to apply to your favorite sweaters, and congrats to Kurdy for killing it, 2 years in a row.

The yogurt flavors were delightful.  A great mixture of tart and smooth.  Orange and Vanilla went great together as a 50/50 bar.

The waffle was substantial and filling, made with pearl (nib) sugar, and there were a bevy of appetizing toppings, including cookie butter!

Let's show this location some love!  Dont forget to come back as a customer!

The night was filled with waffles, yogurt, photo booths, swag, eating contests, ugly sweaters and smiles. Seriously thank you Hailey for putting on this amazing event and Yo Waffle for accommodating all of us Yelpers!

It was great seeing everyone in the holiday spirit and even the wait in line was fun. We all checked out each others sweaters, stuck stickers on each other and taste tested the whole line of yogurts. By the time we made it to the front, I struggled to limit my toppings so I wouldn't explode. Everything looked so good from the crushed butterfingers to the gooey caramel sauce.

The waffles tasted amazing and the company was even better. We loved the photo booth and the photographers were so sweet! Seeing all the contests was a good laugh and overall a great night. Thanks again for such a great event and can't wait to see everyone again!

This was my first Yelp Elite Event, and I have to say, it was quite a treat!
I had the opportunity to feast on the most delectable waffles, fro-yo, toppings-a-plenty, and that is just the food!
There were plenty of games, a King of the Ugly Sweaters competition (And those winners were fabulous!), plenty of opportunities to mingle, and meet the other Yelpers abound!
The staff of Yo Waffle were very helpful and accommodating, even walking around with glasses of water for anyone who might be parched, making coffee, cocoa, tea, and otherwise being a general delight. To them I thank you all!
Thank you to the Yelp team, Hailey, to the Photographer (I apologize I missed her name, but she was adorable and so nice). The Photo Booth was a nice touch, and my favorite addition to the night.

Such a fun event!

I don't make it over to this part of the town that often, but it's always nice to find new places. My +1 lives really close by to Yo Waffle and she had never been here, and like me, she loved it so I'm sure we'll be back. 

A yogurt place that ALSO serves waffles is such a good idea, and I really liked everything I tried. Both the pistachio gelato & vanilla custard were really good! The waffle was delicious! I added some nutella to mine, but I could tell just on it's own the waffle was really good. 

The staff at Yo Waffle were EXTREMELY friendly. It was cold, and they even made me and my friend coffee right before the event ended. Thanks Hailey & the staff at Yo Waffle for a fun time!

Had a fun first night in phnx visiting my grandma  and taking her to her first yelp event ! I saw this event on the yelp elite event and it seemed perfect for my sweet grandma . When we arrived we were greeted so sweetly. We got some cool yelp swag upon entry which was fun! Unfortunately , I do not believe we were given the stickers everyone had . I realized this later when everyone was placing them on each other . 
  The venue was nice and our frozen yogurt was delicious . I wish I had known the waffles would be such a long line so I would have ordered them from the beginning . My only suggestion is if the waffles could be made before we arrived . I understand they need to be made to order and fresh but some people who wanted waffles literally stood for 45 minutes . And my grandma and I never got ours . However, I did order her some yummy hot chocolate so that was nice . I like how there were creative and fun activities to do outdoors as well. We took a photo in the booth and I got some treats after playing the naughty or nice game . Thanks again Hailey for such a fun night !

When I think of Yo Waffle, I think of four words:  What a Pleasant Surprise.  I had no idea of what to expect.  We entered the front of the restaurant, were promptly greeted, and since the line was long we were offered a giant Yogurt container and sampled almost every flavor as we moved towards the waffle grill.  My favorites were Orange and Birthday Cake.  Next time I will mix them.  I also loved Apple, Pistachio, and several other flavors.  The waffles were awesome.  Next time I will eat the waffle with nothing on it, except maybe honey.  I definitely give this location an A+++ for great service, friendly smiles, and wonderful treats.  A great place to take your out of town visiting guests!

What a fun holiday-themed event!
My wife and I loved all the Ugly Sweaters, and, though the line was long, it was worth the wait.
The staff was very courteous and provided everyone with hot cocoa, waffles, frozen yogurt and lots of fun toppings.  It was also very cool that this was a kid-friendly event.
Thanks as always to Hailey for putting on such a great Yelp Elite event.

Yo it's all about the waffle.  It is one of the nicest froyo places in the valley, but I like the "plain" waffle s the best.  

Hailey and the folks at Yo Waffle were organized, friendly and fun.  It was a great Christmas (Holiday) season event!  I was happy to meet a few of the Yelp'ers I follow.  Almost everyone was in the spirit of the season.  

Good food and fun people YEA!!!

Yo waffle, yo way! What a fun event hosted by Hailey! We got to try a multitude of flavors of frozen yogurt including pistachio, strawberry, candy cane, and Valencia orange. My favorite was the combination of orange and vanilla. It was like eating a frozen yogurt creamsicle.

The waffle was great as well, with a lovely balance of crisp and chewy textures. The toppings were plentiful with various syrups to choose from as well.

I was rockin' a little holiday number several sizes too big for me consisting of two drunk looking sheepdogs courtesy of the local Goodwill, and enjoyed seeing everyone else's ode to the holidays in sweater form. I also got to meet my coffee mug buddy Meagan B.! 

The staff here were all wonderful and it was a great way to be introduced to this wonderful business. Thanks for a lovely evening!

Although it was quite a drive for us, we are thankful for Hailey B., Yelp, and Yo Waffle for inviting us and throwing another awesome event!  I loved seeing everyone's ugly sweater, not to mention the interactive games.  Kudos to Hailey for going above and beyond when it comes to imagination and creativity.  

Thank you Yo Waffle for letting us invade your territory.  Loved all the flavors, especially cookies and cream.  Toppings were fresh and they practically have every topping imaginable!!!  To top it off, the waffle was perfectly cooked and right out of the oven!

I enjoyed myself and was happy to meet some new faces.  Can't wait for 2016!  Cheers!

Outstanding event Yelp! Thanks for sharing Yo Waffle, great product and we will definitely be coming back! Very good ice cream selection, although they were missing peanut butter..... Salted Caramel and Triple Chocolate are outstanding. Great topping selections as well. The waffles are very good. Small sit down space, better to grab and go. The seasonal Egg Nog was good, although I prefer the Peppermint, as it is not to sharp, but just right.

What a fantastic and festive holiday event!  Special thanks to Hailey and Tisha for putting everything together and making the experience an amazing one for all. I especially had fun mingling with my wife and meeting new Elite friends! The quality of the waffle and frozen yogurt was very good and something I will definitely recommend to my buddies. Can't wait for the next event!

YO Waffle! What a perfect place to hold the annual ugly sweater holiday party! How can you beat a sweet night filled with fro-yo, fresh belgian waffles, and toppings galore?! And with a fam of awesome people?!

The lovely owner of yo waffle talked to us about how she started the business and how they carefully craft their waffles and flavors. What's really special is that each waffle is made to order so it's piping hot and fresh to each and every hungry customer! The fro-yo was delicious coming in a variety of flavors like egg nog, tahitian vanilla, pistachio, birthday cake and more! The waffle was so scrumptious especially with some hot nutella. Thank you so much for hosting us tonight!!

Hailey was absolutely incredible and organized a plethora of fun activities. We were all judges in voting for the best ugly sweaters and were given stickers to place on our favorites. Not only was it fun, but it was such a nice way to bond and get to know others. There were 2 rounds of a fro-yo eating contest! The camaraderie was great, everyone was cheering on with encouragement! "My face is so numb!" shouted one contestant. "It's like I just came from the dentist," stated another, mouth completely numb. A winning contestant proudly displayed his fro-yo coated beard! True dedication! There was also a naughty or nice table for little surprise swag. We got an opportunity to write thank you cards to the troops which I found to be so sweet! The photobooth complete with X-mas props was also a nice touch to the event, memories forever captured!! Thank you so much Hailey! :)

The best part of the event was meeting a ton of fun and good quality people! I can't wait for the next event!! Happy Holidays everyone!!!

A very chill Yelp Elite event! Thanks to Hailey, Erica and the folks at Yo Waffle for having us last night. Got some free gloves just for checking in. We came out from Scottsdale to try this place out and it was worth it. The hosts were incredibly welcoming and the owner personally greeted us and chatted with us as we waited in line. We were able to try the different flavors of froyo, gelato and sorbet as we indulged in the smell of freshly made waffles. My favorites were the Valencia orange and triple chocolate. My sweet tooth has lessened over the past year, so my food was quite decadent. I tried to balance it with fruit, which helped slightly. I do prefer savory foods, but obviously this is a froyo and waffle place, so there's only sweet items. 

I loved the atmosphere of the event: people dressed in their holiday sweaters (the joint one and the Barbie one were the best imo), the decorations and the weather were perfect. The outside had a photobooth, cup game (so creative) and even a froyo eating contest. We ended our night by playing Jenga, or tumbling towers. Overall, I enjoyed the night and it seems like this business will continue to do well.

Opened a year ago, I am surprised this place isn't as popular as it should be!!! YoWAFFLE ever'day! 

First of, I would love to thank Trisha and her whole crew for letting us Phoenix Yelpers try Yo Waffle. Secondly, thank you to Hailey and her Yelp Crew for putting this Ugly Sweater Event eating yummy Froyo with Belgium Waffles! 

Starting off, I haven't been to a Yelp Event in a while because of schedule conflicts but I was glad to have made it to this one. It was great meeting lots of new joined Yelpers and Elites and also seeing Elites and Yelpers I have never met in person but on Yelp. 
We started off trying flavors out, the YoWaffle team made it so nice to sample their froyos while waiting for the each Belgium Waffles to be made from Scratch. Trisha, the owner, said they have tiny little Belgium beads....I believe, don't quote me on that, but it is imported in and it really makes it extra special. They are unique in that aspect. 

I really liked the Vanilla custard, the Candy Cane, the Sea Salt and the Cookies and Cream Froyos. The Belgium waffle, as stated earlier has ingredients that makes it extra decadent and crispy. It is really yummy when it is fresh because it is warm and the froyo is cold. So that contrast makes it super yummy. Along with the 40 other toppings from your classic gummy bears/worms to your walnuts/peanuts. They even have mochi and Nutella! Mmmm. They had lots of fresh fruits and they all looked yummy, I wanted it all. 
I believe I saw on the board...a normal cup size is about $0.49/oz. Something like that, I didn't pay attention....but it was somewhere in the ballpark like that. 

The games outside were super fun from "being NAUGHTY or NICE" prices; I was nice. I got some nice candies. :D My sister, Kellie, was nice, too; she got candy and a handheld charger...pretty nifty if you asked me. We wrote Christmas Cards to the troops...which is always nice. There was a game of Jenga. There was a cute little PhotoBooth...which is always nice! Last but not least, there were two games of Froyo eating contest. My sister, Kellie, was in the second contest...and to quote her, "I can't feel my face." LOL. I believe Jackson won that round....along with the first round. Way the go, Jackson! I believe that was his first yelp event with his mom! 

What a night. It was so much FUN! Thank you YELP!

Anyway, if you are craving waffles....craving froyo and in the Gilbert/Mesa area by Higley and Elliot...should drop by!!!

As the current reining dutchess of Yo Waffle I was a tad worried about a possible threat to my title after this epic Ugly Christmas Sweater event.  And they really know how to throw a party!  (My little guy was washing froyo out of his hair until midnight!) 

Our favorite flavor that night was the eggnog froyo, served over a warm waffle with a dollop of whipped cream.  It was heavenly!

Sot on customer service, delicious frozen yogurt, a variety of toppings, and freshly made Belgian waffles...  Clearly any sane person WOULD stay up nights worrying about incoming threats to their royal title after others got a taste of this good life. Amiright?!?  

Well, I'll have to warn anyone who has any funny ideas that I'm increasing palace security, and upping my current check-ins over here.  (Which is easy to do because I live about a quarter mile away and this is my kids favorite after dinner treat, and I currently forget to check in most times I'm there...) 

There will be NO new Yo Waffle Dutchess!

This was an awesome event and we got to wear our Ugly Christmas Sweaters on top of it all. This was a wonderful sweet treat, with fun games outside ,including a Frozen Yogurt  eating contest!
There were lovely Heaters outside as well to keep everyone nice and warm!
The owner and staff were awesome and explained a lot about the business.
While the Yogurt was all very good ,with some really cool flavors, the winner of the night???
Was the Waffles!! These are by far the most amazing waffles ever. They taste like they are infused with Honey. But, it is actually sugar pearls. Awesome and delicious!
The toppings they had to choose from were fantastic including all the syrups!
I am really looking forward to going back soon.

I just want to say .. Good food ! Good service ... 
Come in here ... You will not be disappointed
.

We were looking for dim sum before 10 am on a Friday morning and drove to this restaurant based on an old listing for the previous restaurant. Fortunately it was the first day this new restaurant opened and we were among the first customers. It was surprisingly busy for that hour, but many of the tables may have been friends of the new owners or staff. 

The food and service were both excellent. We've tried a few dim sum places in Las Vegas and they have never compared well to the larger dim sum restaurants in the San Gabriel Valley. We had a good selection of fresh dishes and polite, friendly service that is not always part of the dim sum experience.

It isn't an easy place to find - tucked into the corner of a small shopping center. It is worth the effort, though. It was definitely the best dim sum that I have had in Las Vegas. I look forward to returning on my next visit.

When is use to be Cathay house/jade the service was very good. Now that it has been remodeled and reopen again I feel as if the service isn't great. The carts don't come as often as they use to. Especially since they put us in the back room. It's the first time I've felt dissatisfied eating dim sum.

Brand new boba place! 

Location - South Maryland PKWY directly across UNLV ; inside a strip mall plaza. Tons of parking but can become busy since it's right next to UNLV so keep that in mind when you're pressed for time. 

Atmosphere - Cozy hole in a wall joint; simple, elegant and very clean. The place is very contemporary, complete with WiFi, and enough tables & chairs if you opt to do any school work. One cool thing I found out is that the store design and props used are made of 100% recycled wooden pallets (the tables, benches, the back counter wall, etc...)

Service - It was their first day opening and I was informed it was a soft opening. Service was quick and pleasant. No complaints. 

Product - I ordered the Honeydew Milk Tea with Boba. It was really good and refreshing. My main complaint about other boba places I've been to is that their drinks tend to feel grainy and powdery, which is a good indication that it's either old and powder based with very little liquid content. Did I mention they have macaroons as well ? I pigged out on 2 Nutella macaroons (I'm a sucker for anything Nutella) and it was the bomb.com 

Final Thoughts - The place is brand spanking new. I would highly suggest to try them out. I'll definitely be back and try other stuff on the menu ... Oh and their macaroons are life ...

Chewy Boba company is a franchise with a location across from UNLV. I stopped in after getting take out from Braddahs next door. They have a wide variety of milk teas and smoothies that you can add boba or a variety of other drink-add ins to like jellies.

I picked up a boba milk tea and a Thai tea. Both were really good and prices are typical to a like establishment. The drinks didn't have anything making it unique or better from other boba places around China town but that doesn't mean I didn't enjoy my drink. 

They also offer macaroons for $2.25 each but a quarter is taken off each if you buy a dozen. They did look beautiful and offer many unique flavors like pumpkin spice. I didn't try any but the fact that they're not made in store and run the risk of dryness turns me away.

My drink was made quickly and the cashier was nice.

The shop is cute, clean, bright, and has plenty of seating.

I tried this new spot near UNLV, I really like the decor and the style of this boba joint. They have a wide variety of flavors of teas and slushed along with toppings. I got the mango lychee slush with honey boba. The slush was good but the boba was really hard. It must of been undercooked but it was one of the reasons I could not finish my drink. Other than that, it was good!

So far, I've tried the thai tea and the milk tea.  I have also tried the pumpkin spice macaroon as well as the nutella macaroon. Both are great and are around $2 each. The boba and macaroons are delicious and pretty inexpensive. It's really convenient to have a boba place right across campus as I hate making the commute to china town. Overall, Chewy has a nice interior ( I may start hanging out here in between classes) and a friendly staff. I'll definitely be addicted to this place.

The Las Vegas bubble tea scene is finally starting to come into its own. What a time we live in.

Chewy Boba Company is a chain that originated in Florida. They just opened in Las Vegas last week, bringing a menu full of milk teas, non-milk teas, slushies, smoothies, specialty drinks (I forgot who asked me about oreo milk tea, but there's cookies and cream here), and frappes. Their add-ons include a huge variety of jellies and popping pearls. But what drew my eye is that they offer both mini boba and sea salt cream, each of which was previously only available at one Las Vegas location (to the best of my knowledge), and neither under the same roof... until now.

I was very fortunate to stumble upon them today. I was having lunch right next door at Braddah's Island Style, which graciously had a few copies of the Chewy Boba to-go menu near their register. I also saw a Yelp tip about the buy one, get one 50% off soft opening deal (today was the last day, sorry guys), which the Chewy Boba employee in the front spontaneously told me about it when I walked up to the counter. I was actually contemplating that other boba chain on Maryland for teas and was pleased that I wouldn't have to experiment with their teas.

With no other customers in sight, I carefully browsed the menu and asked questions. Yes, they do offer ice and sweetness adjustments. No, they generally don't have fresh fruit except for avocado, banana, and something else that escapes my memory. And no, they didn't have mini boba, but yes, they could make it if I was willing to wait 20 minutes. Not a problem for me on this day. Phew!

I tried some macarons while waiting for the mini boba. They're $2.25 each, or $12 for 6, or $23 for 12 if you dare. They're an "authorized distributor" of Macaron Cafe, which apparently is somewhat well-known in New York City. While I have no idea if they managed to keep the quality up while shipping the macarons across the country, I actually quite enjoyed my selections. The green tea macaron had surprisingly decent matcha flavor, and the pumpkin spice macaron lived up to expectations. Texture-wise, the "cookies" may be a little soft/wet, but I appreciated the soft, plentiful filling. Overall: great flavors, could use improvement in texture, and better than that place in the Galleria Mall.

Back to the drinks, which is what's really important. I chose the large sea salt coffee without other add-ons ($3.75, plus $0.60 for large). Although I asked for less sweetness, this was still definitely on the sweet side of drinks, and the lighter side of coffee. Also, I think whatever salt is there is getting a little drowned out. But you know what? It still tastes yummy, bearing somewhat of a resemblance to my favorite local sea salt coffee, and I'm finding it hard to stop sipping.

Also hard to stop: my jasmine milk tea, less sweetness, no ice, with mini boba ($4.85 total since toppings are $0.50). Feel free to check my other reviews for the "gospel of mini boba" but I'm just gonna say that the freshly made mini boba is the best version of it that I've had. It's as al dente as the full size, and the flavor is good even though it's not honey boba. I did have some issues with it getting stuck in the normal-sized straw, but that seems to be a bit of an inherent risk. The jasmine flavor is relatively weak, and the sweetness was surprisingly low, so I would stick to full sweetness next time. But I still enjoyed the milkiness and the mini boba, so I slurped it almost all down before I got home.

They have a buy ten, get one (16 oz drink) free stamp card. It's clean so far, as expected of a new place, and they have about as much seating as you'll usually find in a good bubble tea shop. Also, their to-go menu states that they have the ideal customer satisfaction policy: they will adjust or remake your drink to your liking. I didn't feel like testing them over relatively small issues, one of which I could have avoided entirely. Besides, the quantity of ice in the coffee was actually quite modest.

This isn't the best boba in town, but maybe it's the second best. I'll definitely make excuses to return to Chewy Boba Company sooner than later. They're closer to my side of town than most spots, and they should do really well because they're right across from UNLV and are reasonably priced.

Great new boba joint! 

What I notice right off the back is the unique graffiti art on the wall. Very modern layout and design (furnitures are all custom made). Good selection of drinks from slush, tea and smoothie! Will definitely be back for more of that good good! 

FYI: Tarocado (avacodo and taro) is so bomb!

I ordered a Sea Salt Green Tea with 1/2 mini boba and 1/2 regular boba. 
The boba were both chewy and just right. You could actually play around with the mini boba lol. They gave you a lot of sea salt creme on top. However, its kinda sweet for me so I would definitely ask for less sweet next time. Also, i don't really feel the taste of green tea in it, not sure if they made it from real brew tea, and it's more like a regular milk tea.
I would come back and try another drink thou.
Got the lychee tea with aloe and boba. Great service and great boba tea. Comparable to what you would find in Southern California.

Family-owned boba shop from Florida made its arrival in Las Vegas just last week. They are located directly across from Student Union, making it a convenient place for a quick boba fix or study session. 

ATMOSPHERE
Walk in and you will immediately notice this cool, instagram-worthy graffiti artwork on the right wall. Place is modern and simple with few tables and wooden bench along the wall. Menu is displayed on three LED screen above the counter with a tiny font, making it difficult for people with poor vision like me to see what they have. They also sell some shirts with printed logo, which I believe are on sale for $15. Represent!

SERVICE
I was warmly greeted by a lady and a gentleman, both super friendly and helpful. They were able to help me decide which drink to get. 

DRINK
My usual drink to test any boba shop is regular milk tea or jasmine milk tea but after talking to the friendly people here, I somehow ended up with a large honey milk tea with sea salt cream and boba. It came out to be $5.24 for their 24oz. 

I'm usually not a fan of sea salt cream because it is a lot milkier than just a regular milk tea but sea salt cream here wasn't too thick or overwhelming. Drink itself was really sweet for my liking so I would order this less sweet next time. 4/5

Boba here has al dente texture and is marinated in longan honey and brown sugar. Sadly I didn't taste any honey or brown sugar since my drink was honey milk tea but I enjoyed the texture of it. They also have mini boba which is rare to find in Vegas boba scene (as far as I know Tapioca Express is the only other place to have it). 

CONCLUSION
Good vibe, good drink, good boba. I will be back again real soon. Menu is limited right now since they are still under soft opening but seems like they are going to expand their selection, most likely adding white gourd/wintermelon. Make sure to grab their stamp card and stamp your way for a free 16oz drink!

Do you love boba? What about Star Wars? Come on down! 
Don't get the connection? Come find out.

Chris V put this spot on my radar by saying this was the only place (so far) to offer both sea salt cream and mini boba- and they do both exceptionally well. I daresay I enjoyed their sea salt coffee better than that other spot in town!

Macarons are the only edible currently available outside of various beverages- shipped in and refrigerated, not made on site, haven't tried them myself to make a judgement but they're cute enough to mention.

I love the logo and product enough to be tempted to buy a company t-shirt on my first visit- you will be too!

I have really tried to patronize this dealership since my wife bought a new vehicle from them in June 2011. However, their SERVICE DEPARTMENT SUCKS! They are always up-selling my wife things that are totally unnecessary by scaring her half to death that something ominous will happen if she doesn't buy this EXPENSIVE service item. They will do anything they can to AVOID WARRANTY REPAIRS. They have blamed her driving, Arizona heat...you name it. DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND AVOID HORNE HYUNDAI LIKE THE PLAGUE!!

IMHO, car dealers are right down there with Lawyers & Dentist. Horne Hyundai could change all that but alas, it would seem that the service representatives are on some kind of commission structure and $600 is the goal management wants to get from every non-warranty service appointment. You get a very reasonable oil change - tire rotation and inspection coupon via email. The inspection will remarkably turn up a collection of service issues that just happen to cost somewhere around $625 - $725. 
The fluids inspection is a really good idea, but they should explain the process and ask the car owner to watch as they check the fluids. So far they haven't given me any feedback about how long the service is going to take, so you wait and wait and wait.  No status reports, no updates and no way to change the TV channel or turn the volume down. I have suggested twice that since they have a TV, I wish they would give me a channel I could switch to and see the work being done on my car. That will never happen I guess because you might be able to see that there must be long periods of time that nothing is being done on your car.  Why else would it take 3 hours to do an oil change and tire rotation? You should always ask to see YOUR old parts (especially cabin filters, fuses and such...), watch any inspections that they will let you watch and go on test drives to explain how or when that noise, shimmy or what ever shows up. Tires are now rotated front to rear so you should black magic marker your front tires with a "F" to make sure they are rotated correctly. You would think that a $600 - $700 service charge would automatically be worth a free car wash. Although it was getting close to closing time, for the first time today I was offered a free car wash. Have a feeling that the service rep knew I was more that ready to get out of there, but the offer was appreciated
Will I go back? Yes, but I will be more watchful, ask more questions and be much more willing to get a second or even 3rd  service quote..

Everyone has been very courteous here! I came for an oil change and they had completed it very quick. They are also very honest and don't try and manipulate you into buying unnecessary things just to make profit. I am definitely coming back for all future services.

About a month ago I brought my 2002 Hyundai Sonata in to Horne Hyundai for them to do a 5K Service for $39.95 because I had a coupon I received in the mail. Before going to Horne Hyundai I had placed two black marker dots on my rear tires because I had read some reviews about Horne Hyundai not doing as they said for rotating tires and I was in disbelief of that.

The coupon stated Oil Change and Tire Rotation within 45 minutes or it's free and I was sure to point that out in the beginning and the guy working in service told me, "That's just for an oil change" but I had read all the fine print and it wasn't just for an oil change...

When doing the walk-around on my car I had pointed out some things I would like to get quoted on to be replaced (some trim inside the car) and I would like to know the prices of repair. I also made it very clear I needed to get my tires rotated because I was about to go on vacation driving 3k+ miles.

-- The waiting area -- It was alright. The chairs were pretty comfortable and they provided complimentary water. The TV was set to GMA News and it was acceptable but the angle was very awkward to watch it at. 

45 minutes in: No one had approached me at anytime to say they're still working on my car or anything of the sort. I was getting pretty anxious at this point...

90 minutes in: I didn't expect to wait 90 freaking minutes for an oil change and tire rotation and I was pretty pissed off at this point. At the end of waiting a man from the sales department dressed in a nice business suit approached me and told me everything was done, hurray! --He also gave me it for free--, so why is this only a two star rating?

- The tires weren't rotated!

- Greasy/oily handprints all over my cars exterior

- No quotes on getting my damaged interior trim replaced

- Customer service was terrible (until the very end when the businessman stepped in and was very polite)

- They gave me a real hard time about the coupon which clearly stated 45 minutes or it's free

- It took 90 minutes total for an oil change essentially
I was treated very well by your company and look forward to use your services in the future.

We recently took our vehicle into Horne Hyundai to have a fluid change and cleaning.  The service department technician was prompt, respectful and a wealth of information.  He didn't push anything on us, merely took our requirements, made some suggestions related to our service and then took care of us.  I would highly recommend this service department for all your vehicle needs.

I have to give the guys at Horne Hyundai five stars for customer service. 

First, let me say that I made a mistake and picked up the wrong Horne dealer and wrote them with a complaint. Twice I had taken my Kia, which we are leasing from Horne Kia in for service and twice I had asked for a valve stem cover to be replaced. TWICE I was ignored. One guy said that they would not have silver as it came from the factory. I said I don't care if it is purple, please put one on. Unfortunately, we drove all the way back from Gilbert to Maricopa before I thought to check, and then I found that it was still missing. 

On Saturday I wrote the Horne Hyundai service department, by mistake, and within minutes I had a call from their service department. I explained that I had made a mistake and had written a second time to apologize. The guy said he would send me a valve stem cover which I said was unnecessary because it was not their problem. Then I got an email apologizing for their poor service and finally a third email saying a full set of valve stem covers was being shipped and I should have them by Tuesday.

WOW and double WOW. Horne Kia should take note. They not only sent them and I received them yesterday. They sent them overnight FedEx! It is such a little thing, but it was important to me and they responded even though it was not their problem. Thank you kind sirs. :)

Stopped in to find out what type of cleaner to use on the interior of my 2014 Sonata which I purchased new from this dealership.  Poor customer service when the parts guy has no clue nor bothers to find out from anyone!!!

Michael in the service department is my hero! I bought my car here over a year ago and I refuse to take it anywhere else to have it serviced. They take such good care of me and my vehicle and have helped me so much! especially in an emergency they get me right in and solve the problem as quick as possible. I am so grateful for there great team and staff. They always make sure that me and my kids are comfortable while we wait and don't them running around I always recommend them to everyone I know who needs a car or needs to have service done Like I said I refuse to go anywhere else there the best in town!!!! Thanks again guys your awesome!!!!

I bought a 2011 Sonata from Horne a few years ago and have been very pleased with both the car and the service.  Been working with Michael in service department the  past couple of years and he's always courteous and helpful.  He always informs me of what services are due to maintain the warranty and other items that might need attention.  Never pressures me to do more than is necessary and I always walk out feeling confident that my car will continue to run well until next required maintenance appointment.

Horne Hyundai has always been friendly when I've come in for minor adjustments. So even though I moved only 1 mile away from San Tan Hyundai, I still went to Horne and am glad I did.  My AC went out (not good for AZ) and upon calling around, I was told that a diagnostic would cost me $120.  If it was covered under warranty, I'd get the money back. If not, it would go toward the repair. I called Horne and Mike said not to worry, he would do the diagnostic for free and depending on what he found, would go from  there.  I got there and he started working on it immediately   After about an hour, came back to say "Great news!  It's covered under warranty and we have the part in stock. If you can wait another hour, we'll get it in for you".  They got it fixed, washed my car and had it back sooner than I expected.  I plan to  use Horne from now on.
Requested work not addressed.  Parts missing from back bumper when Car returned.  Very combative service writer.

This place changed from paradise bakery to a Panera bread company. I didn't frequent Paradise often, but had been enough times to know it was solid in the things I ordered. My wife and I both felt incredibly underwhelmed with the food we got for lunch. The Mediterranean vegetable sandwich consisted of tomatoes, lettuce, cucumbers with a couple of crumbles of feta. The tomato soup is not close to what paradise had and isn't a worthy substitute. The garden vegetable soup was not tasty and neither was the Fontega chicken panini. 

Skip this place. Not worth the trip.

Krissy. Extremely nice, friendly wonderful person. Food was amazing also! Thank you for what you do. Loved how cheerful and professional she was! Thanks for starting our morning out right! If I had to say one thing though, the fast lane kiosk at the door make the place look cheap and mediocre.

Fantastic donuts and breakfast croissants. Family owned and very friendly. Donuts are fresh and taste great! Sandwiches on toast croissant or bagel. Smoothies , ice tea coffee, cappuccino, and hot cocoa. Open early and prices are very reasonable. Welcome them to the neighborhood!

Delicious donuts that are fresh and tasty. Even better is that it's near my neighborhood. They have smoothies with boba in a variety of flavors that I no longer need to drive to Avondale to enjoy . My family has tried three flavors and they were all good. The service is friendly and they are open later in the evening that takes care of after dinner dessert cravings.
This place has the most amazing donuts! This is now my go to place when I have a donut craving.

Love this place! I'm glad they opened. They're friendly and we are loyal return customers. Help out this small business to keep them in our local community. Like most small businesses they have a lot of room to grow so I hope they don't go out of business.

OMG!!  We have been in desperate need of a fresh donut shop on this side of town for years.  This place is great.  Friendly service?  Fresh delicious donuts?  It's a win-win situation.

Pros; convenient, friendly, delicious

Cons; I will probably gain 500 pounds this year....LOL

I did not go to this event since my son treated me to this show last Sat. I had never seen the Nutcracker before and was excited to see it for the first time. The story is in the program but I was taken away but the pointe dancers, the magnificent costumes and all the hard work put into this production.

The production does not use a live orchestra but rather you listen to the soundtrack as you watch the performers dance. I love how they used a Shadyside home as well as Pittsburgh locale to serve as the setting before "Marie" enters the world of the Sugar Plum fairy.

The pas de deux in Act 2 literally blew me away as well as the use of a carousel and the world of magic. You will find the familiar "Waltz of the flowers," "the Snow Queen", as well as the "Sugar Plum fairy" tunes you've grown to love along with other music that tell the story of Marie's beloved Nutcracker.

This is a Pittsburgh holiday tradition for family and friends. Dancers change depending upon performance date but all do an outstanding job. This is one production that makes Pittsburgh proud!

What a wonderful production. This was my first time seeing the nutcracker and was totally enthralled by each scene, dancing and costumes. It's like fully cocooning oneself in whimsy. Thank you Yelp Pgh for organizing!

I had never seen The Nutcracker before so when I got the email with notification that Yelp had tickets, I jumped at the chance to go (I got so excited that I think I submitted two requests because my phone wasn't working fast enough for me :) ). 
It is at The Benedum which is a fantastic venue. You step into the lobby and it is like stepping back into time. The lobby beautifully appointed with sparkling chandeliers that glow warmly, inviting you in from the cold, frosty air outside. It didn't hurt that on this night, the air was cold, colder than it has been all season and the snow started flying while we watched Marie and The Nutcracker dance across the stage. We were also greeted by carolers singing beautifully as we waited to get into the auditorium. It certainly brightened my spirit making it seem much more Christmas than it has recently (the warm weather has dampened my spirit a little). 
Now on with the ballet... What an awesome job the Pittsburgh ballet does! It was beautifully done. I love that they use Pittsburgh and all things Pittsburgh. The costumes are amazing! The colors are just so vibrant. And the dancers, wow, exquisite! I could watch point all day and night and not get tired. It is absolutely mesmerizing to me. It all comes together for an awesome display, a feast for your eyes if you will. It was amazing!
If you ever get the chance to see The Nutcracker, do it! It was just breathtaking! And it certainly adds to the holiday spirit. Thank you Yelp for affording me the opportunity to see The Nutcracker it was unforgettable and I absolutely loved it!

This is an excellent production of the Nutcracker. There are magical special effects that emphasize the dream-like fantasy of Tchaikovsky's masterpiece. There are humorous scenes that made the youngsters sitting around us giggle with pleasure. There is masterful dancing, such as the serenely beautiful duet in the Arabian Dance. It all takes place in a spectacular venue. This is a marvelous Pittsburgh tradition, wonderfully staged. 

My only concern is the lack of live music. The taped music is okay, however it can't compare with the excitement of a live orchestral performance.

Ballet is an important holiday tradition for me! Growing up with a (really talented) ballerina for a sister meant that I was involved in a Nutcracker production of some sort for around ten years. She used to be in the Pittsburgh Ballet Theater's grad program, meaning she danced in this particular production several times...she was a bird in the aviary sequence in high school followed by the snow and flowers scenes several times. I have happy memories of this show from years past, so I jumped at the chance to see it again and share it with my boyfriend. We both enjoyed ourselves immensely! We scored great orchestra-level seating with a clear view. The revamped snow scene looked wonderful, as did the staging of the battle scene. I loved seeing the penguin toy with a hockey stick due to it being a Pens game night! (The rats wave Terrible Towels on Steelers game nights too.) Overall this is a wonderful Pittsburgh version of a beloved holiday production, and it's not to be missed if you can help it!

If I had to use only one word to give a review it would be BREATHTAKING. I have not been to see the Nutcracker in many years so I was very excited to see it. I didn't realize how many connections the Nutcracker had with Pittsburgh until o read about it in the program. Before they ballet opened they brought Sally Wiggan, a local newscaster, and shared that she was going to be one of the guests at the party in the Nutcracker. She stated she had the opportunity to "attend the party" several times and really enjoyed it. Again they were bringing a bit of Pittsburgh into the ballet.
From the moment the curtained opened until the final curtain I was mesmerized. Everything was literally on pointe. I loved how they incorporated some of today's dance moves into the ballet by in the first act the young man did a few. Whip and Nae Nae moves. It was funny to see who in the audience knew what he was doing. Later in the performance a young man did the Cabbage Patch and the Sprinkler. Again, it was funny to see who responded. 
I think most little girls would want to play the part of Marie or the Sugar Plum Fairy but the dancer who drew my eye was the young woman who was the Arabian dancer. She was flawless, graceful, and to me was the best ballerina of the show.  She made everything she did look effortless. 
Of course seeing the tiny dancers is heartwarming. They are all just adorable. In one part of the show the little ones were building a human pyramid and one of the tots who was supposed to be on top just couldn't make it. It didn't mess up the performance, it actually made it more enchanting. Of course my very favorite was at the end when the bees turned their backs to us and wiggled their behinds. 
I don't know if many little girls dream about becoming a ballerina in today's world where they can dream about one of the many options they have but I dreamed of being a ballerina when I was little. Tonight I'll be dreaming about being a ballerina again.

This was my second time seeing The Nutcracker in Pittsburgh, and it's quickly becoming a holiday tradition. Between the unseasonably warm weather we have been having and a very busy work schedule, I've been finding it hard to get into the holiday spirit. Last night definitely changed that for me, thanks to this production.

I enjoy attending shows at the Benedum Center because it is like stepping back in time. The building and theater are absolutely beautiful, and unlike any "modern" theaters or concert halls. 

PBT puts on a great production, with very talented dancers and whimsical sets. The show is very thoughtfully planned to appeal to all ages. While my friend and I were able to appreciate the complexity of the dances, the younger audience members were engaged by the special effects and silly moments.

Overall, this was a really nice evening. I plan to continue to support PBT and their production of The Nutcracker as it is a wonderful way to experience some Christmas magic and get into the holiday spirit!

Thanks as always to Rachel and the Pittsburgh Yelp team for securing tickets for us to The Nutcracker! The hubby and I planned a fun evening around the event, starting the evening with appetizers and drinks at Sonoma and ending with dinner and dessert at Butcher and the Rye.

I have only been to The Nutcracker a couple other times during my life (once as a little girl and another time in college) and was really looking forward to attending for the third time. I wish that I could say the show lived up to my expectations, but to be perfectly honest, it did not. For me, the bright spots of the performance were the Snow King and Snow Queen, the Arabian dancers, and the fun Pittsburgh references, such as the large clock and the party guests. I struggled with the pace of the show as it began to feel long to me, especially in Act I, and also with the very softly projected pre-recorded music. Maybe the music was louder closer to the stage, but from row R on the main floor, I could more easily hear a number of whispered conversations and show commentary occurring around me than I could hear the actual music.

I love attending plays and musicals but must admit that I would have been disappointed to have paid $50/seat to attend this show. I have really enjoyed attending both A Musical Christmas Carol and the Holiday Pops in the past and would prefer to return to them - at a lower cost - in the future versus coming back to The Nutcracker.

The Nutcracker is a classic in any city, and Yelp giving away free tickets was pretty cool.

As someone who has had the luxury of seeing some great ballet, the Nutcracker in Pittsburgh doesn't really do my artistic soul any justice.  I will say that Marie and the Nutcracker on this night were quite good.  However, the lack of a live orchestra is truly wrong on so many levels.  If you are someone with a strong classical music background, you will need to just view this production as a spectacle.  This isn't New York, Chicago, or Boston for sure.

Once you sit back and just take this as a free evening to get into the Christmas spirit, this is a fun way to get ready for the holidays. The children dancers are really cute, and it is fun to see the little kids dress up to go to the show.  We also had pretty good seats for the ballet. The left center of the orchestra 6 rows from the back gave us a view of most of the stage.

All in all, I wouldn't pay much to see this production, but it is an enjoyable evening out.

Grand Opening of the Store and was very impressed with the selection of merchandise they have to offer for all occasions and at very affordable prices.  One of the best selection of BALLONS I have ever seen.
I look forward to shopping here again!

Best party supply store in Vegas for sure!! The staff was very helpful and the customer service was excellent. I needed some balloons for my grandma's birthday and they helped me pick the perfect ones. My grandma loved them. They have a great stock of party supplies for any occasion and I'll definitely be coming back.

Located in the same shopping plaza as Sushimon, I noticed the hand-crafted signs noting a grand opening for a new party supply store scattered through the lot.  I needed a couple balloons for a kid's birthday party, so location was convenient after lunch.  

They had a good selection, including some fancy foil ones that seemed to fit the bill, and along with a grand opening discount, the prices seemed more than fair.

The young girl behind the counter seemed eager to help, was friendly and pointed out a couple options that I didn't initially see on the wall.

I'd give them a shot, esp if you are in the area already :)

The location is a little harder to find but it's situated behind the residence building on balsam St. You'll have to turn to larch to get behind the building. 

Bao is very rustic shop that provides Asian fusion banh mi and baos! They definitely put their own style into their food. Very good and very unique! 

I had the Kimchi fries with bulgogi. Definitely will come back!

Newly opened Bao/Banh Mi restaurant in Waterloo, very close to WCI. It's in the 62 Balsam building but on the other side of the building so you have to go around. They're having 25% off right now (not sure how long this promo is going on for). Decor was nice, I liked the wooden tables. It's pretty spacious inside and fairly cozy. I had the 5 spice pork belly bao (3.75) and Thai tea (1.50). The Thai tea was great, tastes like a milk tea sweetened with condensed milk. The 5 spice bao was a little lacking in flavour and the white sauce inside was a little odd in my opinion. Tried some of my friend's fries, which were quite good, though on the peppery side. Service is excellent, you have the option to get take out or dine in. Will definitely be back!
Fantastic .. Simple and yummy , anything better then pork belly with crackling ? Nope ... It's behind the building so keep looking .. Will be back often , well done ..

My girlfriend and I decided to check this new place out on a Saturday night.

The atmosphere felt like the type of restaurant that would be found in downtown Toronto. It's a place where you could sit down with a couple of friends, grab a beer and chill. Or you could get some scooby snax to go. 

We got the 5 spice, the Korean and the crispy pork belly baos as well as the kimchi bulgogi fries. Overall, the fries definitely stood out to us the most in terms of flavour and portion for the cost. It was $4, and $2 extra for bulgogi added. Our favourite was the Korean bao! From what we remember it had bulgogi, scallions, cucumber, kimchi. 

We both agreed that if this was THE place to bring our family or friends when they visit in the future. We were both extremely satisfied with the experience. It was so refreshing to see a high-quality, quaint restaurant pop up in an area away from the shawarma and Chinese food crowd. 

- M. Jar

The Ace is a stylish and funky small hotel located in the East Liberty district.

They have done a wonder job of connecting the hotel to the local community through art commissions and programming. 

One entire floor of the hotel is occupied by the gym. This hotel has lots of cool amenities!

Intimate, community based hotel that encourages locals as well as visitors to enjoy it's amenities (art, food, architecture, ambience). As Pittsburghers know, Monday can be a desert when it comes to finding a nice place to eat. Thankfully, the Whitfield is open on Mondays. Brunch is served seven days a week. Staff is charming and competent.
So far, so good! Good drink selection. Great breakfast. Super nice service. Great, relaxed atmosphere. Keep it up!
The Ace is beautiful! Wonderfully restored old building, adorable rooms and great food & coffee! What more could we ask for?

It was 43 degrees when we descended upon the Container Park- luckily, there was a whiskey tasting on the agenda, which helped warm us up and educate us at the same time! Friendly staff welcomed us and hooked us up with food and drinks, the nameless cranberry-gin-rosemary-St. Germain concoction being my favorite. The beef carpaccio was almost too beautifully plated to eat, but it disappeared across the table in record time. I'm definitely planning to swing by again for brunch or happy hour.

The whiskey portion of the event allowed attendees to hear the history and differences between whiskey, bourbon, and scotch. It was cool to progressively challenge our palates with spicier sips (Bullet) and then return to the original (Buffalo Trace), finding it sweeter and more pleasingly aromatic. Tater was a knowledgeable teacher, and great about putting alcohol terminology into basic terms and making comparisons we could understand. I am only bummed that we were unable to meet in the Oak & Ivy proper, which remains a dark mystery- but the relocation was necessitated by the cold, and much appreciated by the desert rats.

But we all know the people are what make the event! From Tater to Chef Marvin, the various bartenders and serving staff, and our own Nate M., everyone involved with event organization was pleasant and personable. Yelpers present included a mix of familiar faces (Lisa, Niyen, Mr & Mrs Q), some new Elites (Kevin!),  a new Vegas transplant (Sarah S!), and even a Canadian Elite popping in while on vacation. Many thanks to all for making it warm and cozy in our shipping container cafe despite the winter weather!

This Yee marked the last for 2015, and went really well.

It was nice and small which makes for a good social intimate setting between the two table set ups (one for whisky tasting, one for small dishes). I feel that I got to talk and meet a lot more of the other elites at this event because of it which was really nice.

The whisky tasting was pretty interesting, it was really refreshing to get a bit of a crash course education on what we were drinking. I'm glad I got to walk away learning something new although I'm not much of a whisky connoisseur myself.

The drinks: 
Corn derived whisky (had a more sweet aroma) I tried to sip but it had a little bit of a harshness going down, and this was the lighter of the 3.

Corn and Rye whisky (had a bit of a pepper corn taste)

Rye whisky (this had more of a potent strong pepper or as I would describe fire taste to me haha)

The food:
Ny beef carpaccio- my favorite dish! It usually brings out the true Italian side of me. The pepper corn was a little strong in the dish, and I wasn't too much into the balsamic glaze, but it was still really good. Probably the best dish of the night in my opinion.

Spicy shrimp pasta- I liked the shrimp in this dish but I sort of wish the cream sauce was a little bit more bold on the flavors. The cherry tomatoes in it were good though and I liked the slight heat from the sriracha in the sauce.

Thanks again Nate and everyone for organizing a really fun and chill event! It was awesome getting to be around the Yelp family again.

My first YEE was awesome!  I love how intimate of a setting we were in with two groups of about 12 each it really gave the opportunity to get to know others.  

First group was small plates and a few delicious drinks.  The first drink was amazing, probably my favorite thing all night!  It was a gin/fizz/egg white/rosemary cocktail - I know that doesn't sound like a great combo but it truly was tasty and refreshing.  The first course was a beef capraccio which consisted of arugula,  balsamic glaze and a raw meat - not my cup of tea but it wasn't bad.  The second dish was a spicy shrimp pasta - also not my cup of tea but i enjoyed it more than expected.  The dessert drink was a cinnamon eggnog concoction that was outstanding.  

Group two was more of an educational experience where we got to learn about whiskey and how it's made and the different types of whiskey as well as tasting a few.  This was something that I would have never pictured myself doing but it was fun.  

Afterwards I stopped by Oak & Ivy with a few others for drinks which was a perfect end to the the night.  

It was great to meet everyone,  looking forward to the next event!

Another great ending to the year.  Nathen busted out another awesome event.

So first, hats off to The Perch and Oak & Ivy.   It was colder than the dickens and they accommodated the groups nicely by actually having us indoors.  That was really helpful considering the Las Vegas Christmas winds.  brr...

Our group was set up with The Perch offerings first.   My pictures should speak for themselves, but there were two plates and two cocktails.   The beef carpaccio was delicious as was the shrimp pasta.   The cocktails were great... the first was a cranberry gin, which as a gin person I thought that it was a little light on the gin side, but very refreshing.  A good starter.  The other cocktail was an eggnog drink as a seasonal which is rumchatta, bourbon and heavy cream.  RIDICULOUS.   This is an off menu item, but wow.   Crazy good.  They need to think about adding that to the drink menu.

The whiskey tasting was interesting to say the least.  Having gone through wine tasting before, I was expecting to spit, but.... why when it was only a little bit?

We tasted Buffalo Trace, Redemption and Bulleit which went from bourbon to a rye based.   Very educational and the guys at Oak & Ivy really know their stuff.  Taught you how to try smell the different aromas and how they interacted.  Very fun.

In usual fashion, we did an after-party for YEE at Oak & Ivy.   Saw old friends, met some new, and all and all was a great way to close out the year!  2016 Yelp Elite here we come!

Ah, the last YEE of the year.  
A bittersweet evening!

I haven't been to many events this year, for lots of reasons, but this one was definitely a highlight, and a great way to close out the year!

I'd never been to the Container park, other than right out front before Alibi over the summer, so I was REALLY excited to try out The Perch and Oak & Ivy. We were supposed to switch locations with our groups, but since it was RIDICULOUSLY cold outside, we stayed inside the Toasty warm Perch, and just switched tables.  Way to look out for us guys!!

I was in the "diamonds" group, so I started with The Perch offerings first.  
We sampled a delightful gin cocktail:  Cranberry Juice, St. Germaine, Gin, and apparently a touch of egg white to make it nice and frothy, garnished with rosemary.  I'm not a gin drinker, but I could have had these all night!  Really tasty.  

After this drink, we tried the Beef Carpaccio, which was really beautifully plated:  Thinly sliced raw beef, with shaved parmigiano, and a balsamic glaze over micro arugula. 
I'm a big fan of Carpaccio anyway.  I didn't want to start eating it at first, because it was too pretty.  I'm glad I dove in though, because it was really delicious.  

Next, we tried the Spicy Shrimp Pasta (which I think I mislabled on Instagram last night.  OOOPS!  I'll have to fix that.)  Shrimp cooked to perfection, served with an aldente pasta and cherry tomatoes in a Sriracha cream sauce: THIS was delightful.  I'd go back just for this dish.  In fact, I can't wait to take my husband to The Perch to try out the regular sized portion!!!

After the delicious food, we were given another cocktail:  An Eggnog Boilermaker type drink...I was a little wary about this one, but after having one...I'll take a dozen!
Basically, this was Rumchata (YUM) and heavy cream with an eggshell in the drink with a shot of bourbon inside the eggshell.  You pushed the egg down into the drink to mix, and then had the option to either sip or "chug" through the straw.  I, of course, chugged.  What a tasty little drink!  I'd definitely enjoy another one of these, any day of the week.  

After The Perch's offerings, we switched tables for the pièce de résistance:  The Whiskey tasting.  
I love me some good whiskey. Although I'm more of a fan of Scottish Whiskey (Scotch), I do enjoy a good American Whiskey from time to time, and its been a long while since I've had a good one.  
Chris, or Tater, from Oak & Ivy, really knows his stuff. He gave us a rundown of what makes Whiskey Whiskey, and the differences between bourbon and rye.  He showed us the proper way to sip (and "the chew" which I was familiar with from my Scotch drinking)...My favorite was the super spicy rye.  

All in all, it was a great night. 
There was a good mix of old faces, and new.  I loved having the chance to chat with so many great people.

Thanks to The Perch, Oak & Ivy, and Nate for a stellar end to 2015.  *raises glass of Rye* May next year bring even more adventures!!!

This was a nice, low key event to close out the year. It succeeded in getting me back to Downtown Container Park--somewhere I hadn't visited in a very long time. It also succeeded in introducing me to a couple of neat businesses I never knew existed.

I use the term "neat" not by coincidence. I enjoyed sampling the three whiskeys in official neat tasting glasses. The exaggerated tulip shape of the glass is perfect for enhancing the aromas of the whiskey while suppressing the alcohol burn. It definitely allowed me to appreciate the bouquet, to borrow a wine term, but I'm not sure the shape is ideal for actual drinking. (That doesn't mean I'm not buying a couple stat).

In any case, the head-bartender-mixologist-whiskey-aficionado dude (forgot his name) was a fantastic guide. His passion for American whiskey was evident and I am definitely coming back soon to check out Oak & Ivy. Due to the cold weather, the entirety of the event actually took place inside The Perch and that was our group's second "stop." By the way, apologies to the other group that we ate all of the JinJu Chocolates. We had no idea there weren't more. In case you were wondering though, they were delicious.

Even though The Perch only served a couple of small dishes (Beef Carpaccio and Shrimp Scampi), I was completely satisfied. Along with the two unnamed cocktails to go along with the food, it was a tasty preview of what they have to offer.

Thanks to Nate for a fun event to close out the 2015 Elite calendar. Thanks to Oak & Ivy, The Perch, and JinJu Chocolates for the hospitality.

With very cold temps this evening, I was a bit nervous at first to head outside to Container Park for this event but Yelp came through!

We all met at Perch and were able to partake in the planned arrangements indoors thankfully!

The bartender from Oak and Ivy greeted us at the first table to go over our Whiskey/Bourbon tasting we had planned! I enjoyed learning all about the various types of whiskey and how and why each had a different taste - I hadn't thought about the chemical makeup of the alcohol because I stray from hard liquor but learning helped a ton! Chris was very knowledgeable and good at teaching us! The pairings with dark chocolates from JinJu were perfect! They added a sweet kick in between tastings and brought out the flavors even more! 

At the Perch offerings table, I was floored by the tender love and care taken with the rosemary and cranberry mixed drink, beef carpaccio, shrimp pasta, and 'egg nog bomb' we were able to try! The head chef came to the table to talk about the offerings and the staff was very welcoming to have us in their restaurant! 

I've Loved Oak and Ivy since before this visit so we'll definitely be back there, but I was happy to try Perch so that we can make it back to sample more of their menu especially brunch!

Thank you Nate and the Yelp crew for our last event of 2015 - Cheers to what 2016 will bring us in the Vegas Valley with Yelp!

Event went on without a hitch, but thank Yelp we were inside the whole time! It was really cold and a little too breezy outside and part of the event was meant to be on the rooftop of Oak and Ivy but thankfully Nate kept us in the warmth of Perch. Both our Oak and Ivy rep Chris and the servers at Perch did a fantastic job keeping us busy tasting whiskey, food, and cocktails.

Now I'm not a whiskey lover or anything so I can't really judge the whiskeys but I tried my best to really savor the experience - that being said, the surprise chocolates from Jinju really saved my taste buds as personally I just found the alcohol so strong and bitter even though I was trying a corn heavy whiskey. Still, I learned more than I ever had about how to enjoy and taste whiskey/scotch/bourbon than I ever have before so now I'll know for when I try it elsewhere.

As for the food, I enjoyed the carpaccio but I did feel like there was a bit too much balsamic on it which covered up the taste of the beef. The shrimp pasta was also reasonably tasty but lacked salt on a significant level. Whether or not this is because of a bit of mass production or not, I still enjoyed the flavors they were trying to put forth. As for the cocktails, I thought both were excellent and very enjoyable with uniqueness in both of them.

We got a bit of yelp swag, including a cool little set of finger-less gloves, one of the few articles I still hadn't received up to that point.

Thanks to Nate, as he did a great job organizing this event as juggling between two different tables was easier than expected. I got to catch up a bit with other Yelpers and a number of us jumped over to Oak and Ivy after and got to see some apple get torched in a drink.

Oh, it's 40 some odd degrees outside? Oh, this event is outside? Hey hunnie, should we even go? Well, I guess we can go to see how it's like. If it's too cold, we can just leave. 

When we braved the winds, the cold, and got to Container Park -- it was breathtaking .. for all that walking we did to get there or, you know, it was pretty. Container Park was decorated with Christmas lights and it was wonderful to walk through and see it all. We went straight to the Perch and to our surprise, the whole event was moved indoors. That was music to my ears! 

Our first table was the whiskey table where we got to try three different types of American whiskey, learn about them, the differences, and then stuffed our faces with some chocolates from Jinju. Now, I'm not a whiskey drinker so I can't say that I LOVED it a lot but I do appreciate learning about them, which is why I wanted to come in the first place. We got to try a sweet, spicy, and bitter whiskey. The chocolates from Jinju was definitely our saving grace from the bitterness we taste from the whiskey.

Then afterwards, we got to switch tables! Swappity swap! We got to experience the food table! Here, we got to try two drinks and two dishes from the Perch. We had a cranberry-gin-rosemary concoction as our first drink and it was light and refreshing compared to the whiskey. We got to try their beef carpaccio, which was very nice. I liked the arugula and the balsamic but the balsamic was a little on the heavy side -- it made it hard to be able to taste the beef for what it is. The second drink we got to try was a bourbon eggnog. It was very yummy but a little too strong for my taste buds and it was the first time I had any form of eggnog! The second dish we got to try was their spicy shrimp pasta. The pasta was well put together but the seasoning is a little off. It was almost bland to my taste buds. 

We got treated to some Yelp swag! Fingerless gloves and a candy cane for the holidays! The gloves are perfect for winter and with it being fingerless, you can still text on your phone HAHA!
